column1: 7516,c-6,Field Digital Skills: Micro-courses via WhatsApp for farmers,1/6/25,1/6/25,3,,275,MKD,2,ardita.zekiri@undp.org,North Macedonia,"This platfrom is developed by the CGIAR Digital Innovation Initiative, offers micro - courses to farmers via WhatsApp. It capitalizes on the growing smartphone penetration, especially in regions like sub - Saharan Africa. Unlike conventional e - learning platforms, it addresses the challenges of self - regulated learning for farmers. Through a meticulous process involving learner profiling, goal setting, and iterative design, it crafts bite - sized micro - courses. These are bundled into learning routes; currently, ""Field Digital Skills, Level 1"" is available, comprising four courses on smartphone learning essentials.

Farmers can enroll by registering their mobile numbers on the CO - LAB Learning Network. All instructional videos are conveniently hosted on a YouTube playlist, ensuring easy access for learners seeking to enhance their digital skills and improve farming practices through this innovative, mobile - first learning solution.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/45e18bc3-8805-45e1-8c54-b356bcee4912/f7344307-c0c8-410f-9be3-fb6c90c800b0.png,"Field Digital Skills: Micro-courses via WhatsApp for farmers

column5: This platfrom is developed by the CGIAR Digital Innovation Initiative, offers micro - courses to farmers via WhatsApp. It capitalizes on the growing smartphone penetration, especially in regions like sub - Saharan Africa. Unlike conventional e - learning platforms, it addresses the challenges of self - regulated learning for farmers. Through a meticulous process involving learner profiling, goal setting, and iterative design, it crafts bite - sized micro - courses. These are bundled into learning routes; currently, ""Field Digital Skills, Level 1"" is available, comprising four courses on smartphone learning essentials.

column1: Farmers can enroll by registering their mobile numbers on the CO - LAB Learning Network. All instructional videos are conveniently hosted on a YouTube playlist, ensuring easy access for learners seeking to enhance their digital skills and improve farming practices through this innovative, mobile - first learning solution.

column5: training and learning

column1: 7513,c-6,Agri-CaB,1/6/25,1/6/25,3,,275,MKD,2,ardita.zekiri@undp.org,North Macedonia,"Agriculture and Food Security Capacity Building Programme. The Programme is expected to enhance the capacities of the relevant national institutions in the OIC Member States in a wide range of areas such as efficient techniques of land, water and livestock management, fisheries and aquaculture and food security. In addition, it serves as a platform where best practices and experiences can be shared and exchanged.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/45e18bc3-8805-45e1-8c54-b356bcee4912/4069a559-1b84-4f01-94a8-d58622911c87.png,"Agri-CaB

column5: Agriculture and Food Security Capacity Building Programme. The Programme is expected to enhance the capacities of the relevant national institutions in the OIC Member States in a wide range of areas such as efficient techniques of land, water and livestock management, fisheries and aquaculture and food security. In addition, it serves as a platform where best practices and experiences can be shared and exchanged.

7511,c-6,Empowering smallholder farmers,1/6/25,1/6/25,3,,275,MKD,2,ardita.zekiri@undp.org,North Macedonia,Farrelly Mitchell believe in the transformative impact that smallholders and SMEs can have on the food supply chain and the wider agrifood industry.  Their consultants have extensive experience nurturing the growth and development of smallholder farmers and SMEs. They work alongside governments, NGOs, and private investors to introduce modern technologies, promote sustainable practices, and connect small-scale businesses with global markets.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/45e18bc3-8805-45e1-8c54-b356bcee4912/77d9d720-98fe-48ac-82b8-8709157bd8fb.png,"Empowering smallholder farmers

Farrelly Mitchell believe in the transformative impact that smallholders and SMEs can have on the food supply chain and the wider agrifood industry.  Their consultants have extensive experience nurturing the growth and development of smallholder farmers and SMEs. They work alongside governments, NGOs, and private investors to introduce modern technologies, promote sustainable practices, and connect small-scale businesses with global markets.

7468,c-6,The Connected Farmer Alliance (CFA),1/6/25,1/6/25,3,,275,MKD,2,ardita.zekiri@undp.org,North Macedonia,The Connected Farmer Alliance (CFA) is a partnership between USAID, Vodafone, and TechnoServe to improve the lives of smallholder farmers in Kenya, Tanzania, and Mozambique. By using mobile technology, the CFA aims to connect farmers to markets, financial services, and agricultural information. This will help farmers increase their productivity, incomes, and resilience to challenges like climate change. The CFA is currently working with 30,000 farmers and multiple agribusinesses to achieve these goals.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/45e18bc3-8805-45e1-8c54-b356bcee4912/442ddefc-f327-4bdf-88df-a5b1ee29a05f.png,"The Connected Farmer Alliance (CFA)

The Connected Farmer Alliance (CFA) is a partnership between USAID, Vodafone, and TechnoServe to improve the lives of smallholder farmers in Kenya, Tanzania, and Mozambique. By using mobile technology, the CFA aims to connect farmers to markets, financial services, and agricultural information. This will help farmers increase their productivity, incomes, and resilience to challenges like climate change. The CFA is currently working with 30,000 farmers and multiple agribusinesses to achieve these goals.

7461,c-6,AgriFin Accelerate,1/6/25,1/6/25,3,,275,MKD,2,ardita.zekiri@undp.org,North Macedonia,AgriFin Accelerate is a US$25 million, six-year initiative funded by the Mastercard Foundation. It aims to help smallholder farmers in Kenya, Tanzania, and Zambia access financial and information services. The program works with farmers and various stakeholders to identify barriers to access and develop solutions to overcome them. It utilizes technology and mobile banking to improve farmers' access to financial products and services, ultimately increasing their productivity and income.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/45e18bc3-8805-45e1-8c54-b356bcee4912/b7008551-f441-4c52-a944-03968f689055.png,"AgriFin Accelerate

AgriFin Accelerate is a US$25 million, six-year initiative funded by the Mastercard Foundation. It aims to help smallholder farmers in Kenya, Tanzania, and Zambia access financial and information services. The program works with farmers and various stakeholders to identify barriers to access and develop solutions to overcome them. It utilizes technology and mobile banking to improve farmers' access to financial products and services, ultimately increasing their productivity and income.

7460,c-6,Esoko,1/6/25,1/6/25,3,,275,MKD,2,ardita.zekiri@undp.org,North Macedonia,Esoko is an agricultural technology company thta provides tools and services to hep smallholder farmers connect to markets and access information. It provides up-to-date information on market prices for crops, and also gives access to accurate weather forecasts to help farmers plan their harvesting nd planting schedules. Esoko also provides expert advice on best practices for farming, including crop management, pest control and soil health. Through Esoko, farmers can receive important updates and alerts via SMS, voice messages or interactive voice response (IVR) systems.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/45e18bc3-8805-45e1-8c54-b356bcee4912/1f90be8a-1167-4b6a-9a09-99ae136c8ffb.png,"Esoko

Esoko is an agricultural technology company thta provides tools and services to hep smallholder farmers connect to markets and access information. It provides up-to-date information on market prices for crops, and also gives access to accurate weather forecasts to help farmers plan their harvesting nd planting schedules. Esoko also provides expert advice on best practices for farming, including crop management, pest control and soil health. Through Esoko, farmers can receive important updates and alerts via SMS, voice messages or interactive voice response (IVR) systems.

7450,c-6,Global Partners Benin,1/6/25,1/6/25,3,,275,MKD,2,ardita.zekiri@undp.org,North Macedonia,Project that implements drones for improving rice and pineapple productivity in Benin. First, the first category of drones used are smart spraying drones to dispense pesticides more effectively and safely. Second, the project also equipped extension workers with drones generated data that deliver innovative, location specific and real time advice to farmers.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/45e18bc3-8805-45e1-8c54-b356bcee4912/075dbd51-ead2-4aaa-9c22-9948bcbcb6d9.png,"Global Partners Benin

Project that implements drones for improving rice and pineapple productivity in Benin. First, the first category of drones used are smart spraying drones to dispense pesticides more effectively and safely. Second, the project also equipped extension workers with drones generated data that deliver innovative, location specific and real time advice to farmers.

column1: Global Partners is a Benin based start-up specialised in developing and providing drone solutions for agriculture, land use planning, surveillance, and biodiversity conservation. The implementation time is 5 years and above as there has been several trial periods since 2017., I could not find the name of the project so I called it by the organisation's name + country

column1: 7435,c-6,The Open Forum on Agricultural Techonology in Africa (OFAB),1/6/25,1/6/25,3,,275,MKD,2,ardita.zekiri@undp.org,North Macedonia,"The Open Forum on Agricultural Biotechnology in Africa (OFAB) is a project that aims to increase understanding of agricultural biotechnology in Africa. It does this by facilitating conversations between policymakers, scientists, and the public. OFAB provides accurate information and promotes the benefits of modern biotechnology, such as increased crop yields and resistance to pests and diseases. By engaging with key stakeholders, OFAB helps to inform policy decisions and advance the use of biotechnology in African agriculture. It also includes the establishment and management of a range of platforms to enhance understanding of biotechnology in agriculture for productivity.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/45e18bc3-8805-45e1-8c54-b356bcee4912/4a13a0f7-7b4c-4835-8e0b-d543e5ebb46c.png,"The Open Forum on Agricultural Techonology in Africa (OFAB)

column5: The Open Forum on Agricultural Biotechnology in Africa (OFAB) is a project that aims to increase understanding of agricultural biotechnology in Africa. It does this by facilitating conversations between policymakers, scientists, and the public. OFAB provides accurate information and promotes the benefits of modern biotechnology, such as increased crop yields and resistance to pests and diseases. By engaging with key stakeholders, OFAB helps to inform policy decisions and advance the use of biotechnology in African agriculture. It also includes the establishment and management of a range of platforms to enhance understanding of biotechnology in agriculture for productivity.
decision_support

column1: 7434,c-6,TAAT Maize Compact,1/6/25,1/6/25,3,,275,MKD,2,ardita.zekiri@undp.org,North Macedonia,"The AATF-led TAAT Maize Compact is spreading climate-resilient maize technologies, including Water Efficient Maize Varieties (WEMA), to 14 African countries. This collaboration between public and private sectors involves seed companies, farmer organizations, commodity associations, and national agricultural research institutions.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/45e18bc3-8805-45e1-8c54-b356bcee4912/9d31d484-4af8-4ec3-abc9-d1fb58f2eaba.png,"TAAT Maize Compact

column5: The AATF-led TAAT Maize Compact is spreading climate-resilient maize technologies, including Water Efficient Maize Varieties (WEMA), to 14 African countries. This collaboration between public and private sectors involves seed companies, farmer organizations, commodity associations, and national agricultural research institutions.

column1: Initiative led by private-public partnership. The initiative is being applied to 14 different Sub-Saharan countries, but only 3 have published relevant results so far.

7430,c-6,PEWS,1/6/25,1/6/25,3,,275,MKD,2,ardita.zekiri@undp.org,North Macedonia,The PEWS pastoral surveillance and early warning system has been developed by the NGO Action Contre la Faim in the Sahel region where pastoralism and pastoral mobility are one of the keys to environmental and economic resilience. The approach aims to monitor pastoral resources based on satellite images complemented by field data collection and combines two concepts: early warning and surveillance. Early warning is based on the evaluation of biomass production during the rainy season, allowing the anticipation of the stock of pasture that will be available during the next dry season. Surveillance is done through real-time monitoring of green and dry vegetation by remote sensing and a network of field agents, who provide information on the pastoral situation at the local scale several times a month. The project uses phone apps such as 'Pastonavigator' or mapping systems such as MODIS (Moderate-Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer).",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/45e18bc3-8805-45e1-8c54-b356bcee4912/2d776503-586c-46e9-8ef6-913682bb02da.png,"PEWS

The PEWS pastoral surveillance and early warning system has been developed by the NGO Action Contre la Faim in the Sahel region where pastoralism and pastoral mobility are one of the keys to environmental and economic resilience. The approach aims to monitor pastoral resources based on satellite images complemented by field data collection and combines two concepts: early warning and surveillance. Early warning is based on the evaluation of biomass production during the rainy season, allowing the anticipation of the stock of pasture that will be available during the next dry season. Surveillance is done through real-time monitoring of green and dry vegetation by remote sensing and a network of field agents, who provide information on the pastoral situation at the local scale several times a month. The project uses phone apps such as 'Pastonavigator' or mapping systems such as MODIS (Moderate-Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer).

7427,c-6,The NextGen Agroadvisory,1/6/25,1/6/25,3,,275,MKD,2,ardita.zekiri@undp.org,North Macedonia,The NextGen Agroadvisory is a location-specific, tailored, and season-smart agricultural decision support tool (DST) designed to help farmers make informed decisions about fertilizer application, planting timelines, and other agricultural practices. The tool uses machine learning algorithms to analyze crop responses to different fertilizer inputs and spatial co-variants, providing recommendations tailored to specific locations and growing conditions.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/45e18bc3-8805-45e1-8c54-b356bcee4912/e54aeaa5-849e-4de6-a39f-33ea10e6d217.png,"The NextGen Agroadvisory

The NextGen Agroadvisory is a location-specific, tailored, and season-smart agricultural decision support tool (DST) designed to help farmers make informed decisions about fertilizer application, planting timelines, and other agricultural practices. The tool uses machine learning algorithms to analyze crop responses to different fertilizer inputs and spatial co-variants, providing recommendations tailored to specific locations and growing conditions.
decision_support

column1: 7418,c-6,Hi Saai: Artificial Intelligence Platform for Family Farmers,1/6/25,1/6/25,3,,275,MKD,2,ardita.zekiri@undp.org,North Macedonia,"Hi Saii is a platform designed to help farmers by providing instant answers to their questions via WhatsApp. The platform uses a vast amount of data to provide comprehensive advice on various farming topics, including business planning, financial management, crop production, and more. Saai aims to make this technology accessible to farmers worldwide, particularly in developing countries. While the platform is still in its development phase, it has already proven to be a valuable tool for farmers.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/45e18bc3-8805-45e1-8c54-b356bcee4912/3ed0ce16-f8c7-4860-8deb-91a544c3e9ea.png,"Hi Saai: Artificial Intelligence Platform for Family Farmers

column5: Hi Saii is a platform designed to help farmers by providing instant answers to their questions via WhatsApp. The platform uses a vast amount of data to provide comprehensive advice on various farming topics, including business planning, financial management, crop production, and more. Saai aims to make this technology accessible to farmers worldwide, particularly in developing countries. While the platform is still in its development phase, it has already proven to be a valuable tool for farmers.
data_driven_equipment

column1: 7399,c-6,MazaoPlus+,1/6/25,1/6/25,3,,275,MKD,2,ardita.zekiri@undp.org,North Macedonia,"MazaoPlus+, an innovative data platform created to collect and share fertilizer supply and demand data (e.g., fertilizer price, fertilizer type, etc.) among smallholder farmers and fertilizer vendors with the aim of improving market inefficiencies. Using a USSD code, farmers get information on fertilizer vendors closest to them, who are selling the type of fertilizer that they are looking for. In addition, farmers get to know different fertilizer prices either per 50kg bag or per unit kilogram.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/45e18bc3-8805-45e1-8c54-b356bcee4912/9494ab03-e3ab-4a86-b40b-b29ef3b77f7b.png,"MazaoPlus+

column5: MazaoPlus+, an innovative data platform created to collect and share fertilizer supply and demand data (e.g., fertilizer price, fertilizer type, etc.) among smallholder farmers and fertilizer vendors with the aim of improving market inefficiencies. Using a USSD code, farmers get information on fertilizer vendors closest to them, who are selling the type of fertilizer that they are looking for. In addition, farmers get to know different fertilizer prices either per 50kg bag or per unit kilogram.

7398,c-6,FarmGrow,1/6/25,1/6/25,3,,275,MKD,2,ardita.zekiri@undp.org,North Macedonia,The FarmGrow app is used to record soil properties (i.e., soil physical condition, organic matter condition, pH, and drainage) and related soil management observations (i.e. fertilizer application and formulation) from the top 30 cm of the soil at each farm site. The aim is to provide site-specific soil information that smallholder cocoa farmers can use to improve soil health and overall farm productivity.",,"FarmGrow

The FarmGrow app is used to record soil properties (i.e., soil physical condition, organic matter condition, pH, and drainage) and related soil management observations (i.e. fertilizer application and formulation) from the top 30 cm of the soil at each farm site. The aim is to provide site-specific soil information that smallholder cocoa farmers can use to improve soil health and overall farm productivity.

column1: 7397,c-6,Digital farm,1/6/25,1/6/25,3,,275,MKD,2,ardita.zekiri@undp.org,North Macedonia,"On-farm NEXO weather stations: provide real-time data information that is integrated into the FarmDirect App to analyse data (temperature, humidity, light intensity and soil temperature data).

Farmdirect app (logbooks) and dynamic data dashboard: enables smallholders to visualise and track the profit and loss across multiple on-farm enterprises, to access a portal with information and data (eg: from weather stations or other external data-sets).",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/45e18bc3-8805-45e1-8c54-b356bcee4912/6edb14fa-493a-4d6a-bbea-ab7ede1a0979.png,"Digital farm

column5: On-farm NEXO weather stations: provide real-time data information that is integrated into the FarmDirect App to analyse data (temperature, humidity, light intensity and soil temperature data).

column1: Farmdirect app (logbooks) and dynamic data dashboard: enables smallholders to visualise and track the profit and loss across multiple on-farm enterprises, to access a portal with information and data (eg: from weather stations or other external data-sets).

This project was submitted  by Producers Direct in response to the 2017 call for proposals by the World Bank‚Äôs Development Data Group (DECDG) and the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development Data (GPSDD), is supported by various foreign governments.

column5: data_driven_equipment

column1: 7336,c-22,Redvers E-mobility: Converts Fuel Motor Bikes to Electric,11/14/24,11/14/24,3,,,UGA,2,hadijah.nabbale@undp.org,Uganda,"From fuel Boda Boda to E-Moto: Boda bodas are a lifeline for tens of millions of Ugandans, providing affordable and accessible transportation. However, at the same time, they also contribute significantly to air and noise pollution and operate within a challenging market environment where drivers struggle with high fuel costs and thus limited income. Redvers saw an opportunity to address these issues while simultaneously creating positive social and environmental impact. Our Solution. Electric motorcycles (e-motos) are offered through a unique lease-to-own model and a network of convenient battery-swapping stations. These converted e-motos are not only cost-effective and environmentally friendly but also rugged enough to handle Uganda's demanding roads. Drivers can lease these motorcycles with an affordable daily fee and complimentary maintenance, significantly boosting their income while transitioning to clean energy.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/eb495499-2399-4933-a25e-0d6cf611ab3d/a65ac7194446bc81262338fa797559ae.png,"Redvers E-mobility: Converts Fuel Motor Bikes to Electric

From fuel Boda Boda to E-Moto: Boda bodas are a lifeline for tens of millions of Ugandans, providing affordable and accessible transportation. However, at the same time, they also contribute significantly to air and noise pollution and operate within a challenging market environment where drivers struggle with high fuel costs and thus limited income. Redvers saw an opportunity to address these issues while simultaneously creating positive social and environmental impact. Our Solution. Electric motorcycles (e-motos) are offered through a unique lease-to-own model and a network of convenient battery-swapping stations. These converted e-motos are not only cost-effective and environmentally friendly but also rugged enough to handle Uganda's demanding roads. Drivers can lease these motorcycles with an affordable daily fee and complimentary maintenance, significantly boosting their income while transitioning to clean energy.

7334,c-22,Maisha: Malaria Drug from Indigenous herbs,11/14/24,11/14/24,3,,,UGA,2,hadijah.nabbale@undp.org,Uganda,"Joel Felix Ochom a third-year pharmacy student at Makerere University, narrowly survived becoming a malaria-death statistic at the age of 14. This experience sparked his passion to finding a permanent cure for the malaria disease. After joining Makerere University to pursue a Bachelor of Pharmacy, Joel convinced his friends, Valentine Muhoozi, Jimmy Kabuna, Robert Zziwa and Rita Ainembabazi formed a team to research on the different options of drugs for treating malaria.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/eb495499-2399-4933-a25e-0d6cf611ab3d/855a1e7a2a8b8fe0cf9ce0b4cdf5ae2b.png,"Maisha: Malaria Drug from Indigenous herbs
A group of Students innovate a malaria syrup

Joel Felix Ochom a third-year pharmacy student at Makerere University, narrowly survived becoming a malaria-death statistic at the age of 14. This experience sparked his passion to finding a permanent cure for the malaria disease. After joining Makerere University to pursue a Bachelor of Pharmacy, Joel convinced his friends, Valentine Muhoozi, Jimmy Kabuna, Robert Zziwa and Rita Ainembabazi formed a team to research on the different options of drugs for treating malaria.

7294,c-6,BreatheLife,7/26/24,10/31/24,3,,262,MKD,2,ardita.zekiri@undp.org,North Macedonia,"The project combines public health and climate change expertise with guidance on implementing solutions to air pollution in support of global development goals.

It provides a platform for cities to share best practices, works with municipalities to expand monitoring efforts that can keep citizens informed and facilitate more sustainable urban development, builds demand for new solutions that are working and support municipalities in effectively implementing them in their own cities, and educates people about the burden air pollution poses to our health and our climate and provide meaningful ways to take action both locally and globally",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/45e18bc3-8805-45e1-8c54-b356bcee4912/066f493a-0943-4a05-a3eb-62731fba26f7.png,"BreatheLife
The project combines public health and climate change expertise with guidance on implementing solutions to air pollution in support of global development goals.

It provides a platform for cities to share best practices, works with municipalities to expand monitoring efforts that can keep citizens informed and facilitate more sustainable urban development, builds demand for new solutions that are working and support municipalities in effectively implementing them in their own cities, and educates people about the burden air pollution poses to our health and our climate and provide meaningful ways to take action both locally and globally
Improve air quality, enhance public health
1. active measures (direct measures for reduction of air pollution)
The growing network includes 79 cities, regions, and countries; reaching 492 million citizens.

7283,c-6,Hire-purchase Solar Panels,7/26/24,10/31/24,3,,262,MKD,2,ardita.zekiri@undp.org,North Macedonia,"The hire-purchase business model for solar panels aims to provide households with off-grid access to affordable clean energy through solar panels. SolarNow is a solar company based in Uganda that previously sold, installed, and serviced high-quality modular solar home systems on a hire-purchase basis to mostly rural households and businesses. Customers were offered an affordable 12-month plan that typically involved a deposit on the system followed by 12 monthly installments, after which they own the system. SolarNow has now evolved into an energy solution provider supporting businesses as well as institutions in the Education, Healthcare, and Non-profit sectors.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/45e18bc3-8805-45e1-8c54-b356bcee4912/245060dd-8324-4506-b7c6-a13d9a883677.png,"Hire-purchase Solar Panels

column5: Innovative business model

column1: The hire-purchase business model for solar panels aims to provide households with off-grid access to affordable clean energy through solar panels. SolarNow is a solar company based in Uganda that previously sold, installed, and serviced high-quality modular solar home systems on a hire-purchase basis to mostly rural households and businesses. Customers were offered an affordable 12-month plan that typically involved a deposit on the system followed by 12 monthly installments, after which they own the system. SolarNow has now evolved into an energy solution provider supporting businesses as well as institutions in the Education, Healthcare, and Non-profit sectors.
Consult this study for a case study and further details of SolarNow's business model https://cleancooking.org/wp-content/uploads/2021/07/421-1.pdf

On finance: The hire-purchase business model allowed more people to afford solar plants. Customers were offered an affordable 12-month plan that typically involved a deposit on the system followed by 12 monthly installments, after which they own the system.

7281,c-6,Pay-As-You-Go Solar,7/26/24,10/31/24,3,,262,MKD,2,ardita.zekiri@undp.org,North Macedonia,Large upfront costs often deter clean energy use.  The Pay-As-You-Go (PAYG) approach to solar energy removes the upfront price barrier by allowing end users to pay in affordable amounts over time. A company essentially rents consumers a solar home system. Basic systems have enough power to charge phones and lights, and larger ones can power small appliances like radios or TVs. PAYG schemes use smart meters installed in households to monitor energy use and enable consumers to pay in smaller increments on a daily, weekly, or monthly basis using mobile banking platforms. Through this model,  access to energy in off-grid areas is improved, companies can minimize the cost of collections by automating the receipt of payments and remote rural customers get immediate access to basic electricity without having to take out a loan.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/45e18bc3-8805-45e1-8c54-b356bcee4912/3c3e7620-1ef2-4c32-86b9-2d4efae8289b.png,"Pay-As-You-Go Solar
Innovative business model

column1: Large upfront costs often deter clean energy use.  The Pay-As-You-Go (PAYG) approach to solar energy removes the upfront price barrier by allowing end users to pay in affordable amounts over time. A company essentially rents consumers a solar home system. Basic systems have enough power to charge phones and lights, and larger ones can power small appliances like radios or TVs. PAYG schemes use smart meters installed in households to monitor energy use and enable consumers to pay in smaller increments on a daily, weekly, or monthly basis using mobile banking platforms. Through this model,  access to energy in off-grid areas is improved, companies can minimize the cost of collections by automating the receipt of payments and remote rural customers get immediate access to basic electricity without having to take out a loan.
Improved public health, increased access to affordable elecricity
Pay-As-You-Go can also be applied to other renewable energy sources such as biomass.
On finance: The Pay-As-You-Go (PAYG) business model renting solar home systems or other solutions allows end users to pay affordable amounts over time.

7273,c-6,Health and Pollution Action Plan,7/26/24,10/31/24,3,,262,MKD,2,ardita.zekiri@undp.org,North Macedonia,The Global Alliance on Health and Pollution (GAHP) has supported 13 countries developing a Health and Pollution Action Plan (HPAP). The goal of each HPAP is to establish pollution as a policy priority and to define and advance concrete actions to reduce exposure to pollution and its related health impacts. GAHP works with national and regional governments by bringing together stakeholders in government, civil society, and the private sector to develop and implement the HPAPs. The HPAP process is flexible and tailored to the needs of each country, but generally includes five steps: Data Collection and Analysis, Setting health based priorities for action on pollution, Preparation of a draft Action Plan, Stakeholder consultation and Implementation.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/45e18bc3-8805-45e1-8c54-b356bcee4912/cbfd04a6-5047-4b7a-a363-259466647a07.png,"Health and Pollution Action Plan

column1: The Global Alliance on Health and Pollution (GAHP) has supported 13 countries developing a Health and Pollution Action Plan (HPAP). The goal of each HPAP is to establish pollution as a policy priority and to define and advance concrete actions to reduce exposure to pollution and its related health impacts. GAHP works with national and regional governments by bringing together stakeholders in government, civil society, and the private sector to develop and implement the HPAPs. The HPAP process is flexible and tailored to the needs of each country, but generally includes five steps: Data Collection and Analysis, Setting health based priorities for action on pollution, Preparation of a draft Action Plan, Stakeholder consultation and Implementation.
On finance: The projects implementing the HPAP are often ODA-funded
thematic_areas: Health and Pollution Action Plan

7265,c-6,Center for No-till Agriculture,7/26/24,10/31/24,3,,262,MKD,2,ardita.zekiri@undp.org,North Macedonia,"The Center for No-till Farming (CTNF) provides farmers with access to community, knowledge and technical advice on no-till farmning and conservation agriculture. Activities include field-level demonstrations, community-based training events and peer-to-peer communication to share experiences and provide resources. No-till farming is planting crops on farmland year after year without tilling the soil. In conservation agriculture, not burning residues means that after harvest, farmers leave all the residues on the field to decompose and serve as nutrients for the soil.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/45e18bc3-8805-45e1-8c54-b356bcee4912/97e064cf-bd72-44dc-9359-18edf11d8597.png,"Center for No-till Agriculture

The Center for No-till Farming (CTNF) provides farmers with access to community, knowledge and technical advice on no-till farmning and conservation agriculture. Activities include field-level demonstrations, community-based training events and peer-to-peer communication to share experiences and provide resources. No-till farming is planting crops on farmland year after year without tilling the soil. In conservation agriculture, not burning residues means that after harvest, farmers leave all the residues on the field to decompose and serve as nutrients for the soil.
Enhanced public health. Enhanced soil health.

7253,c-6,Clean Cookstove Project,7/26/24,10/31/24,3,,262,MKD,2,ardita.zekiri@undp.org,North Macedonia,"Project providing around 20,000 energy efficient and clean cookstoves for local communities. The clean cookstoves use less than half of the wood previously required, meaning that women and children have to spend less time collecting and chopping the wood, less money purchasing wood, and are breathing in smaller volumes of particulate matter.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/45e18bc3-8805-45e1-8c54-b356bcee4912/a38f8a26-a29a-461e-862c-28a2b41c6825.png,"Clean Cookstove Project

Project providing around 20,000 energy efficient and clean cookstoves for local communities. The clean cookstoves use less than half of the wood previously required, meaning that women and children have to spend less time collecting and chopping the wood, less money purchasing wood, and are breathing in smaller volumes of particulate matter.

Reduced deforestation in the local area. Better community health due to improved indoor air quality such as fewer respiratory illnesses such as asthma and coughs from smoke inhalation. Lowering atmospheric CO2 concentration and contributing to a decarbonised society. Local training to manufacture, distribute, install and maintain the cookstoves. Community education to understand the problems caused by deforestation
1. active measures (direct measures for reduction of air pollution)

7221,c-6,"Menged Le Sewe (""Streets for People"")–a car-free days initiative",7/26/24,10/31/24,3,,262,MKD,2,ardita.zekiri@undp.org,North Macedonia,"In Addis Ababa, the ""Menged Le Sewe"" initiative promotes sustainable urban mobility by organizing car-free days, encouraging activities like cycling and walking, and improving public spaces. This project involves local communities and government support to reshape urban transportation and enhance road safety and livability.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/45e18bc3-8805-45e1-8c54-b356bcee4912/1ca0e919-e7ec-44cd-9ffc-bc1747a87ac4.png,"Menged Le Sewe (""Streets for People"")–a car-free days initiative

In Addis Ababa, the ""Menged Le Sewe"" initiative promotes sustainable urban mobility by organizing car-free days, encouraging activities like cycling and walking, and improving public spaces. This project involves local communities and government support to reshape urban transportation and enhance road safety and livability.
Enhances community health, reduces environmental pollution, and fosters a more inclusive urban environment.
Following the example initiative of Raahgiri Day in India.
Although the project was further developed by the local government with received support from the national govenment, too, the initial idea was birthed by local communnity.

Following Addis Ababa's example, other African cities have implemented similar initiatives, including Cape Town (South Africa), Kigali (Rwanda), Kampala (Uganda), and Nairobi (Kenya), demonstrating a broader regional commitment to sustainable mobility and urban wellness.

This can significantly reduce greenhouse gas emissions, air pollutants, and other environmental impacts associated with industrial activities. However, the feasibility of fuel switching depends on several factors:

column1: Technical Compatibility: The new fuel must be compatible with existing industrial equipment and processes. Modifications might be necessary for some fuel switches.

Economic Considerations: The cost of the new fuel, potential infrastructure upgrades, and overall operational efficiency changes need to be assessed. Switching to a cleaner fuel should ideally be economically viable in the long term.

Fuel Availability: Reliable access to the new fuel source in sufficient quantities is crucial for successful implementation.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/45e18bc3-8805-45e1-8c54-b356bcee4912/e6e35e3c-3986-4cf6-a2c7-fc49bf11cea9.png,"Industrial Process Fuel Switching (considering technical and economic feasibility)

column5: Technology & Management Approach

column1: Industrial fuel switching involves replacing existing fossil fuels used in industrial processes with cleaner alternatives. This can significantly reduce greenhouse gas emissions, air pollutants, and other environmental impacts associated with industrial activities. However, the feasibility of fuel switching depends on several factors:
Technical Compatibility: The new fuel must be compatible with existing industrial equipment and processes. Modifications might be necessary for some fuel switches.

Economic Considerations: The cost of the new fuel, potential infrastructure upgrades, and overall operational efficiency changes need to be assessed. Switching to a cleaner fuel should ideally be economically viable in the long term.
Fuel Availability: Reliable access to the new fuel source in sufficient quantities is crucial for successful implementation.
Reduced greenhouse gas emissions and air pollution
Potential for job creation in clean energy sectors
Increased energy security and independence from fossil fuels (depending on the chosen alternative fuel)

Industries (making the switch), Governments (providing incentives, regulations), Technology Providers (developing new technologies) lead the solution. Industry and Energy are the affected sectors. Timescae of implementation Varies depending on the complexity of the switch and infrastructure needs. Can range from months to years for planning and implementation.

Successful fuel switching in industrial processes requires careful evaluation of technical and economic feasibility. Collaboration between industries, governments, and technology providers is crucial to overcome challenges and accelerate the adoption of cleaner fuels.

column1: 7191,c-6,Improved Cooking Stoves and Fuel Distribution Programs,7/26/24,10/31/24,3,,262,MKD,2,ardita.zekiri@undp.org,North Macedonia,"This solution promotes the transition from traditional cooking stoves (often burning biomass like firewood or charcoal) to improved cooking stoves and cleaner fuels. Improved cooking stoves offer several benefits: Increased efficiency, reducing fuel consumption and associated emissions; Reduced smoke and harmful pollutants released during cooking, improving indoor air quality and health; and Potential for using cleaner burning fuels like biogas or ethanol.

Effective programs often combine stove distribution with: Fuel availability: Ensuring access to cleaner fuels for the new stoves; Education and behavior change: Encouraging proper use and maintenance of the new stoves; and Financing mechanisms: Making improved stoves affordable for low-income households.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/45e18bc3-8805-45e1-8c54-b356bcee4912/5618bcd8-64e9-4ac0-b6a5-3396dc2fcabf.png,"Improved Cooking Stoves and Fuel Distribution Programs

column5: Technology & Management Approach (improved stoves), Infrastructure & Distribution (fuel access)

column1: This solution promotes the transition from traditional cooking stoves (often burning biomass like firewood or charcoal) to improved cooking stoves and cleaner fuels. Improved cooking stoves offer several benefits: Increased efficiency, reducing fuel consumption and associated emissions; Reduced smoke and harmful pollutants released during cooking, improving indoor air quality and health; and Potential for using cleaner burning fuels like biogas or ethanol.

Effective programs often combine stove distribution with: Fuel availability: Ensuring access to cleaner fuels for the new stoves; Education and behavior change: Encouraging proper use and maintenance of the new stoves; and Financing mechanisms: Making improved stoves affordable for low-income households.
Improved health outcomes from reduced indoor air pollution
Reduced fuel consumption and associated costs
Potential for job creation in stove production and fuel distribution
Empowerment of women who are often primarily responsible for cooking

partnerships. Multi-Stakeholder Approach (NGOs, Governments, Private Sector, Communities) lead the solution. Primarily targeting developing countries with large populations relying on traditional cooking methods. The affected sectors are: Energy, Health, Environment.

The effectiveness of cooking stove replacement programs depends on a holistic approach that addresses stove quality, fuel availability, user education, and affordability. Successful programs consider the specific needs and contexts of the target communities.

6863,c-31,Solarbox, the first solar vehicle manufactured in Senegal",12/22/23,12/22/23,2,,199,SEN,2,aminata.ba2@undp.org,Senegal,Solarbox is a completely new senegalese environmentally-friendly mobility solution designed and manufactured by the start-up bearing the same name. This innovation was born of the need to reduce environmental impact while meeting the mobility needs of the population. The solution shows that it is possible to design solar-powered vehicles from scratch.  ,https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/2b6f0ea5-a774-4f23-b5ae-23da7b3d6f53/74f66fd6977d1b7fd80ef34f52741858.png,"Solarbox, the first solar vehicle manufactured in Senegal

column1: Solarbox is a completely new senegalese environmentally-friendly mobility solution designed and manufactured by the start-up bearing the same name. This innovation was born of the need to reduce environmental impact while meeting the mobility needs of the population. The solution shows that it is possible to design solar-powered vehicles from scratch.

The solarbox consists of a container that takes the form of a fleet of electric vehicles powered exclusively by solar energy. It combines solar charging & container mobility. Each Solarbox powers 5 electric 3-wheelers & 2-wheelers. The choice of the 3-wheels is justified by the restrictions on the circulation of assembled standard cars in Senegal.

6862,c-31,"""Telewer"" Solution de télémédecine",12/20/23,9/23/24,3,,199,SEN,2,aminata.ba2@undp.org,Senegal,"Au Sénégal, l'accès à la santé est très limité dans la plupart des régions, notamment dans les zones frontales. A Sédhiou, Matam et Tambacounda, les distances entre un poste de santé et un hôpital de référence varient de 43 à 60 km. Aussi, si en Afrique l'accès à un personnel de santé est de 1 médecin pour 5000 habitants, au Sénégal, les chiffres sont 1 pour 14000 habitants.

Avec sa solution ""TeleWer"" Senvital propose des services de télémédecine par le biais d'une plateforme numérique réunissant les professionnels de la santé avec ces populations déshéritées.et des personnes ayant un accès limité aux infrastructures de santé. ",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/2b6f0ea5-a774-4f23-b5ae-23da7b3d6f53/031bcf91aee91bd766f2acc9214ec452.png,"""Telewer"" Solution de télémédecine

Au Sénégal, l'accès à la santé est très limité dans la plupart des régions, notamment dans les zones frontales. A Sédhiou, Matam et Tambacounda, les distances entre un poste de santé et un hôpital de référence varient de 43 à 60 km. Aussi, si en Afrique l'accès à un personnel de santé est de 1 médecin pour 5000 habitants, au Sénégal, les chiffres sont 1 pour 14000 habitants.

Avec sa solution ""TeleWer"" Senvital propose des services de télémédecine par le biais d'une plateforme numérique réunissant les professionnels de la santé avec ces populations déshéritées.et des personnes ayant un accès limité aux infrastructures de santé.

La solution consiste en une valise connectée 5G intégrant les équipements de diagnostic (prise de température, la pression artérielle, électrocardiogramme, contrôle du niveau de glycémie, examen de la peau etc.) tandis qu'un médecin interprète directement les résultats et prescrit l' ordonnance au patient. Par la même occasion, la solution facilite l'accès au dossier de santé du malade. Les paiements se font aussi en ligne par paiement mobile

6860,c-31,"Say2Forest, solution de suivi et surveillance des forets",12/20/23,12/20/23,2,,199,SEN,2,aminata.ba2@undp.org,Senegal,"Say2Forest vise à innover dans la gestion forestière. Grâce à l'utilisation de techniques de Deep Learning, la plateforme modèle prédit la couverture forestière, surveille le stock de carbone et estime les émissions de
carbone au fil du temps. La solution pour la surveillance environnementale du Parc National du Niokolo-Koba. ",,"Say2Forest, solution de suivi et surveillance des forets

Say2Forest vise à innover dans la gestion forestière. Grâce à l'utilisation de techniques de Deep Learning, la plateforme modèle prédit la couverture forestière, surveille le stock de carbone et estime les émissions de
carbone au fil du temps. La solution pour la surveillance environnementale du Parc National du Niokolo-Koba.

Il offre une visualisation interactive de l'évolution de la couverture forestière, utilisant des images satellites et des données pour suivre les changements de déforestation et de reforestation. Le système intègre un suivi des émissions de CO2, essentiel pour évaluer l'impact environnemental et guider les actions de conservation.

6859,c-31,"ADIA, l'IA au service des porteurs de projets ",12/20/23,12/20/23,2,,199,SEN,2,aminata.ba2@undp.org,Senegal,"ADIA solution est un outil qui accompagne les entrepreneurs, porteurs de projets à développer un plan d'amorçage. La solution répond à la difficulté pour les nouveaux entrepreneurs et détenteurs de solutions de disposer d'un accompagnement taillé à leurs besoins à temps opportun. L'accès à cette plateforme permet à ses utilisateurs de répondre à leurs besoins grâce à l'intelligence artificielle. L'application vous pose des questions et vous aide structurer votre idée l’outil fait une analyse du marché et peut vous donner un business modèle économique",,"ADIA, l'IA au service des porteurs de projets

ADIA solution est un outil qui accompagne les entrepreneurs, porteurs de projets à développer un plan d'amorçage. La solution répond à la difficulté pour les nouveaux entrepreneurs et détenteurs de solutions de disposer d'un accompagnement taillé à leurs besoins à temps opportun. L'accès à cette plateforme permet à ses utilisateurs de répondre à leurs besoins grâce à l'intelligence artificielle. L'application vous pose des questions et vous aide structurer votre idée l’outil fait une analyse du marché et peut vous donner un business modèle économique

Propulsée par la start-up sénégalaise CONCREE, la solution ADIA propose à n’importe quel porteur de projet de bénéficier d’un véritable plan d’amorçage pour lancer son activité. Basée sur ChatGPT, l’intelligence artificielle se charge de dresser une étude de marché, un business model et un plan de financement pour confronter l’idée de départ à la réalité du terrain.

6858,c-31,Plaque d'égouts en plastique recyclé pour renforcer la résilience des villes,12/19/23,12/20/23,2,,199,SEN,2,aminata.ba2@undp.org,Senegal,Un innovateur local fabrique des plaques d'égouts en plastique recyclé pour dissuader les voleurs de plaques en fer ou fonte renforçant ainsi la résilience des villes et des communautés aux phénomènes d'inondations  ,https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/2b6f0ea5-a774-4f23-b5ae-23da7b3d6f53/60fc3ecda1031f3badd44a8dd46bfc56.png,"Plaque d'égouts en plastique recyclé pour renforcer la résilience des villes

Un innovateur local fabrique des plaques d'égouts en plastique recyclé pour dissuader les voleurs de plaques en fer ou fonte renforçant ainsi la résilience des villes et des communautés aux phénomènes d'inondations

La solution consiste à fabriquer un nouveau modèle de plaque en plastique recyclé qui n'a pas d'intérêt pour les personnes mal intentionnées qui volent les plaques d'égouts en fer et en fonte pour les revendre.

Le problème du vol des plaques d'égouts est très ancien au Sénégal et répandu dans toutes les régions particulièrement dans la capitale. L'incivisme et la possibilité de revendre les plaques en fer et fonte développer certaines personnes à s'adonner illégalement à cette activité la nuit. Les municipalités ont du mal à suivre au jour le jour la disparition des plaques et leur remplacement dans tous les quartiers et artères des villes. Cette situation aggrave les accidents physiques et des automobiles. Aussi, sans les plaques, les égouts se bouchent rapidement avec toutes sortes de déchets et ne jouent plus leur rôle pour l'évacuation des eaux favorisant ainsi les inondations des rues.

6857,c-31,Livraison de sang à l'aide de drones,12/19/23,12/20/23,2,,199,SEN,2,aminata.ba2@undp.org,Senegal,"Au Senegal, le transport des poches de sang du Centre de transfusion sanguine aux centres de santé et hôpitaux est très difficile en raison des embouteillages monstres dans la capitale et des routes qui sont souvent non praticables. Aussi, certaines régions très éloignées comme Matam, Kédougou et Ziguinchor peuvent souffrir du manque de sang dans les hôpitaux.

En cas d'accident, la disponibilité des poches de sang dans ces Cette solution consiste à utiliser des drones autonomes à décollage et atterrissage vertical (VTOL) longue distance pour la livraison rapide et fiable de poches de sang depuis les centres de distribution de sang vers les hôpitaux. ",,"Livraison de sang à l'aide de drones

Au Senegal, le transport des poches de sang du Centre de transfusion sanguine aux centres de santé et hôpitaux est très difficile en raison des embouteillages monstres dans la capitale et des routes qui sont souvent non praticables. Aussi, certaines régions très éloignées comme Matam, Kédougou et Ziguinchor peuvent souffrir du manque de sang dans les hôpitaux.

En cas d'accident, la disponibilité des poches de sang dans ces Cette solution consiste à utiliser des drones autonomes à décollage et atterrissage vertical (VTOL) longue distance pour la livraison rapide et fiable de poches de sang depuis les centres de distribution de sang vers les hôpitaux.

Cette solution vise à améliorer l’efficacité des chaînes d’approvisionnement en sang, en particulier dans les zones difficiles d’accès, contribuant ainsi à améliorer les capacités de soins de santé et d’intervention d’urgence.

In building design, thermal mass is a property of the mass of a building that enables it to store heat and provide inertia against temperature fluctuations. It is sometimes known as the thermal flywheel effect. It can be used to even out variations in internal and external conditions, absorbing heat as temperatures rise and releasing it as they fall. An example is a trombe wall placed in front of a south-facing window will absorb solar radiation and then slowly release it into the enclosed space.
thematic_areas: Thermal Mass Innovation and Techniques

6763,c-6,Innovative Cooling Designs Inspired by Nature/Biomimicry,12/15/23,12/15/23,3,,240,MKD,2,ardita.zekiri@undp.org,North Macedonia,Innovative,https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/2da18d61-418c-4afc-9098-1dcf780b6969/9e6cd714-2ef9-4d5c-8a31-372d8545f740.png,"Innovative Cooling Designs Inspired by Nature/Biomimicry
Innovative Cooling Designs Inspired by Nature/Biomimicry

Students from Art University of Isfahan, Iran designed a hot weather structure inspired by desert snails and their naturally cooling shells. The other students were from the University of Latvia who devised a shading system that mimics how flowers and stomata open and close in response to sunlight. Another type of biomimicry: Researchers had proposed that termite mounds maintained stable internal climates by having a physical structure that enables passive internal airflow. While subsequent research on termite mounds has altered our understanding of the function of mound structures, the Eastgate Centre in Zimbabwe still achieves a controlled internal climate with the help of cost-effective and energy-efficient mechanisms originally inspired by termite mounds.
Mimicking of nature with the aim to find cooling solution:
thematic_areas:  Efficient architectural measures against heat waves

Geothermal cooling is a type of renewable energy system that moves heat from a building to below the earth's surface, using the ground like a heat sink. Systems based on geothermal energy cool in much the same way that they heat, moving hot air through a geothermal heat pump or through air-to-liquid transfer. Due to the mass of the earth below, geothermal systems can cool even intense sources of heat.

As a renewable resource geothermal covers a significant share of electricity demand in countries such as Iceland, El Salvador, New Zealand, Kenya and the Phillipines and meets more than 90% of heating demand in Iceland.
thematic_areas:  Energy generated from natural resources

The race to resilience is the UN-backed global campaign to catalyse a step-change in global ambition for climate resilience, putting people and nature first in pursuit of a resilient world where we do not just survive climate shocks and stresses, but thrive in spite of them.  The Campaign is led by the High-Level Climate Champions for climate Action.  The campaign seeks to catalyse action by non-state actors that builds resilience of 4 billion people from vulnerable groups and communities to climate risks, by 2030.

Innovative strategies at the Universidade Agostinho Neto
were employed to promote natural ventilation and
passive cooling in all buildings with the exception of the
library which is located underground. Landscape was
advantageous and trees were arranged in a linear order
to create a tunnel through which prevailing winds would

blow from the southwest. Even the positioning of these windows can have passive cooling effects through cross-ventilation, or the aligning of windows to facilitate air circulation. Notable examples of cross-ventilation include Louisiana shotgun houses, which minimize interior walls that may obstruct horizontal drafts.

The classrooms of UAN are arranged in a grid such that they are angled 19 degrees off the north/south axis thus assuming the ideal orientation to maximize in natural lighting as well as natural ventilation. The roofs of the classrooms are designed with natural ventilation in mind, calibrated through computer dynamics to minimize solar gain as well as maximizing pressure differences to draw breezes through the classrooms. Invented by Perkins+Will Architects.

6530,c-12,BusCenter,12/6/23,12/5/24,3,,,AGO,2,eneida.lima@undp.org,Angola,"Based on functional and non-functional buses, with the aim of providing integrated infrastructure for the provision of services in the fields of STEAM Education, Health, Environment, Tourism, Entrepreneurship, culture and safe spaces for youth.

The project is already in 2 provinces: Luanda and Namibe, with itinerant and fixed buses that aim to promote STEM Education, Proximity Health, taking a Disease Screening and Diagnosis Center to communities, promoting culture, robotics and initiation space education, promoting free internet access and satellite telephony, as well as supporting local primary schools with digital literacy and a small library to encourage reading.

The project is in the expansion phase for the Entrepreneur's BusCenter, which aims to have a One-Stop-Center for the entrepreneur, that is, in the same space an entrepreneur who wants to open his business will be able to find all the services, from the feasibility study, company registration, brand registration, access to credit services, among others.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/ae0a481e-a281-4ae4-b2a4-4dd4ad371a3a/9a113ccb68f835fb02d883ac8aa4a69b.png,"BusCenter
The buscenter project is a community empowerment initiative that aims to create Itinerant Competence Centers (ICC)

Based on functional and non-functional buses, with the aim of providing integrated infrastructure for the provision of services in the fields of STEAM Education, Health, Environment, Tourism, Entrepreneurship, culture and safe spaces for youth.

The project is already in 2 provinces: Luanda and Namibe, with itinerant and fixed buses that aim to promote STEM Education, Proximity Health, taking a Disease Screening and Diagnosis Center to communities, promoting culture, robotics and initiation space education, promoting free internet access and satellite telephony, as well as supporting local primary schools with digital literacy and a small library to encourage reading.

The project is in the expansion phase for the Entrepreneur's BusCenter, which aims to have a One-Stop-Center for the entrepreneur, that is, in the same space an entrepreneur who wants to open his business will be able to find all the services, from the feasibility study, company registration, brand registration, access to credit services, among others.

6529,c-12,Roque online,12/6/23,12/5/24,3,,,AGO,2,eneida.lima@undp.org,Angola,"Their focus is to help anyone compete effectively in modern society. Whether you’re an informal market vendor, small business owner, or a large distributor, you can download the mobile application and start registering your inventory so we can start monetizing it on our website or through our partners’ ecommerce channels.

It's a team of individuals dedicated to connecting the informal markets of the world with empowering technologies. Inspirate is the famous Roque Santeiro open-air market in the Republic of Angola that operated from 1991 to 2011. This market was the largest of its kind in Africa and provided a valuable service during a period of significant strife in the country's history. These types of markets exist all over the world and we want consumers to connect with vendors and service providers with which they ordinarily wouldn't connect. ",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/ae0a481e-a281-4ae4-b2a4-4dd4ad371a3a/bfe3828980cbca7712d0ac7d486374ae.png,"Roque online

6527,c-12,Mavo Diami (My Land) in Angola,12/6/23,12/5/24,3,,,AGO,2,eneida.lima@undp.org,Angola,"The envisaged impact of the effective use of Mavo Diami services is strengthened the resilience of smallholder farmers to climate change; improved soil sustainability and land allocation; and improved self-reliance of smallholder farmers due to sustainable food production and improved income security. In turn, this will contribute to a more stable agricultural economy in Angola.

Mavo Diami from consortium led by Worldvision Netherlands. The Mavo Diami project funded under the Geo Data 4Agriculture and Water of the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs / Netherlands Space Agency. The aim of this project is to improve the food and income security of more than 100,000 smallholder farmers by accelerating their agri-business performance through informed decisions supported by the Mavo Diami services built on weather, water, soil, and crop signals and other relevant data and indicators. The project is called Mavo Diami, which means 'my land' in Angolan local language (Kimbundo). During the project the Kres network was formed as a social enterprise to carry on beyond the project.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/ae0a481e-a281-4ae4-b2a4-4dd4ad371a3a/93dfeda4c70afec5033c384c8668b376.png,"Mavo Diami (My Land) in Angola

Geodata for Agriculture and Water (G4AW) The Mavo Diami social enterprise contributes to the acceleration of agribusiness performance by leveraging geodata-based information services in Angola for the benefit of smallholder farmers.

The envisaged impact of the effective use of Mavo Diami services is strengthened the resilience of smallholder farmers to climate change; improved soil sustainability and land allocation; and improved self-reliance of smallholder farmers due to sustainable food production and improved income security. In turn, this will contribute to a more stable agricultural economy in Angola.

Mavo Diami from consortium led by Worldvision Netherlands. The Mavo Diami project funded under the Geo Data 4Agriculture and Water of the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs / Netherlands Space Agency. The aim of this project is to improve the food and income security of more than 100,000 smallholder farmers by accelerating their agri-business performance through informed decisions supported by the Mavo Diami services built on weather, water, soil, and crop signals and other relevant data and indicators. The project is called Mavo Diami, which means 'my land' in Angolan local language (Kimbundo). During the project the Kres network was formed as a social enterprise to carry on beyond the project.

6526,c-12,Digital Grow,12/6/23,12/5/24,3,,,AGO,2,eneida.lima@undp.org,Angola,"It has 1,500 active users and 2,300 registered users and deals with digital advisory through AgriVAS: One to many advisory covering agricultural livestock information and addressing knowledge gaps leading to low productivity. A resource centre - digital library, free access with technical documentation to support family farming, including books, technical articles, videos or practical exercises, being found in 4 languages: Portuguese, Spanish, French and English. The contents of the Digital Library are tailor-made, essentially for the most disadvantaged regions and a virtual Platform that, in partnership with universities and research centres in Africa and Latin America, promotes training at different levels, promoting transfer of know-how and South-South relations. Digital Grow develops technical training tailored and adjusted to the local reality, especially suitable for geographies with weak internet and less sophisticated devices, operating offline. The contents of this training allow the farmer a deeper knowledge of the entire production process and value chain, a better use of resources, a reduction in production costs and an increase in production and income. They use smartphones, a website and dashboard and portal, both local and cloud-based software. Their challenges are understanding the market, and user needs, accessibility, digital literacy and use by marginalized groups. Their funding has come from impact investors and donors and is dependent on them.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/ae0a481e-a281-4ae4-b2a4-4dd4ad371a3a/17e251b2da8304a50300f9b94cfce856.png,"Digital Grow
This innovation from Fondacion Ondivia was established in 2017 is a tool with 2 components active in Angola and Mozambique.

It has 1,500 active users and 2,300 registered users and deals with digital advisory through AgriVAS: One to many advisory covering agricultural livestock information and addressing knowledge gaps leading to low productivity. A resource centre - digital library, free access with technical documentation to support family farming, including books, technical articles, videos or practical exercises, being found in 4 languages: Portuguese, Spanish, French and English. The contents of the Digital Library are tailor-made, essentially for the most disadvantaged regions and a virtual Platform that, in partnership with universities and research centres in Africa and Latin America, promotes training at different levels, promoting transfer of know-how and South-South relations. Digital Grow develops technical training tailored and adjusted to the local reality, especially suitable for geographies with weak internet and less sophisticated devices, operating offline. The contents of this training allow the farmer a deeper knowledge of the entire production process and value chain, a better use of resources, a reduction in production costs and an increase in production and income. They use smartphones, a website and dashboard and portal, both local and cloud-based software. Their challenges are understanding the market, and user needs, accessibility, digital literacy and use by marginalized groups. Their funding has come from impact investors and donors and is dependent on them.

6525,c-12,GeoFarmer,12/6/23,12/5/24,3,,,AGO,2,eneida.lima@undp.org,Angola,"Whilst GeoTerraImage is a private sector company which provides actionable intelligence through monthly crop monitoring through GeoFarmer-©-Crop monitoring platform to support precision farming, and accurate information to map crop trends and statistics by using a dashboard in a cloud-based environment. The innovative solution provides through the use of computers, satellites and Earth Observation visual maps and illustrations, statistics and trends for each field or farm being analysed (crop type, crop growth stages, land suitability, crop irrigation) and guiding decision making around farm management and practices for more efficient and sustainable production. GeoTerraImage have reached wide scale sustained adoption and operate in Angola, Botswana, Comoros, DRC, Eswatini, Lesotho, Madagascar, Malawi, Mauritius, Mozambique, Namibia, Seychelles, South Africa, Tanzania, Zambia and Zimbabwe. Through specialized software, proprietary algorithms and application GeoTerraImage use remote sensed data to create spatial information. They combine advanced information and reporting to enable analysis, quantification and monitoring to support key decision making. They charge business subscription fees for their fully commercial product and believe their technology is inclusive of underrepresented groups.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/ae0a481e-a281-4ae4-b2a4-4dd4ad371a3a/f401ca39e21561ad84a90df726c799db.png,"GeoFarmer

GeoFarmer at GEOTERRAIMAGE Ltd is established in 2017 and has combined innovations in smart farming and digital advisory and e-commerce and are regional in their deployment across the entire SADC region.

Whilst GeoTerraImage is a private sector company which provides actionable intelligence through monthly crop monitoring through GeoFarmer-©-Crop monitoring platform to support precision farming, and accurate information to map crop trends and statistics by using a dashboard in a cloud-based environment. The innovative solution provides through the use of computers, satellites and Earth Observation visual maps and illustrations, statistics and trends for each field or farm being analysed (crop type, crop growth stages, land suitability, crop irrigation) and guiding decision making around farm management and practices for more efficient and sustainable production. GeoTerraImage have reached wide scale sustained adoption and operate in Angola, Botswana, Comoros, DRC, Eswatini, Lesotho, Madagascar, Malawi, Mauritius, Mozambique, Namibia, Seychelles, South Africa, Tanzania, Zambia and Zimbabwe. Through specialized software, proprietary algorithms and application GeoTerraImage use remote sensed data to create spatial information. They combine advanced information and reporting to enable analysis, quantification and monitoring to support key decision making. They charge business subscription fees for their fully commercial product and believe their technology is inclusive of underrepresented groups.

6524,c-12,Kobocollect ,12/6/23,12/5/24,3,,,AGO,2,eneida.lima@undp.org,Angola,"It addresses challenges such as difficulties in field information transmission, potential data loss on paper, decision-making hurdles due to insufficient knowledge of field realities, and complexities in updating forms for basic information collection.
-Time Efficiency: Eliminates the need to transcribe information from paper to mobile devices for analysis.
-Accuracy: Minimizes errors through validation post-entry, eliminating transcription errors.
-User-Friendly: Requires no technical expertise and can be quickly learned.
-Multimedia Options: Allows display, recording of images, videos, or GPS coordinates.
-Quick Data Analysis: The server organizes and consolidates information for rapid analysis.
-Controlled Access: Limits and scopes access to information.

Targeting humanitarian and development cooperation services, companies, and civil society organizations, KoboToolbox proves to be a valuable, efficient tool for data management and analysis in the field.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/ae0a481e-a281-4ae4-b2a4-4dd4ad371a3a/742cc08b2792e0fc32e6a4ab19de8d38.png,"Kobocollect

This application, known as KoboToolbox, facilitates data collection using mobile devices and operates on an online server, streamlining the process of collecting, organizing, analyzing, and consolidating data.

It addresses challenges such as difficulties in field information transmission, potential data loss on paper, decision-making hurdles due to insufficient knowledge of field realities, and complexities in updating forms for basic information collection.
-Time Efficiency: Eliminates the need to transcribe information from paper to mobile devices for analysis.
-Accuracy: Minimizes errors through validation post-entry, eliminating transcription errors.
-User-Friendly: Requires no technical expertise and can be quickly learned.
-Multimedia Options: Allows display, recording of images, videos, or GPS coordinates.
-Quick Data Analysis: The server organizes and consolidates information for rapid analysis.
-Controlled Access: Limits and scopes access to information.

Targeting humanitarian and development cooperation services, companies, and civil society organizations, KoboToolbox proves to be a valuable, efficient tool for data management and analysis in the field.

6522,c-12,Weather Impact,12/6/23,12/5/24,3,,,AGO,2,eneida.lima@undp.org,Angola,Weather Impact provides agrometeorological forecast and advisory services to support smallholder farmer's decision-making. ,https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/ae0a481e-a281-4ae4-b2a4-4dd4ad371a3a/9a678ba6e471ff671b4ed36537abd78f.png,"Weather Impact
Weather Impact provides agrometeorological forecast and advisory services to support smallholder farmer's decision-making.

Our forecasts are available in various languages across Africa, Asia and Europe. We condense complex, real-time data into accurate, user-friendly text messages, via our own mobile app, existing apps, our website, or SMS. Our services support farmers in making decisions such as when to plant, fertilize or harvest. Weather Impact’s objective is to provide reliable local weather data which prevents climate related losses and helps optimize global food production. We forecast: daily weather, extreme weather, monsoon onset, seasonal weather outlook, and pest and disease risk.
Deployed in Angola, Burundi, Ethiopia, Ghana, Kenya, Myanmar, Netherlands, South Africa, Spain, Tanzani

6520,c-12,KRES,12/6/23,12/5/24,3,,,AGO,2,eneida.lima@undp.org,Angola,"Launched in 2021, the KRES Network, operational in Angola and Mozambique, is a collaborative initiative involving partners from the Netherlands and World Vision. Serving as a decentralized service provider, it has 250 smartphone users and 2,800 basic phone users.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/ae0a481e-a281-4ae4-b2a4-4dd4ad371a3a/f983473c70c8ffe731e7c224b7b8d9c1.png,"KRES

Launched in 2021, the KRES Network, operational in Angola and Mozambique, is a collaborative initiative involving partners from the Netherlands and World Vision. Serving as a decentralized service provider, it has 250 smartphone users and 2,800 basic phone users.
The primary objective is to empower farmers through regenerative agriculture, utilizing digital advisory services and market linkages with voice bots, chatbots, and geodata/AI.

The network aims to create Rural Agri Entrepreneurs, acting as intermediaries, and employs innovative digital/e-learning tools, including chatbot-based drills, to enhance the capacity of remote Rural Agri Entrepreneurs. Smart advisory services leverage data-driven insights and technologies such as sensors, satellites, drones, big data analytics, and AI to provide tailored information on agro-climatic and crop-specific conditions.

KRES Network offers weather information and digital tools for climate-smart advice and pest and disease management accessible via mobile applications or USSD. Agri-record keeping tools, like the Plan & Activity Tracker, help farmers view farming as a business, with an accountability tool for tracking expenses and revenues to demonstrate creditworthiness.

The network is developing Liquidity Financing solutions involving FADA, BNI, BDA (Angola), and HUB, Casa do Agricultor (Mozambique). KRES facilitates the sale of agricultural inputs and produce through a Smart Digital Agent approach, emphasizing a holistic approach rather than functioning as a marketplace. The inception of the KRES Network traces back to the Mavo Diami project in Angola.
sdgs: Decent work and economic growth

6519,c-12,Jardins da Yoba,12/6/23,12/5/24,3,,,AGO,2,eneida.lima@undp.org,Angola,"Jardins da Yoba integrate agricultural and livestock systems prioritize environmental sustainability and responsible resource utilization. Their core activities involve the production and multiplication of seeds, alongside cultivating vegetables and fruit trees. Additionally, they focus on honey and bee product production, as well as the organic crafting of sweets and jams. These endeavors represent their current and future potential for export, underscoring their commitment to excellence.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/ae0a481e-a281-4ae4-b2a4-4dd4ad371a3a/382a4b91a1ddf54df30acb4e74755c64.png,"Jardins da Yoba
Situated in the Huila province of Angola, Jardins da Yoba is an agribusiness enterprise dedicated to sustainable practices.

Jardins da Yoba integrate agricultural and livestock systems prioritize environmental sustainability and responsible resource utilization. Their core activities involve the production and multiplication of seeds, alongside cultivating vegetables and fruit trees. Additionally, they focus on honey and bee product production, as well as the organic crafting of sweets and jams. These endeavors represent their current and future potential for export, underscoring their commitment to excellence.
sdgs: Decent work and economic growth

6513,c-12,Aldeia VILLAGE CAMELA AMÕES,12/5/23,12/5/24,3,,,AGO,2,eneida.lima@undp.org,Angola,"Aldeia Camela Amões, nestled amidst the Lumbanganda mountain range, spans 40,000 hectares, offering a multifaceted solution to combat poverty in vulnerable contexts. ",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/ae0a481e-a281-4ae4-b2a4-4dd4ad371a3a/9d9b6f707512c529fdaca6ad56bd5824.png,"Aldeia VILLAGE CAMELA AMÕES
Aldeia Camela Amões, nestled amidst the Lumbanganda mountain range, spans 40,000 hectares, offering a multifaceted solution to combat poverty in vulnerable contexts.

The project encompasses housing, education, health, churches, shops, leisure, farmland, livestock, industry, forestry, tourism, and a wildlife reserve. Utilizing the rural setting, the initiative promotes a dignified lifestyle.

The village, featuring red earth blocks produced locally, prioritizes self-sustainable housing over traditional kimbos. Three configurations cater to technicians, local inhabitants, and tourism. Social housing, occupying half a hectare, includes recreational areas and space for vegetable gardens. Residents, part of a housing cooperative, pay for amenities over 40 years through agricultural produce.

Solar panels provide energy, and boreholes supply potable water. The village hosts wild animals and plans for ponds. Recognized at the Global Summit for Trade and Investment in Africa in Washington DC, the project emphasizes social impact by creating productive sectors in rural areas. The village includes a medical center, school, Protestant and Catholic places of worship, and an essential goods store.
sdgs: Decent work and economic growth
