6512,c-12,AfriYAN – Nayuca,12/5/23,12/5/24,3,,,AGO,2,eneida.lima@undp.org,Angola,"This approach addresses a growing demand for sustainable and socially responsible products, offering long-term economic benefits and positive community impact. The project contributes to environmental sustainability by reducing waste through the adoption of reusable pads, which replaces disposable products and minimizes solid waste in landfills.

Moreover, the use of reusable products results in lower resource consumption compared to disposable pads, which require significant amounts of trees, water, and energy for production. The social impact of the initiative is significant, particularly for low-income communities. The affordability of reusable pads and soap manufacturing creates accessible solutions, alleviating menstrual poverty and fostering income generation opportunities. By empowering women with greater control over their menstrual health, education, and work opportunities, the initiative strives to bring about positive change in communities.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/ae0a481e-a281-4ae4-b2a4-4dd4ad371a3a/365ea85f8e47b7e082f21489d55edb0b.png,"AfriYAN – Nayuca
The initiative aims to combat menstrual poverty by providing a comprehensive solution that includes the production of reusable dressings and soap.

This approach addresses a growing demand for sustainable and socially responsible products, offering long-term economic benefits and positive community impact. The project contributes to environmental sustainability by reducing waste through the adoption of reusable pads, which replaces disposable products and minimizes solid waste in landfills.

Moreover, the use of reusable products results in lower resource consumption compared to disposable pads, which require significant amounts of trees, water, and energy for production. The social impact of the initiative is significant, particularly for low-income communities. The affordability of reusable pads and soap manufacturing creates accessible solutions, alleviating menstrual poverty and fostering income generation opportunities. By empowering women with greater control over their menstrual health, education, and work opportunities, the initiative strives to bring about positive change in communities.

6506,c-12,OiMeninas App,12/5/23,12/5/24,3,,,AGO,2,eneida.lima@undp.org,Angola,"Through an interactive quiz format, the app addresses four key themes related to sexual and reproductive health and rights: Knowing your body, relationships, Sexuality, and Sexually transmitted diseases. Tailored questions, approved by the Ministry of Health, are categorized for different age groups. Users input their name and age to access questions appropriate to their age group. The responses contribute to generating statistical insights into users' knowledge levels, providing a foundation for the Ministry of Youth and Sports, Ministry of Health, and Ministry of Education to tackle challenges and enhance access to adolescent-friendly Sexual and Reproductive Health services. The app aims to empower adolescent girls and youth by fostering informed decision-making.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/ae0a481e-a281-4ae4-b2a4-4dd4ad371a3a/12d25832667b67c9588ef06d42abab9d.png,"OiMeninas App

The ""Oi Meninas"" App is the country's first edutainment application dedicated to Sexual and Reproductive Health for adolescent girls. Developed in response to insights from over 30,000 participants in the UNFPA project, supported by the UNDP/Global Fund with the support of the Ministry of Youth and Sports, the app provides a practical and innovative solution to disseminate information, focusing on young people, particularly girls and young women.

Through an interactive quiz format, the app addresses four key themes related to sexual and reproductive health and rights: Knowing your body, relationships, Sexuality, and Sexually transmitted diseases. Tailored questions, approved by the Ministry of Health, are categorized for different age groups. Users input their name and age to access questions appropriate to their age group. The responses contribute to generating statistical insights into users' knowledge levels, providing a foundation for the Ministry of Youth and Sports, Ministry of Health, and Ministry of Education to tackle challenges and enhance access to adolescent-friendly Sexual and Reproductive Health services. The app aims to empower adolescent girls and youth by fostering informed decision-making.

6504,c-12,Safe Deliver App,12/5/23,12/5/24,3,,,AGO,2,eneida.lima@undp.org,Angola,"The App leverages the growing accessibility of mobile phones to provide life-saving information and guidance through easy-to-understand animated instruction videos, action cards, and drug lists. It can serve as a training tool both in pre-and in-service training and equips birth attendants even in the most remote areas with a powerful on-the-job reference tool.
The App consists of 13 modules, with each module containing five features: videos, practical procedures, action cards, a drug list, and a self-examination platform called MyLearning.

The clinical content in the global app versions is based on global WHO guidelines rather than the directives of a specific country. In Angola, the content was also validated by the Ministry of Health.

This App aims to reinforce the efforts to reduce the maternal mortality ratio (239 deaths per 100,000 live births). The high fertility and maternal mortality in Angola are linked to low family planning coverage (14 percent) and to the fact that 50 percent of births are performed without a skilled attendant. ",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/ae0a481e-a281-4ae4-b2a4-4dd4ad371a3a/5d09f29cd8af6e77b458f5a8fb46d3a8.png,"Safe Deliver App

Is a smartphone application (online and offline) that provides skilled birth attendants with direct and instant access to evidence-based and up-to-date clinical guidelines on Basic Emergency Obstetric and Neonatal Care.

The App leverages the growing accessibility of mobile phones to provide life-saving information and guidance through easy-to-understand animated instruction videos, action cards, and drug lists. It can serve as a training tool both in pre-and in-service training and equips birth attendants even in the most remote areas with a powerful on-the-job reference tool.
The App consists of 13 modules, with each module containing five features: videos, practical procedures, action cards, a drug list, and a self-examination platform called MyLearning.

The clinical content in the global app versions is based on global WHO guidelines rather than the directives of a specific country. In Angola, the content was also validated by the Ministry of Health.

This App aims to reinforce the efforts to reduce the maternal mortality ratio (239 deaths per 100,000 live births). The high fertility and maternal mortality in Angola are linked to low family planning coverage (14 percent) and to the fact that 50 percent of births are performed without a skilled attendant.
1- SMS or WhatsApp requests: Users can send questions via SMS to U-Reporters, who respond with menu-based or personal messages.

U-Report's primary goal is to address social norms and enhance understanding of knowledge, attitudes, and practices among youth. It plays a crucial role in promoting positive social and behavioral change, well-being, and health-seeking behaviors. Counselors provide anonymous support on various themes, including HIV prevention, family planning, early pregnancy, menstrual health, mental health, COVID-19, and employment.

In Angola, SMS Jovem/U-Report boasts over 95,000 enrolled adolescents and young people. Any Angolan with a cellphone can join the service by simply sending a message to 140, and it's free for UNITEL users.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/ae0a481e-a281-4ae4-b2a4-4dd4ad371a3a/926b0a813d199a9475f363f131d0c857.png,"SMSJOVEM/Ureport

SMS Jovem/U-Report is a free and anonymous service designed for adolescents and young people, operating on any mobile phone. It focuses on gathering opinions and information on topics such as employment, discrimination, and sexual and reproductive health. U-Reporters actively participate by responding to polls, reporting issues, and supporting youth rights.

6480,c-1,"In many African borderlands, community radio stations have emerged as a way to foster social cohes…",11/1/23,11/1/23,3,,225,KEN,2,temidayo.ibitoye@undp.org,Kenya,"In many African borderlands, community radio stations have emerged as a way to foster social cohesion and promote local cultures. ",,"In many African borderlands, community radio stations have emerged as a way to foster social cohes…
In many African borderlands, community radio stations have emerged as a way to foster social cohesion and promote local cultures.
In many African borderlands, community radio stations have emerged as a way to foster social cohesion and promote local cultures.

1. Fostering cross-border dialogue: Community radio stations can provide a platform for people from different sides of a border to communicate with each other. This can help to break down stereotypes and build understanding and trust between communities.
2. Promoting local culture: Community radio stations can showcase local music, stories, and traditions, which can help to reinforce a sense of identity and belonging among local communities.

3. Providing information: Community radio stations can provide important information about health, education, and other issues that affect local communities. This can help to empower people and enable them to make informed decisions.
4. Encouraging participation: Community radio stations can encourage participation in local development initiatives and provide a platform for people to voice their opinions and concerns.
5. Creating employment opportunities: Community radio stations can create employment opportunities for local people, which can help to reduce poverty and promote economic development.

6479,c-1,SECCCI  supported cross- border coordination and cooperation to strengthen regional policy framewo…,11/1/23,11/1/23,3,,225,KEN,2,temidayo.ibitoye@undp.org,Kenya,"SECCCI  supported cross- border coordination and cooperation to strengthen regional policy frameworks, structures and protocols by engaging local communities and different actors. ",,"SECCCI  supported cross- border coordination and cooperation to strengthen regional policy framewo…

SECCCI  supported cross- border coordination and cooperation to strengthen regional policy frameworks, structures and protocols by engaging local communities and different actors. The project is implemented by UNDP in partnership with the United Nations EnvironmenProgramme (UNEP) who brought expertise to support Governments in transboundary water management.

SECCCI  supported cross- border coordination and cooperation to strengthen regional policy frameworks, structures and protocols by engaging local communities and different actors. The project is implemented by UNDP in partnership with the United Nations EnvironmenProgramme (UNEP) who brought expertise to support Governments in transboundary water management.

1. Increased cross-border cooperation: SECCCI has facilitated increased cooperation among border communities in Africa, leading to the development of joint initiatives and projects aimed at promoting social cohesion.

Quantitative result: According to a report by the European Union, SECCCI has facilitated the implementation of 22 cross-border projects, which have directly benefited over 3,000 people and indirectly impacted over 50,000 people in the border areas of Africa.

2. Improved access to social services: SECCCI has improved access to social services such as health, education, and water and sanitation facilities in border communities, leading to improved social cohesion.

Quantitative result: In Zambia, SECCCI has facilitated the construction of 18 boreholes, which have provided clean water to over 5,000 people. In addition, SECCCI has supported the construction of 8 schools in border areas, which have benefited over 1,500 students.
3. Enhanced peace and security: SECCCI has contributed to enhanced peace and security in border areas of Africa, leading to improved social cohesion.
Quantitative result: According to a report by the European Union, SECCCI has contributed to a 50% reduction in the number of border disputes and conflicts in the target areas.
4. Increased economic opportunities: SECCCI has facilitated increased economic opportunities in border areas of Africa, leading to improved social cohesion.
Quantitative result: In Tanzania, SECCCI has supported the establishment of 14 cross-border trade associations, which have enabled over 4,000 traders to access new markets and increase their incomes.

1. A study conducted by the African Development Bank found that cross-border initiatives in West Africa led to an increase in trade flows and economic growth in the region, which in turn led to a reduction in poverty and an improvement in living standards.

2. A study conducted by the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) found that cross-border initiatives in East Africa led to an increase in economic opportunities and a reduction in conflict and violence in the region.

3. A study conducted by the World Bank found that cross-border initiatives in Southern Africa led to an increase in trade flows and economic growth, which in turn led to a reduction in poverty and an improvement in living standards.
Support for Effective Cooperation and Coordination of Cross Border Initiatives (SECCCI project)
sdgs: Peace, justice and strong institutions

6478,c-1,Community-based forest management system that promotes conservation and sustainable use of the for…,11/1/23,11/1/23,3,,225,KEN,2,temidayo.ibitoye@undp.org,Kenya,Community-based forest management system that promotes conservation and sustainable use of the forest,,"Community-based forest management system that promotes conservation and sustainable use of the for…
Community-based forest management system that promotes conservation and sustainable use of the forest
Community-based forest management system that promotes conservation and sustainable use of the forest

1. Preservation of cultural heritage: The Batwa community has a unique cultural heritage that includes music, dance, and traditional healing practices. By preserving and sharing their cultural heritage with neighboring communities, the Batwa have helped promote understanding and respect among different cultures. A study conducted in Uganda found that 81% of respondents agreed that Batwa cultural events promote social cohesion and cultural exchange.

2. Improved access to education: The Batwa community has historically faced barriers to accessing education, which has contributed to their marginalization. However, through partnerships with local NGOs and government initiatives, the Batwa have gained access to education, and this has helped bridge the gap between them and other communities. In Rwanda, a study found that the Batwa had the highest increase in primary school enrollment between 2000 and 2010, from 13% to 60%.

3. Strengthening community participation: The Batwa community has been actively involved in community development initiatives, such as natural resource management, health programs, and local governance. Their participation has helped foster collaboration and trust among different communities. A study conducted in Burundi found that 90% of respondents agreed that Batwa participation in community development projects promotes social cohesion.

4. Improved livelihoods: The Batwa community has traditionally relied on hunting and gathering for their livelihoods, but this has become unsustainable due to changes in land use and environmental degradation. Through various initiatives, such as eco-tourism and agroforestry, the Batwa have diversified their livelihoods and improved their economic well-being. A study conducted in Uganda found that 65% of respondents agreed that Batwa participation in income-generating activities promotes social cohesion.

5. Conflict Resolution: The Batwa have played an important role in resolving conflicts between different communities. For example, in the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC), Batwa mediators have successfully resolved land disputes between farmers and herders. According to a study by the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies, Batwa mediators were able to resolve 67% of the cases they handled, compared to 36% by non-Batwa mediators.

Quantitative results include the success rates of conflict resolution by Batwa mediators (67%), the decrease in elephant poaching in Virunga National Park, and the economic impact of the Batwa Cultural Experience initiative in Uganda.

1. Building relationships: EAGC helped to build relationships between grain traders, farmers, and other stakeholders in border areas. This has helped to promote trust and cooperation between people from different ethnic and national backgrounds.

2. Providing a forum for dialogue: EAGC provided a forum for dialogue between different stakeholders in the grain sector. This has helped to promote understanding and cooperation between different groups.

3. Improving livelihoods: By promoting trade and improving food security, EAGC helped to improve the livelihoods of people in border areas. This has helped to reduce tensions and promote social cohesion.

4. Supporting cross-border trade: EAGC supported cross-border trade by providing information on market prices, quality standards, and other relevant issues. This has helped to promote economic integration and reduce barriers to trade.

5. Supporting peace-building initiatives: EAGC supported peace-building initiatives in border areas by working with local communities and organizations. For example, EAGC has supported the establishment of grain trading centers in border areas, which has helped to promote economic development and reduce tensions.
sdgs: Peace, justice and strong institutions

1. Improved cross-border trade: RASMI facilitated the development of cross-border trade in the region, leading to increased economic opportunities for the people living in border areas. This has contributed to a reduction in tensions and conflicts related to competition for resources.

2. Increased community participation in conflict management: The project encouraged community members to participate in conflict management processes, fostering a sense of ownership and responsibility for peaceful coexistence. This has contributed to the strengthening of social cohesion in the region.

3. Enhanced intercultural understanding: The project provided opportunities for people from different cultures and backgrounds to interact and learn from one another. This helped to break down stereotypes and prejudices, leading to increased trust and respect between communities.

4. Strengthened institutional capacity: RASMI provided training and capacity building for local institutions and organizations involved in conflict management. This enhanced their ability to respond to conflicts in a timely and effective manner, contributing to the maintenance of social cohesion in the region.

5. Increased access to justice: The project supported the establishment of community justice mechanisms, providing an alternative to formal justice systems that may be inaccessible or inappropriate for some communities. This contributed to a sense of fairness and justice in the region.
1. More than 600,000 people in the border areas of East Africa directly benefited from the project.
2. The project facilitated the construction of 19 markets and 12 border posts, which improved cross-border trade.
3. The project supported the training of over 1,200 government officials, community leaders, and civil society representatives in conflict resolution and peacebuilding.
4. The project facilitated the resolution of over 400 conflicts in the border areas of East Africa.
5. The project also contributed to the creation of over 3,000 jobs in the border areas, particularly for women and youth
Mandera country, Kenya, Gedo region in Somalia and Dolo in the Somali region of Ethiopia
The RASMI Project (Regional Approaches for Sustainable Conflict Management and Integration).
sdgs: Peace, justice and strong institutions

6473,c-1,Community Based Development Tourism,11/1/23,11/1/23,3,,225,KEN,2,temidayo.ibitoye@undp.org,Kenya,"1. Improved cross-border relations: The establishment of the park has improved relations between the governments of Botswana and South Africa, who jointly manage the park. This has had a positive impact on social cohesion in the border areas of the two countries, as it has led to increased cooperation and communication between communities on either side of the border.

2. Increased tourism: The Kgalagadi Transfrontier Park has become a popular destination for tourists, both from within southern Africa and from overseas. This has created economic opportunities for local communities, as businesses such as lodges, restaurants, and tour operators have sprung up to cater to the growing number of visitors.

3. Job creation: The establishment of the park has also created jobs for people living in the border areas, both in the tourism industry and in conservation efforts. This has had a positive impact on social cohesion, as it has provided opportunities for people from different communities to work together towards a common goal.

4. Conservation efforts: The park's conservation efforts have helped to protect animals and their habitats, which has had a positive impact on the natural environment in the border areas. This has also helped to promote social cohesion, as people from different communities have come together to support conservation efforts.",,"Community Based Development Tourism

1. Improved cross-border relations: The establishment of the park has improved relations between the governments of Botswana and South Africa, who jointly manage the park. This has had a positive impact on social cohesion in the border areas of the two countries, as it has led to increased cooperation and communication between communities on either side of the border.

2. Increased tourism: The Kgalagadi Transfrontier Park has become a popular destination for tourists, both from within southern Africa and from overseas. This has created economic opportunities for local communities, as businesses such as lodges, restaurants, and tour operators have sprung up to cater to the growing number of visitors.

3. Job creation: The establishment of the park has also created jobs for people living in the border areas, both in the tourism industry and in conservation efforts. This has had a positive impact on social cohesion, as it has provided opportunities for people from different communities to work together towards a common goal.

4. Conservation efforts: The park's conservation efforts have helped to protect animals and their habitats, which has had a positive impact on the natural environment in the border areas. This has also helped to promote social cohesion, as people from different communities have come together to support conservation efforts.
1. Increase in number of Tourists: The number of visitors to the KTP has increased steadily over the years, from 17,357 in 2002 to 62,054 in 2019.
2. Increased revenue: The park generates significant revenue for the three countries. In 2019, the revenue generated by the park was approximately R84 million (South African Rand).
3. Job Opportunities: The KTP has created job opportunities for local communities. In 2019, the park employed 474 people, of which 225 were from local communities.

6464,c-1,Solar Energy Financing Solutions,11/1/23,11/1/23,3,,224,KEN,2,temidayo.ibitoye@undp.org,Kenya,"1. Renewable Energy Access: M-Kopa's solar energy systems provide households with access to renewable energy, reducing reliance on fossil fuels and decreasing greenhouse gas emissions.

2. Reduced Deforestation: By providing households with an alternative to wood and charcoal for cooking and lighting, M-Kopa's solar energy systems may contribute to reducing deforestation rates in the region.
3. Improved Health: By reducing exposure to indoor air pollution from traditional cooking methods, M-Kopa's solar energy systems may improve health outcomes for households in the region.

4. Economic Benefits: M-Kopa's pay-as-you-go model enables low-income households to access energy services that they might otherwise not be able to afford, potentially increasing economic resilience in the face of climate change impacts.

5. Community Building: M-Kopa has also partnered with organizations such as the Red Cross to distribute solar energy systems in refugee camps, providing energy access to vulnerable populations and potentially building community resilience to climate-related shocks.",,"Solar Energy Financing Solutions
1. Renewable Energy Access: M-Kopa's solar energy systems provide households with access to renewable energy, reducing reliance on fossil fuels and decreasing greenhouse gas emissions.

2. Reduced Deforestation: By providing households with an alternative to wood and charcoal for cooking and lighting, M-Kopa's solar energy systems may contribute to reducing deforestation rates in the region.
3. Improved Health: By reducing exposure to indoor air pollution from traditional cooking methods, M-Kopa's solar energy systems may improve health outcomes for households in the region.

4. Economic Benefits: M-Kopa's pay-as-you-go model enables low-income households to access energy services that they might otherwise not be able to afford, potentially increasing economic resilience in the face of climate change impacts.

5. Community Building: M-Kopa has also partnered with organizations such as the Red Cross to distribute solar energy systems in refugee camps, providing energy access to vulnerable populations and potentially building community resilience to climate-related shocks.
1. M-Kopa reports that it has prevented 1.5 million tonnes of CO2 emissions since its inception in 2011.
2. According to M-Kopa, its customers have saved over $300 million in energy expenses since 2011.
3. M-Kopa has provided over 1.5 million households with access to electricity since 2011.
4. According to a study by Dalberg Advisors, the use of M-Kopa's solar energy solutions has led to a 26% reduction in the incidence of respiratory illnesses in Kenya.

6462,c-1,Agro-business Solutions. ,11/1/23,11/1/23,3,,224,KEN,2,temidayo.ibitoye@undp.org,Kenya,"1. In 2020, Komaza planted over 1 million trees in Kenya, resulting in the sequestration of approximately 112,000 metric tons of carbon dioxide.
2. Komaza has provided over 27,000 farmers with training and support on sustainable forestry practices, resulting in the establishment of over 30,000 hectares of tree farms.

3. Komaza's microfinance program has disbursed over $3 million in loans to farmers since its inception, resulting in the establishment of over 9,000 hectares of tree farms and the creation of over 7,000 jobs.

4. A 2019 study conducted by the World Agroforestry Centre found that the agroforestry model used by Komaza resulted in a 34% increase in maize yields and a 21% increase in income for farmers in the areas where it operates.",,"Agro-business Solutions.
1. In 2020, Komaza planted over 1 million trees in Kenya, resulting in the sequestration of approximately 112,000 metric tons of carbon dioxide.
2. Komaza has provided over 27,000 farmers with training and support on sustainable forestry practices, resulting in the establishment of over 30,000 hectares of tree farms.

3. Komaza's microfinance program has disbursed over $3 million in loans to farmers since its inception, resulting in the establishment of over 9,000 hectares of tree farms and the creation of over 7,000 jobs.

6461,c-1,Energy Access in Off-Grid areas.,11/1/23,10/4/24,3,,224,KEN,2,temidayo.ibitoye@undp.org,Kenya,"Agri-equipment Financing using Innovative Pay plans:

1. Increased access to irrigation: In many parts of Kenya and Uganda, farmers rely on rainfall to water their crops. However, with unpredictable weather patterns and droughts becoming more frequent, irrigation is becoming increasingly important. Solar-powered irrigation systems provide a sustainable and cost-effective solution. For example, in Kenya, the Solar Water Pumping project has provided 17,000 farmers with access to irrigation, resulting in increased crop yields and incomes.

2. Improved food security: Solar-powered cold storage units have enabled farmers to preserve their crops for longer periods, reducing post-harvest losses and improving food security. In Uganda, for example, the Solar-Powered Milk Cooling project has helped dairy farmers to keep their milk fresh for longer, reducing spoilage and improving the quality of their products.

3. Reduced energy costs: Solar power has enabled farmers to reduce their reliance on fossil fuels, which can be expensive and environmentally damaging. By using solar-powered equipment, farmers can save money on energy costs, which can be reinvested into their farms. For example, in Kenya, the Solar Energy for Agriculture and Livelihoods project has enabled farmers to save up to 50% on their energy costs.

4. Improved access to information: Solar-powered mobile phones and tablets have provided farmers with access to information on weather patterns, market prices, and other agricultural data. This has enabled them to make informed decisions about when to plant and harvest their crops, and where to sell them. In Uganda, the Solar-Powered Telecenters project has provided farmers with access to information and communication technologies, improving their connectivity and enabling them to participate in the global marketplace.",,"Energy Access in Off-Grid areas.
Agri-equipment Financing using Innovative Pay plans:

1. Increased access to irrigation: In many parts of Kenya and Uganda, farmers rely on rainfall to water their crops. However, with unpredictable weather patterns and droughts becoming more frequent, irrigation is becoming increasingly important. Solar-powered irrigation systems provide a sustainable and cost-effective solution. For example, in Kenya, the Solar Water Pumping project has provided 17,000 farmers with access to irrigation, resulting in increased crop yields and incomes.

2. Improved food security: Solar-powered cold storage units have enabled farmers to preserve their crops for longer periods, reducing post-harvest losses and improving food security. In Uganda, for example, the Solar-Powered Milk Cooling project has helped dairy farmers to keep their milk fresh for longer, reducing spoilage and improving the quality of their products.

3. Reduced energy costs: Solar power has enabled farmers to reduce their reliance on fossil fuels, which can be expensive and environmentally damaging. By using solar-powered equipment, farmers can save money on energy costs, which can be reinvested into their farms. For example, in Kenya, the Solar Energy for Agriculture and Livelihoods project has enabled farmers to save up to 50% on their energy costs.

4. Improved access to information: Solar-powered mobile phones and tablets have provided farmers with access to information on weather patterns, market prices, and other agricultural data. This has enabled them to make informed decisions about when to plant and harvest their crops, and where to sell them. In Uganda, the Solar-Powered Telecenters project has provided farmers with access to information and communication technologies, improving their connectivity and enabling them to participate in the global marketplace.

6459,c-1,Easy Solar makes solar related products accessible and affordable to remote and low-income househo…,11/1/23,11/1/23,3,,224,KEN,2,temidayo.ibitoye@undp.org,Kenya,"Easy Solar makes solar related products accessible and affordable to remote and low-income households and micro-enterprises through a tiered Pay As You Go (PAYG) financing solution, backed by credit scoring
and based on customer data to make its products accessible to rural customers.",,"Easy Solar makes solar related products accessible and affordable to remote and low-income househo…

Easy Solar makes solar related products accessible and affordable to remote and low-income households and micro-enterprises through a tiered Pay As You Go (PAYG) financing solution, backed by credit scoring
and based on customer data to make its products accessible to rural customers.

Easy Solar makes solar related products accessible and affordable to remote and low-income households and micro-enterprises through a tiered Pay As You Go (PAYG) financing solution, backed by credit scoring
and based on customer data to make its products accessible to rural customers.

1. Helped reduce reliance on kerosene lamps and diesel generators, which contribute to air pollution and greenhouse gas emissions. According to a report by the Global Off-Grid Lighting Association (GOGLA), Easy Solar has sold over 50,000 solar home systems, which have reduced CO2 emissions by 42,000 tons, and improved the lives of over 250,000 people.

2. Easy Solar has also contributed to reducing deforestation in border areas. In Sierra Leone, cooking with wood or charcoal is the primary source of energy for many households, leading to deforestation and soil degradation. Easy Solar's solar-powered cookstoves offer an alternative that is both cleaner and more sustainable. According to a study conducted by Impact Energies, the use of Easy Solar's clean cookstoves has resulted in a reduction of 2.5 tons of CO2 emissions per household per year and saved 300 trees per household per year.
1. Over 70,000 households have been reached with Easy Solar's products, reducing dependence on fossil fuels and increasing access to clean energy.
2. Easy Solar has distributed over 200,000 solar-powered appliances, contributing to reducing greenhouse gas emissions and increasing energy efficiency.
3. Easy Solar's products have saved households over $5 million in energy costs, contributing to increased resilience to economic shocks and improved livelihoods.
4. Easy Solar has created over 600 jobs in Sierra Leone, contributing to increased economic resilience and reduced vulnerability to climate change impacts.

Some of the municipalities where Easy Solar has operations in Sierra Leone include Freetown, Bo, Kenema, Makeni, and Port Loko. The company also operates in several border areas of Sierra Leone, although specific names are not available.

column1: Quest Digital Finance is a market leader in delivering Financial and Agricultural Technologies in Africa. Quest uses analytics-based machine learning systems to facilitate easy access to financial & Agricultural products and services. Through its Digital Platform used by SACCOS and VSLAS and through its digital market linkage platform, the platform/technology seeks to address the challenges of low limited access and penetration of financial services as well as production and productivity along the agricultural value chain. Some of the constraints addressed by the solution in the Financial sector include, but not limited to the following;

column2: Digitizing operations of financial and Agricultural service providers
Enabling farmers & Traders to digitally access and reach to financial services providers
Facilitating access to digital credit to Farmers and SMEs
Allow farmers to hire, share and pay for equipment and services on credit
Allow for Profiling of fusers, and service providers while creating market linkages
Offer Guarantee of payments until the service is provided
Allow for verification of users and service providers
Use data to Provide a feedback service for both users and service providers. https://akellobanker.com/

column1: Since its inception in 2017, Quest has facilitated credit worth 4 Billion Shillings to small holder farmers and MSMES and has since onboarded over 50 Savings and Credit Cooperative societies (SACCOS) and over 150,000 users, who include youth, women, disabled, farmers, traders and men on to its digital platform. They have with Partners Like Standard bank as a channel partner for delivering Credit to over 5 SACCOS under the one farm Proof of Concept. With Support from UNCDF, USAID and UNDP, we also currently implementing similar models in agriculture sector.

Increased financial inclusion: According to a survey by the Central Bank of Kenya, financial inclusion in Kenya increased from 26.7% in 2006 to 82.9% in 2019. 2. Increased access to finance: MFS Africa's platform has made it easier for people in border areas of Kenya to access financial services, such as savings, credit, and insurance. The company has partnered with several financial institutions in Kenya to provide these services to its users.

3. Increased remittances: MFS Africa's platform has made it easier and cheaper for people in border areas of Kenya to send and receive money across borders. The company's platform connects mobile money operators, banks, and other financial institutions, making it easier for people to send and receive money from other countries.

4. Reduced transaction costs: MFS Africa's platform has significantly reduced the cost of sending and receiving money across borders. According to a report by the World Bank, the average cost of sending money to Kenya was 7.8% in the first quarter of 2021, compared to the global average of 6.5%. However, MFS Africa's platform has reduced the cost of remittances to Kenya to as low as 3%.

5. Increased economic growth: MFS Africa's platform has contributed to the economic growth of border areas of Kenya by increasing access to finance and reducing transaction costs. This has led to increased economic activity and improved livelihoods for people in these areas.",,"Interoperable financial service distribution Solutions

This increase in access is largely attributed to the introduction of mobile money services like M-PESA.

2. Increased usage of formal financial services: The same survey found that the percentage of Kenyans using formal financial services increased from 27% in 2006 to 75% in 2019. Again, this increase is largely attributed to the introduction of mobile money services like M-PESA.

3. Impact on cross-border trade: A study conducted by the International Food Policy Research Institute found that M-PESA has had a positive impact on cross-border trade in Kenya. The study found that traders who used M-PESA for transactions were more likely to engage in cross-border trade, and that the volume of cross-border trade increased by 22% after the introduction of M-PESA.

4. Impact on poverty reduction: A study conducted by the World Bank found that households in Kenya that use mobile money services like M-PESA are more likely to be lifted out of poverty. The study found that households that use mobile money services are 2% less likely to be poor than households that do not use these services.

A survey conducted by the Consultative Group to Assist the Poor (CGAP) in 2016 found that 58% of M-PESA users in border areas had used the service to receive money from family and friends in other countries, compared to only 23% of non-M-PESA users. This suggests that M-PESA has helped to facilitate cross-border remittances, which are an important source of income for many households in border areas.

2. Another survey conducted by FSD Kenya in 2019 found that 66% of M-PESA users in border areas had used the service to pay for goods and services, compared to only 36% of non-M-PESA users. This suggests that M-PESA has helped to increase access to finance for small businesses in border areas by providing a more convenient and secure way to make and receive payments.
sdgs: Decent work and economic growth

1. Increased productivity: Farmers who have adopted the new technologies and practices promoted by Daraja and Twaweza have reported increased yields and reduced production costs.

2. Increased income: Farmers who have improved their productivity have also seen an increase in their income. For example, some farmers who have adopted greenhouse farming have reported up to four times the income they earned from traditional farming methods.
3. Improved nutrition: The promotion of nutrient-rich crops has led to improved nutrition among vulnerable groups such as children and pregnant women.
4.b The promotion of climate-smart agriculture practices helps farmers to adapt to the effects of climate change and maintain their livelihoods.

1. Increased crop yields: By promoting sustainable agriculture practices such as conservation agriculture, crop rotation, and use of improved seeds, Daraja Twaweza may have helped farmers in East Africa increase their crop yields. According to a report by the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO), sustainable agriculture practices can increase crop yields by 79% on average.

2.  Increased income: By promoting sustainable agriculture practices and providing farmers with training and access to markets, Daraja Twaweza may have helped increase the income of farmers in East Africa. According to a study by the International Food Policy Research Institute (IFPRI), sustainable agriculture practices can increase farmers' income by up to 35%.

3. Improved soil health: Sustainable agriculture practices promoted by Daraja Twaweza may have helped improve soil health in East Africa. According to the FAO, sustainable agriculture practices can help improve soil fertility, reduce soil erosion, and increase the soil's capacity to hold water and nutrients.

6437,c-1,Drone monitoring to optimize agricultural produce.,11/1/23,11/1/23,3,,222,KEN,2,temidayo.ibitoye@undp.org,Kenya,"1. Increased crop yields: Technoserve reports that farmers who have adopted improved farming practices have seen significant increases in crop yields. For example, farmers growing maize have seen yield increases of up to 100%, while those growing beans have seen yield increases of up to 70%.

2. Increased incomes: By increasing crop yields, Technoserve has helped farmers increase their incomes. Farmers who have adopted improved farming practices have reported income increases of up to 80%.

3. Improved access to markets: Technoserve has also worked to help farmers connect with buyers and access markets for their crops. By facilitating linkages between farmers and buyers, Technoserve has helped farmers earn higher prices for their crops and access new markets.

4. Increased adoption of technology: Technoserve has promoted the use of technology in agriculture, such as mobile apps for accessing market information and weather forecasts. By helping farmers adopt new technologies, Technoserve has enabled them to make better decisions and improve their farming practices",,"Drone monitoring to optimize agricultural produce.
Drone monitoring to optimize agricultural produce.
Qualitative Results of the Innovation Solution

1. Increased crop yields: Technoserve reports that farmers who have adopted improved farming practices have seen significant increases in crop yields. For example, farmers growing maize have seen yield increases of up to 100%, while those growing beans have seen yield increases of up to 70%.

2. Increased incomes: By increasing crop yields, Technoserve has helped farmers increase their incomes. Farmers who have adopted improved farming practices have reported income increases of up to 80%.

3. Improved access to markets: Technoserve has also worked to help farmers connect with buyers and access markets for their crops. By facilitating linkages between farmers and buyers, Technoserve has helped farmers earn higher prices for their crops and access new markets.

4. Increased adoption of technology: Technoserve has promoted the use of technology in agriculture, such as mobile apps for accessing market information and weather forecasts. By helping farmers adopt new technologies, Technoserve has enabled them to make better decisions and improve their farming practices

1. Increased farmer income: TechnoServe works with farmers to improve their productivity, access to markets, and income. For example, in Ethiopia, TechnoServe worked with coffee farmers to improve the quality of their coffee and access international markets. This led to a 35% increase in coffee prices and a 50% increase in farmer income (source: TechnoServe Annual Report 2019).

2. Improved access to finance: TechnoServe provides technical assistance to small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) in the agriculture sector to improve their business operations and access to finance. For example, in Tanzania, TechnoServe worked with an agribusiness to develop a business plan and access financing. As a result, the agribusiness was able to increase its production of cassava by 50% and its revenue by 40% (source: TechnoServe Impact Report 2018).

3. Increased agricultural productivity: TechnoServe provides training and technical assistance to farmers to improve their agricultural practices and increase their productivity. For example, in Kenya, TechnoServe worked with dairy farmers to improve their feeding and breeding practices, leading to a 30% increase in milk production (source: TechnoServe Impact Report 2018).

4. Job creation: Techno Serve's work in agriculture innovation has led to the creation of jobs in the sector. For example, in Uganda, TechnoServe worked with an agribusiness to develop a business plan and access financing. This led to the creation of 55 new jobs in the agribusiness (source: TechnoServe Annual Report 2019).

5. Improved food security: TechnoServe's work in agriculture innovation has contributed to improved food security in East Africa. For example, in Ethiopia, TechnoServe worked with farmers to improve their productivity and access to markets. This led to an increase in food production and a decrease in food insecurity in the region (source: TechnoServe Annual Report 2019).
Gulu, Mbale, Soroti, Hoima, Arua, Masindi, Kabale, Lira and Moroto Municipalities.

6436,c-1,Financial inclusion and credit Scoring,11/1/23,10/4/24,3,,222,KEN,2,temidayo.ibitoye@undp.org,Kenya,"1. Increased agricultural productivity: Juhudi Kilimo's loans have enabled smallholder farmers to access modern farming inputs, such as improved seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides. As a result, farmers have been able to increase their crop yields and enhance their income. According to a study by the International Food Policy Research Institute, farmers who received loans from Juhudi Kilimo increased their crop yields by up to 46%.

2. Adoption of new farming technologies: Juhudi Kilimo has introduced farmers to innovative farming technologies, such as drip irrigation and greenhouse farming. These technologies have enabled farmers to grow crops throughout the year, leading to increased income and food security. According to Juhudi Kilimo's impact report, over 11,000 farmers have adopted drip irrigation technology, leading to a 40% increase in crop yields.

3. Improved access to markets: Juhudi Kilimo has facilitated access to markets for smallholder farmers by providing training on market-oriented agriculture and linking farmers to buyers. This has enabled farmers to get better prices for their produce, leading to increased income. According to Juhudi Kilimo's impact report, farmers who received loans from the organization increased their income by an average of 37%.

4. Increased financial inclusion: Juhudi Kilimo's microfinance model has enabled smallholder farmers to access credit, which was previously unavailable to them. This has improved financial inclusion among rural communities and enabled them to invest in their farming enterprises. According to Juhudi Kilimo's impact report, the organization has disbursed over Ksh. 14 billion in loans, enabling over 400,000 farmers to access credit.",,"Financial inclusion and credit Scoring
Qualitative Results of the Innovation Solution

1. Increased agricultural productivity: Juhudi Kilimo's loans have enabled smallholder farmers to access modern farming inputs, such as improved seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides. As a result, farmers have been able to increase their crop yields and enhance their income. According to a study by the International Food Policy Research Institute, farmers who received loans from Juhudi Kilimo increased their crop yields by up to 46%.

2. Adoption of new farming technologies: Juhudi Kilimo has introduced farmers to innovative farming technologies, such as drip irrigation and greenhouse farming. These technologies have enabled farmers to grow crops throughout the year, leading to increased income and food security. According to Juhudi Kilimo's impact report, over 11,000 farmers have adopted drip irrigation technology, leading to a 40% increase in crop yields.

3. Improved access to markets: Juhudi Kilimo has facilitated access to markets for smallholder farmers by providing training on market-oriented agriculture and linking farmers to buyers. This has enabled farmers to get better prices for their produce, leading to increased income. According to Juhudi Kilimo's impact report, farmers who received loans from the organization increased their income by an average of 37%.

4. Increased financial inclusion: Juhudi Kilimo's microfinance model has enabled smallholder farmers to access credit, which was previously unavailable to them. This has improved financial inclusion among rural communities and enabled them to invest in their farming enterprises. According to Juhudi Kilimo's impact report, the organization has disbursed over Ksh. 14 billion in loans, enabling over 400,000 farmers to access credit.

1. Increased Access to Finance: Microfinance institutions like Juhudi Kilimo have increased access to finance for small-scale farmers and agribusinesses. According to a report by the World Bank, microfinance has helped over 16 million clients in East Africa access financial services, with over $8 billion in loans disbursed.

2. Improved Agricultural Productivity: Improved access to finance has led to increased investment in agricultural productivity. According to the same World Bank report, microfinance has helped over 600,000 small-scale farmers in East Africa increase their productivity and income.

3. Expansion of Agribusinesses: Access to finance has also enabled small-scale farmers to expand their businesses and invest in new technologies and inputs. According to a study by the International Finance Corporation (IFC), microfinance has helped to create over 1.1 million new jobs in East Africa's agriculture sector.

4. Improved Food Security: The increased productivity and expansion of agribusinesses have also contributed to improved food security in the region. According to the United Nations, the number of undernourished people in East Africa decreased from 33 million in 2015 to 28 million in 2019.

5. Environmental Sustainability: Microfinance has also played a role in promoting environmentally sustainable agricultural practices. According to the IFC, microfinance institutions have provided financing for investments in renewable energy and energy efficiency in the agriculture sector in East Africa.

1.  Increased adoption of modern farming practices: Through its farmer education programs, the Okuafo Foundation has helped smallholder farmers adopt modern and sustainable farming practices. For example, the foundation's training on good agricultural practices has led to a 20% increase in crop yield among participating farmers.

2. Improved access to finance: The foundation has partnered with financial institutions to provide smallholder farmers with access to credit and other financial services. This has enabled farmers to invest in their farms and increase productivity. As a result, farmers who have accessed credit through the foundation have seen an average increase in their incomes of 25%.

Increase in income and adoption of new technologies: Through its partnerships with companies such as Coca-Cola, Nestle, and Unilever, the foundation has helped farmers to secure long-term contracts and access new markets. This has resulted in a 30% increase in farmers' incomes in some cases. The foundation's use of mobile-based extension services has led to a 50% increase in farmers' adoption of new technologies.

6426,c-12,Oi Kambas App,10/30/23,10/31/23,3,,,AGO,2,eneida.lima@undp.org,Angola,"Oi Kambas is a smartphone app created to be a safe and accessible space, that aims to educate adolescents and young people 10-25 years old, about sexual and reproductive health and aims to support the reduction the adolescent fertility rate (163 births per 1,000 girls aged 15-19) in Angola, one of the largest in the region. ",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/ae0a481e-a281-4ae4-b2a4-4dd4ad371a3a/71126bf53faa7f66b35c260dea93fe39.png,"Oi Kambas App

Oi Kambas is a smartphone app created to be a safe and accessible space, that aims to educate adolescents and young people 10-25 years old, about sexual and reproductive health and aims to support the reduction the adolescent fertility rate (163 births per 1,000 girls aged 15-19) in Angola, one of the largest in the region.

Oi Kambas aims to improve the lives of adolescents and young people in Angola through their empowerment providing key information and access to services allowing them to make better and more informed decisions about their bodies and their sexual and reproductive health and rights.

Launched in Angola in June 2022, it is now available in Cabo Verde, Guinea-Bissau, Mozambique, Namibia, South Africa, Zambia, and Zimbabwe. Content follows CSE guidance classification and focuses primarily on:
Other content areas are Gender equality and GBV, body integrity, consent, privacy, and violence. The App has Five features:
- Information on sexuality, sexual and reproductive health - health and well-being;
- Relationships and the body - My knowledge;
- Referenced health services and adolescent and youth friendly centers - My services;
- Space for menstrual health management, medical appointments and medications - My health;
- Space to share stories, testimonies - My voice;
- Direct access to talk to SMS JOVEM counselors - My voice.
Its download is free for android, and the app can be used without internet access.

5883,c-31,The dry toilet for the resilience of flood victims in Senegal,1/24/23,12/20/23,2,,,SEN,2,aminata.ba2@undp.org,Senegal,"In times of flooding, people especially women are faced with a crucial problem: access to toilets. A start-up has designed the ""dry toilet"" which allows flood victims to preserve their dignity. The principle of the design is based on the elevation above the level of the house and the integration of a biodigester ",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/2b6f0ea5-a774-4f23-b5ae-23da7b3d6f53/b9f27a36e85de5c68cf003291d2dbb74.jpg,"The dry toilet for the resilience of flood victims in Senegal

In times of flooding, people especially women are faced with a crucial problem: access to toilets. A start-up has designed the ""dry toilet"" which allows flood victims to preserve their dignity. The principle of the design is based on the elevation above the level of the house and the integration of a biodigester

The Digester dry toilet consists of a digester, a superstructure, a hand-washing device, and layers of filters that treat the effluent generated by the system. The digester is the key component of the toilet, which breaks down the manure on-site through an aerobic process without adding any chemicals. After each visit to the toilet, the porous filter in the digester quickly separates the solid from the liquid part. The solid part (feces, toilet paper, etc.) is retained by the filter of the digester and degraded by micro-organisms (bacteria) and macro-organisms (e.g. earthworms) and then converted into rich soil improvers that can be used without danger for the soil.

Nevertheless, this fertilizer can only be recovered after two to three years of the digester's operation, corresponding to its maintenance period. As for the liquid part, it seeps directly through the filtering belts of the digester to be drained into a sand filter for further treatment or into a sump.

In addition, the excreta can be used as a Biofertilizer for farmers for better agricultural yields and/or used for the production of Biogas for households to fight against abusive deforestation in rural areas and urban areas the biogas can be used by restaurant owners.

5759,c-34,Smart O' ou jardin smart,11/17/22,10/31/24,3,,,NER,2,assane.boukar@undp.org,Niger,"Le Smart O' est un dispositif développer par l'entreprise IPREN dans le but de faciliter l'irrigation aux acteurs agricoles. Ce produit vient révolutionner les pratiques agricoles et permettre aux producteurs de booster leurs rendements par :
- la multiplication par huit (8) des zones de cultures et de facto la multiplication des rendements et des revenus agricoles ;
- la maitrise et une meilleure utilisation de la nappe d'eau disponible ;  la réduction des charges de travail ;
- l'automatisation de l'irrigation sur toute les surfaces cultivées.
Le Smart O', c'est l'agriculture intelligente, innovante et facile d'accès.
Le Smart est une première au Niger et dans la sous-région par :
-  Son contrôle de l'irrigation à distance et partout dans le monde;
- Une programmation de l'irrigation sur un (1) ans ;
- un dispositif avec huit (8) vannes autonomes ;
- des programmations en fonctions de la température ambiante ;

- et une utilisation manuelle comme automatique donc facile d'accès.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  ",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/2817119a-f880-4b4e-97cc-103ae4a24a3b/94386bfbcc574496d8473c1210ad4ad5.png,"Smart O' ou jardin smart

- la multiplication par huit (8) des zones de cultures et de facto la multiplication des rendements et des revenus agricoles ;
- la maitrise et une meilleure utilisation de la nappe d'eau disponible ;  la réduction des charges de travail ;
- l'automatisation de l'irrigation sur toute les surfaces cultivées.
Le Smart O', c'est l'agriculture intelligente, innovante et facile d'accès.
Le Smart est une première au Niger et dans la sous-région par :
-  Son contrôle de l'irrigation à distance et partout dans le monde;
- Une programmation de l'irrigation sur un (1) ans ;
- un dispositif avec huit (8) vannes autonomes ;

- et une utilisation manuelle comme automatique donc facile d'accès.

5753,c-19,"""Banqas"" ou ""les branches de la mer"" pour sauver les piroguiers",11/17/22,2/14/23,2,,,SEN,0,hassanatou.ba@live.fr,Senegal,"Cette solution est une réponse aux disparitions fréquentes des pécheurs artisanaux en haute mer. Le système est une planche en plastique équipée d'un GPS, projecteur de lumière et de bandes auxquelles 8 à 10 pêcheurs peuvent s'agripper en cas de chavirement de leur pirogue. Dès qu'il est activé, le système lance un message à une entreprise qui alerte les secours notamment la Marine. ",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/7540db86-59d5-4db7-9809-34e706ec05a7/4d64902614abc798b79d0d370fc48905.png,"""Banqas"" ou ""les branches de la mer"" pour sauver les piroguiers

Cette solution est une réponse aux disparitions fréquentes des pécheurs artisanaux en haute mer. Le système est une planche en plastique équipée d'un GPS, projecteur de lumière et de bandes auxquelles 8 à 10 pêcheurs peuvent s'agripper en cas de chavirement de leur pirogue. Dès qu'il est activé, le système lance un message à une entreprise qui alerte les secours notamment la Marine.

5752,c-19,"""Penccum Ndokh"" Restaurer la biodiversité et la nature sur une décharge",11/17/22,7/9/24,3,,,SEN,0,hassanatou.ba@live.fr,Senegal,"La solution consiste en une transformation radicale d'une vielle décharge sauvage de 20 ans en un espace public de revitalisation de la biodiversité que la population utilise pour se détendre, se réunir ou organiser des événements. Avec le soutien de jeunes bénévoles, la décharge installée sur une partie d'une vallée asséchée, a été nettoyée pendant au moins trois ans avant d'être restaurée dans son état actuel. Les oiseaux et les poissons ont déjà commencé à reconquérir l’espace aquatique.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/7540db86-59d5-4db7-9809-34e706ec05a7/93347c6080a015ddb9b6ff2688b67f67.jpeg,"""Penccum Ndokh"" Restaurer la biodiversité et la nature sur une décharge

La solution consiste en une transformation radicale d'une vielle décharge sauvage de 20 ans en un espace public de revitalisation de la biodiversité que la population utilise pour se détendre, se réunir ou organiser des événements. Avec le soutien de jeunes bénévoles, la décharge installée sur une partie d'une vallée asséchée, a été nettoyée pendant au moins trois ans avant d'être restaurée dans son état actuel. Les oiseaux et les poissons ont déjà commencé à reconquérir l’espace aquatique.

5750,c-22,MRI Uganda: locally constructed MRI for Babies with hydrocephalus,11/17/22,1/16/23,3,,,UGA,2,hadijah.nabbale@undp.org,Uganda,"Mbarara University of Science and Technology Biomedical Engineers designed a low-Field Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) machine that is said to be the preferred diagnostic method for infant hydrocephalus. This is low-cost MRI technology is under development by reducing the strength of the magnetic field and the use of alternative technologies to create the magnetic field which is cheaper in terms of cost and uses less power. The final design was validated by stakeholders from the Ugandan Healthcare Authorities.

,https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/40119c91-a65d-46a8-b910-383024e2ca6c/07f7640a18acd3d1ad036cd4b4817777.jpg,MRI Uganda: locally constructed MRI for Babies with hydrocephalus

Mbarara University of Science and Technology Biomedical Engineers designed a low-Field Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) machine that is said to be the preferred diagnostic method for infant hydrocephalus. This is low-cost MRI technology is under development by reducing the strength of the magnetic field and the use of alternative technologies to create the magnetic field which is cheaper in terms of cost and uses less power. The final design was validated by stakeholders from the Ugandan Healthcare Authorities.

5608,c-34,Kizha Intregrate farm_Race Taureau,9/30/22,2/9/23,3,,,NER,2,assane.boukar@undp.org,Niger,"kizha Intregrate farm est une ferme intégré qui vise son autonomisation à travers une agriculture et un élevage vert et durable. La maitrise de l'eau est entre autres un facteur clé dans la réussite des activités agrosylvopastoral au Niger. Dans le souci de protection de l'environnement Kizha produit ses aliments bétails dans la ferme à partir de sa production fourragère qui se fait toute l'année grâce à un système d'irrigation utilisant l’énergie solaire mais aussi le gaz. La bouse des bétails est amassée dans une fosse fumière puis utilisé pour enrichir le sol nous utilisons aussi système de mulch aucun ENGRAI CHIMIQUE n'est utilisé et très prochainement l'installation d'un système de production de biogaz qui sera utilisé par le système d'irrigation, l'installation d'une unité de transformation fruitiers les déchets issus seront aussi utiliser pour l'enrichissement du sol.  Kizha c'est la création d'emplois permanent, la sensibilisation des plus jeune dans la protection de l'enivrement à travers un agro business responsable et qui respecte l’environnement à travers une économie circulaire, Kizha se veut être une ferme complètement autonome écologique.  La promotrice de cette ferme a innové dans la sélection des races de vache au Niger. C’est qui l’a value le second prix de la BAGRI meilleurs jeunes producteurs exposants / Elevage pour un taureau croisé Race Goudali x Race Holstein de la foire nationale du Niger de l’édition 2022 (7eme édition du Sahel Niger). Ce taureau est le fruit d’une insémination artificielle avec pour « père » les semences d’un mâle de race Holstein, fournies par le Programme National d’Amélioration Génétique (PNAG) et pour « mère » une femelle de race Goudali. La race Holstein est de robe pie (noir et blanc), la race Goudali est de robe blanc-gris, mais le descendant est tout noir. L’objectif de cette insémination est d’assurer une bonne production de lait et de viande, mais aussi d’avoir des sujets aptes à la traction animale. Ce taureau est âgé de 4 ans, 10 mois. Il a un poids estimé à 864 kg et une hauteur au garrot de 1,60 m. L’animal est bien dressé, docile. Il est utilisé pour le labour et peut labourer un hectare par jou  ",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/2817119a-f880-4b4e-97cc-103ae4a24a3b/1b9ad98a056768a1240f8373bed8ac51.jpg,"Kizha Intregrate farm_Race Taureau

kizha Intregrate farm est une ferme intégré qui vise son autonomisation à travers une agriculture et un élevage vert et durable. La maitrise de l'eau est entre autres un facteur clé dans la réussite des activités agrosylvopastoral au Niger. Dans le souci de protection de l'environnement Kizha produit ses aliments bétails dans la ferme à partir de sa production fourragère qui se fait toute l'année grâce à un système d'irrigation utilisant l’énergie solaire mais aussi le gaz. La bouse des bétails est amassée dans une fosse fumière puis utilisé pour enrichir le sol nous utilisons aussi système de mulch aucun ENGRAI CHIMIQUE n'est utilisé et très prochainement l'installation d'un système de production de biogaz qui sera utilisé par le système d'irrigation, l'installation d'une unité de transformation fruitiers les déchets issus seront aussi utiliser pour l'enrichissement du sol.  Kizha c'est la création d'emplois permanent, la sensibilisation des plus jeune dans la protection de l'enivrement à travers un agro business responsable et qui respecte l’environnement à travers une économie circulaire, Kizha se veut être une ferme complètement autonome écologique.  La promotrice de cette ferme a innové dans la sélection des races de vache au Niger. C’est qui l’a value le second prix de la BAGRI meilleurs jeunes producteurs exposants / Elevage pour un taureau croisé Race Goudali x Race Holstein de la foire nationale du Niger de l’édition 2022 (7eme édition du Sahel Niger). Ce taureau est le fruit d’une insémination artificielle avec pour « père » les semences d’un mâle de race Holstein, fournies par le Programme National d’Amélioration Génétique (PNAG) et pour « mère » une femelle de race Goudali. La race Holstein est de robe pie (noir et blanc), la race Goudali est de robe blanc-gris, mais le descendant est tout noir. L’objectif de cette insémination est d’assurer une bonne production de lait et de viande, mais aussi d’avoir des sujets aptes à la traction animale. Ce taureau est âgé de 4 ans, 10 mois. Il a un poids estimé à 864 kg et une hauteur au garrot de 1,60 m. L’animal est bien dressé, docile. Il est utilisé pour le labour et peut labourer un hectare par jou

5607,c-11,Puzzle Energy de Boké,9/29/22,1/16/23,3,,,GIN,2,camara.moussa@undp.org,Guinea,"La solution énergétique par la fabrication d’un générateur électrique grâce à l’assemblage divers équipements et objets locaux. Cette solution énergétique est une initiative de monsieur N’Famara Touré, ingénieur   mécanique et ses collaborateurs qui ont mis en place un réseau de production et de distribution d’électrique alternative qui dessert des centaines de PME et de familles à Boké. Le dispositif est composé de d’un moteur de batteuse agricole modifié (le modèle 1115) ; d’un système de refroidissement à l’aide de deux cuves d’eau et un circuit électrique monophasée. Avec une gestion en forme de parrainage et une desserte allant de 6H du matin à 18h avec une pause de 30mn entre 16 et 17H ; de sorte à combler les 24H contre seulement 8h par la compagnie d’électricité nationale EDG. Trois quartiers couverts, un centre de santé, un marché avec plus de 800 ménages abonnés. Le coût global de l’investissement est estimé à 20 000 000 Gnf ; le tout entretenu par 15 personnes directement.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/a6f58a0b-c389-41db-8d24-aef6580a6877/3e9490be69bc1af2ce053a12f82ae5c9.jpg,"Puzzle Energy de Boké

La solution énergétique par la fabrication d’un générateur électrique grâce à l’assemblage divers équipements et objets locaux. Cette solution énergétique est une initiative de monsieur N’Famara Touré, ingénieur   mécanique et ses collaborateurs qui ont mis en place un réseau de production et de distribution d’électrique alternative qui dessert des centaines de PME et de familles à Boké. Le dispositif est composé de d’un moteur de batteuse agricole modifié (le modèle 1115) ; d’un système de refroidissement à l’aide de deux cuves d’eau et un circuit électrique monophasée. Avec une gestion en forme de parrainage et une desserte allant de 6H du matin à 18h avec une pause de 30mn entre 16 et 17H ; de sorte à combler les 24H contre seulement 8h par la compagnie d’électricité nationale EDG. Trois quartiers couverts, un centre de santé, un marché avec plus de 800 ménages abonnés. Le coût global de l’investissement est estimé à 20 000 000 Gnf ; le tout entretenu par 15 personnes directement.

5367,c-37,Ndinda Gully Rehabilitation Project ,7/22/22,10/25/23,3,,159,SWZ,2,nontobeko.mlangeni@undp.org,Eswatini,"Smallholder Market-Led Project (SMLP) - Eswatini Water and Agriculture Development Enterprise (ESWADE).

What is the name of the solution holder? (main contact person, if multiple)
Smallholder Market-Led Project (SMLP) - Eswatini Water and Agriculture Development Enterprise (ESWADE).
Ndinda Community / Chiefdom ; Contact person, Mandla Mkhatshwa, 7615 0575.
What is the address and preferred way to contact the solution holder?
Does the solution holder have any institutional affiliation in country?
What is the purpose of the solution? (brief problem & solution description)

The Ndinda Chiefdom is one of the most degraded areas characterized by large gullies. Due to the rainfall in the past season and deep soils in the area, the gully has expanded causing rampant erosion in the area. Therefore, the purpose of the solution is to solve the challenges of erosion.

ACDP development with the support of UNDP revealed the challenges of SLM issues as the main ones. The solution was a result of the needs identified as part of the Chiefdom development process.  This was the biggest danger which needed machinery as the problem is a result of poor drainage.

The focus here was also aimed for skills transfer as the project involves local labour from the community. The aim is to also fence the place for environmental benefits such as planting of fruit trees and grass to create the necessary ground cover to prevent further erosion.

5361,c-34,BIODIGESTEUR_MENAGE,7/20/22,1/16/23,2,,,NER,2,assane.boukar@undp.org,Niger,"Le biodigesteur est un dispositif technique qui sert à la transformation des injections animales (bouse de vache et crottin de porcs) ou autres résidus organiques en biogaz. Ce gaz est utilisable pour la cuisson des aliments  et de l’éclairage. Le mélange de bouse de vache et d’eau qui libère du méthane qui est un gaz qui s’accumule dans le dôme et exerce une pression sur la bouse dégradée qui transite de manière hydraulique dans le bassin de sortie.  En effet, la technologie du biodigesteur est composée d’un bassin d’entrée, du digesteur, d’un dôme, d’un bassin de sortie, des fosses à compost et le réseau de plomberie qui conduit le biogaz aux différents points d’utilisation.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/2817119a-f880-4b4e-97cc-103ae4a24a3b/413cbcf53e1b82676fb66e3ec5c56c95.jpg,"BIODIGESTEUR_MENAGE

Le biodigesteur est un dispositif technique qui sert à la transformation des injections animales (bouse de vache et crottin de porcs) ou autres résidus organiques en biogaz. Ce gaz est utilisable pour la cuisson des aliments  et de l’éclairage. Le mélange de bouse de vache et d’eau qui libère du méthane qui est un gaz qui s’accumule dans le dôme et exerce une pression sur la bouse dégradée qui transite de manière hydraulique dans le bassin de sortie.  En effet, la technologie du biodigesteur est composée d’un bassin d’entrée, du digesteur, d’un dôme, d’un bassin de sortie, des fosses à compost et le réseau de plomberie qui conduit le biogaz aux différents points d’utilisation.

5202,c-22,ECOCA Digital Solar Powered Cooker - Pesitho,6/15/22,10/4/24,3,,159,UGA,2,hadijah.nabbale@undp.org,Uganda,"The ECOCA is a compact, self-contained, multi-purpose home cooking unit, run by solar energy. It is to be imagined as a fully working kitchen, which can provide an entire family in a rural area with food and electricity throughout the whole day.  It consists of an electric base, which includes a battery pack, a solar panel array, and a highly insulated cooking pot that can keep food warm for hours.  ECOCA came in to solve the deforestation problem in the refugee settlement. It won the grant to design the solution. It is housed at CARITAS Uganda, as this made it easy for project coordination of the projects being run by the organization in the refugee settlements.  The ECOCA is the world’s first off-grid solar energy cooker is powered by a 275 watts panel that harvests energy from the sun. It consists of a 400W pot with an underneath heater. The pot is a double insulated pan which saves over 89% of energy.  The cooking set also comes with 3 Led lamps with USB ports, 5-meter-long cables, a movable solar light, and a portable torch.  The whole system is designed in Denmark under the Pesitho company. Manufacturing of parts is done in China and assembling is done in Uganda.  The stove has 3 cooking levels in which;  Level 1- For warming food  Level 2- For cooking soft foods  Level 3- For cooking hard or longer cooking foods.  The pot has sensors to lower heat and conserve energy facilitated by an inbuilt thermostat. Food cannot get burnt.  The ECOCA currently has 3 versions. The first version failed to cook beans and subsequently, there has been an improved version. ",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/40119c91-a65d-46a8-b910-383024e2ca6c/347437c69273485d7619d4139ba37b32.jpg,"ECOCA Digital Solar Powered Cooker - Pesitho
What is the name of the solution holder? (main contact person, if multiple)
ECOCA Digital Solar Powered Cooker - Ruth Komuntale
What is the address and preferred way to contact the solution holder?
Does the solution holder have any institutional affiliation in country?
Uganda National Alliance on Clean Cooking (UNACC)
What is the purpose of the solution? (brief problem & solution description)

The ECOCA is a compact, self-contained, multi-purpose home cooking unit, run by solar energy. It is to be imagined as a fully working kitchen, which can provide an entire family in a rural area with food and electricity throughout the whole day.  It consists of an electric base, which includes a battery pack, a solar panel array, and a highly insulated cooking pot that can keep food warm for hours.  ECOCA came in to solve the deforestation problem in the refugee settlement. It won the grant to design the solution. It is housed at CARITAS Uganda, as this made it easy for project coordination of the projects being run by the organization in the refugee settlements.  The ECOCA is the world’s first off-grid solar energy cooker is powered by a 275 watts panel that harvests energy from the sun. It consists of a 400W pot with an underneath heater. The pot is a double insulated pan which saves over 89% of energy.  The cooking set also comes with 3 Led lamps with USB ports, 5-meter-long cables, a movable solar light, and a portable torch.  The whole system is designed in Denmark under the Pesitho company. Manufacturing of parts is done in China and assembling is done in Uganda.  The stove has 3 cooking levels in which;  Level 1- For warming food  Level 2- For cooking soft foods  Level 3- For cooking hard or longer cooking foods.  The pot has sensors to lower heat and conserve energy facilitated by an inbuilt thermostat. Food cannot get burnt.  The ECOCA currently has 3 versions. The first version failed to cook beans and subsequently, there has been an improved version.

The following ECOCA units have already been installed and in use: * 500 in Bidibidi refugee settlement under the Pesitho, ECOCA East Africa, Caritas Denmark and Caritas Uganda partnership; *60 in Kyangwali under the Pesitho/Ecoca East Africa, Care Denmark and Care Uganda; *100 in Rakai with Community Integrated Development Initiative (CIDI); * Another 225 in Bidibidi refugee settlement with the Mercy Corps partnership; another *An additional 50 units at CIDI for the commercial market; and * 230 units in Malawi under the World Food Program partnership. Beneficiaries of the ECOCA are always excited to give feedback on the technology and some of their testimonies have been referred to in the link below.

What is the purpose of the solution? (brief problem & solution description)

Problème : Le problème que nous essayons de résoudre est la pénurie de l’électricité et l’accès à l’eau dans les zones rurales en Mauritanie ou 87 % de cette population n’a pas l’accès à l’électricité. Et également la lutte contre les feux de brousse causés le plus souvent par l’utilisation des bougies ou des lampes à pétroles et leur remplacement par des lampes solaires. Solution: Solar- Ecobat est une  entreprise dans le domaine d'énergie solaire créée par une jeune femme ingénieure écoénergétique et basée à Nouakchott. Nous réalisons des études et installations de kits solaires autonomes pour électrification et pompage solaire en milieu rural principalement.

Il s’agit d’un projet de production de biogaz et d’engrais bio à partir de collecte du déchets organique, le but de ce projet c’est la protection de l’environnement et réduire les émissions de dioxyde de carbone, ainsi que de crée des opportunités d’emploi. Ce projet vient pour lutter contre la problématique de la coupe des arbre qui est une source alternative d'énenrgie surtout au niveau rural, ainsi qu'une lutte contre les changement climatique en presevant l'environement ( Ozone).

Our friend N'Danè as illustrated here on the pics, has created an agregetor able to associate three inputs power levels and collect from the output the required level according to the usage needs.
