In general case, for remote actions we see in the movies it is all about connected houses. Some households in Africa and most part of the world are wasting energy just because the owner forgot to switch off the power before leaving the place. In France, Out of 250,000 annual fires, 80,000 are of electrical origin. 40% of the victims are children under 9 years old.  So to avoid such kind of problem and taking in consideration that power is very expensive ressource that should be well managed, here is a proposition of Power management with a GSM mobile phone. all you need is to send an SMS of instruction that is going to enable the requested action. So if you have to switch off any electrical component remotely, and you just have GSM coverage, this is yours!

Renewable Energy laboratory, University of Dschang.
Does the solution holder have any institutional affiliation in country?
What is the purpose of the solution? (brief problem & solution description)

Too much heat losses from conventional three stone fireplaces and other energy efficient stoves. Our scientific and technological analysis in the laboratory indicates that the most performant energy efficient stoves   have an overall energy transfer rate of maximum only 25 % meaning that much of the heat supplied to the cooking pot is wasted. I am proposing a locally made heavily insulated  cooking, baking, and pipe water heating rocket stove with proper heat flow which increases the energy transfer rate efficiency  to 60%

What is the unit cost of this Solution along with any additional cost for maintenance and training?
The unit cost if 250,000 Frs CFA with no maintenance costs. However if massed produced with a small iron smelting plant the cost could get down to 200000 frs CFA.
Is this solution a prototype or product?
If this solution is a product, is it available in the market (off the shelf) or advance order has to be given?
Advance order has to be given
What is the Technological Readiness Level (TRL) of this solution?

Technical and economic feasibilities both positive. All materials of construction are readily available in most villages. However the heat exchanger pipe that heats water and also acts as chimney has to be sourced in big cities
How much has this solution already been diffused? Is there potential feedback from end-users available?

?Publication on social media has received over 5000 views and 300 commentaries. A few have been installed in Yaounde, and foumban since this stove was developed a year ago. Was recently (two weeks ago) presented in an international conference at the Pan African Climate Justice Alliance in Nairobi, Kenya.  We have received another invitation for a conference in Kigali at the PACJA commonwealth heads of state conference from June 20 to June 25th 2022
Please upload a picture of end-user feedback
Please upload a link of end-user feedback

Are there any efficiency benchmarks for this solution (eg. how much energy does it save; how much cheaper does it produce energy than current market rates/ current household expenditure / cost per kW h)?

Our laboratory analyses and tests energy efficient stoves for the public. We hardly get any stove with an efficiency of up to 25 percent. This one is 60 percent. This gives even 60 percent wood savings compared, to other stoves.
Are there any other potential bottlenecks affecting cross-border or in country diffusion of this solution?
No particular bottlenecks however scarcity of cast iron plates might hinder mass production. We however have a cast iron smelting plant now which will soon go operational.

What is the purpose of the solution? (brief problem & solution description)

In Guinea, electricity is existing long time ago but with covarage holes. Added to that, in the special rural area, to mitigate power supply need and the management problem to avoid public light being active for 24H in so that the rest of the  population could be served. CONDE has decided to set available his auto-managed Public Lights.  Composed by a LED lightning  and  220 to 12V converter, this solution can be reproduced in different format. It's particularity is the sensor incorporated in the converter that enables the switching to light when dakness comes or OFF when day light is felt. Using it can help decrease the consumption and waste of electricity.

What is the purpose of the solution? (brief problem & solution description)

Too much heat losses from conventional three stone fireplaces and other energy efficient stoves. Our scientific and technological analysis in the laboratory indicates that the most performant energy efficient stoves   have an overall energy transfer rate of maximum only 25 % meaning that much of the heat supplied to the cooking pot is wasted. I am proposing a locally made heavily insulated rocket stove with proper heat flow which increases the energy transfer rate efficiency  to 40%

The unit cost if 45,000 Frs with no maintenance costs. However if massed produced with a small iron smelting plant the cost could get down to 25000 frs. Important to state that we recommend sheet metal thickness of 3mm which is quite expensive now in the market but very durable.

5122,c-30,Environmentally friendly coal manufacturing,6/10/22,10/4/24,3,,159,CMR,2,anna.ojong@undp.org,Cameroon,"10 years ago, women and girls in rural areas of Cameroon's Far North region were barely 2 km away to get wood for cooking meals. Today they are at least 15km. This strong pressure on forest cover is causing deforestation and the degradation of forest ecosystems, which in turn exacerbates the vulnerability of populations to the effects of climate change. Our solution is to offer an alternative fuel to the use of wood energy. Indeed, we recover organic waste (rice husk, millet stalk, corn stalk, cotton stalk, peanut shell...) in order to produce ecological charcoal which is an environmentally friendly fuel and meets the seventh objective of sustainable development (SDG 7). Our goal in the next two years is to replicate the solution in the North Cameroon region and the Adamawa region. Indeed, the problem of waste management is common in our communities and this solution that we propose is part of a logic of waste recovery for the proper management of waste.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/c3787e8a-95c0-4ca3-a6dc-e462e7337526/2e9b1b04321e07015f02ffad1cc8daeb.jpg,"Environmentally friendly coal manufacturing
What is the name of the solution holder? (main contact person, if multiple)
What is the address and preferred way to contact the solution holder?
Does the solution holder have any institutional affiliation in country?
Yes the solution is affiliated with an institution in Cameroon -Energy Solutions for All (ESA Services)
What is the purpose of the solution? (brief problem & solution description)

10 years ago, women and girls in rural areas of Cameroon's Far North region were barely 2 km away to get wood for cooking meals. Today they are at least 15km. This strong pressure on forest cover is causing deforestation and the degradation of forest ecosystems, which in turn exacerbates the vulnerability of populations to the effects of climate change. Our solution is to offer an alternative fuel to the use of wood energy. Indeed, we recover organic waste (rice husk, millet stalk, corn stalk, cotton stalk, peanut shell...) in order to produce ecological charcoal which is an environmentally friendly fuel and meets the seventh objective of sustainable development (SDG 7). Our goal in the next two years is to replicate the solution in the North Cameroon region and the Adamawa region. Indeed, the problem of waste management is common in our communities and this solution that we propose is part of a logic of waste recovery for the proper management of waste.

We sell a kilogram at 150cfa compared to that of wood whose prices vary from 300cfa to 500frs sometimes. The wood in the city of Maroua is sold in a small pile of about 03 twigs which is up to 100frs and can not make a meal

500 kg of the product is requested per day. A small amount of our product can be used to cook large amounts or more food for longer than regular charcoal or charcoal from other sources that usually burn faster and the consistency of the heat is not the same.

5120,c-30,BISOLAR TECH FRIDGE,6/9/22,10/4/24,3,,159,CMR,2,anna.ojong@undp.org,Cameroon,"More than 780 million people worldwide do not have access to reliable electricity, the FAO has estimated that around 50% percent of food products in Cameroon are lost between harvest and consumption due to inadequate conservation and storage. The necessary infrastructure for cold storage for vaccines and other medical goods remains insufficient in many of these areas. Our solution, Bi-Solar Tech Fridge is a 100% solar fridge that can work 24h a day without  using batteries. Made to create solar-powered cold storage units  for multiple applications, including pre-cooling, cold storage and charging a cold storage unit. ",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/c3787e8a-95c0-4ca3-a6dc-e462e7337526/b175621e1e2f0b88dea08284235ce5c6.jpg,"BISOLAR TECH FRIDGE

What is the purpose of the solution? (brief problem & solution description)

More than 780 million people worldwide do not have access to reliable electricity, the FAO has estimated that around 50% percent of food products in Cameroon are lost between harvest and consumption due to inadequate conservation and storage. The necessary infrastructure for cold storage for vaccines and other medical goods remains insufficient in many of these areas. Our solution, Bi-Solar Tech Fridge is a 100% solar fridge that can work 24h a day without  using batteries. Made to create solar-powered cold storage units  for multiple applications, including pre-cooling, cold storage and charging a cold storage unit.

5112,c-17,BITAM TORE,6/9/22,10/4/24,3,,159,BFA,2,abdoulaye.ouedraogo@undp.org,Burkina Faso,"C’est une technologie d’économie d’énergie. Elle a la capacité  de conservation la température de tous produits qu’on y met à l’intérieur et renfermé. Qu’elle soit chaude ou froide. De ce fait  il permet de conserver les repas au chaud et les produits frais périssables. Il est aussi utilisé pour l’auto cuisson des mets ; d’où son nom de Bitam toré en Langue nationale mooré. Il contribue à réduire la consommation du bois de chauffe, du charbon de bois et du gaz butane. En matière de cuisine, il réduit les corvées. Plus besoin de réchauffer les mets, de même qu’on a plus besoin de laisser les mets cuire à point. A 80% de cuisson, la marmite est retirée du feu et placer dans le Bitam toré, ou la cuisson va se poursuivre. ",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/e7e2a7be-5a45-4669-83f5-5539c538c020/97282572413924af5d1c16d992849ac2.jpg,"BITAM TORE

C’est une technologie d’économie d’énergie. Elle a la capacité  de conservation la température de tous produits qu’on y met à l’intérieur et renfermé. Qu’elle soit chaude ou froide. De ce fait  il permet de conserver les repas au chaud et les produits frais périssables. Il est aussi utilisé pour l’auto cuisson des mets ; d’où son nom de Bitam toré en Langue nationale mooré. Il contribue à réduire la consommation du bois de chauffe, du charbon de bois et du gaz butane. En matière de cuisine, il réduit les corvées. Plus besoin de réchauffer les mets, de même qu’on a plus besoin de laisser les mets cuire à point. A 80% de cuisson, la marmite est retirée du feu et placer dans le Bitam toré, ou la cuisson va se poursuivre.

5040,c-30,ASAAB THERMAL COOKER,6/7/22,10/4/24,3,,159,CMR,2,anna.ojong@undp.org,Cameroon,"Given the lack or scarcity of cooking fuels (wood, coal or gas) in the far north region of Cameroon, and the lack of autonomy among women, because women can no longer go about other occupations because they are constantly preparing. The problem of deforestation which is a direct impact on climate change. ASAAB which is an ultimate solution, is a non-electrical device with a cylindrical shape made from a fabric and several thermal insulators. It allows you to simmer good dishes of all kinds. To use the ASAAB cooker, a pot is first preheated normally to a fireplace (a stove, stove, wood or charcoal fireplace,..) to bring an initial cooking temperature for up to 10 minutes. At this stage, the pan or pot is removed from the fireplace and placed in the cooker where, due to insulation, the container remains close to the temperature at which it was removed from the fireplace for a period of time. The same goes for cold drinks.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/c3787e8a-95c0-4ca3-a6dc-e462e7337526/7640cfcfda24f498406f763938e6da58.jpg,"ASAAB THERMAL COOKER
What is the name of the solution holder? (main contact person, if multiple)
What is the address and preferred way to contact the solution holder?
Does the solution holder have any institutional affiliation in country?
What is the purpose of the solution? (brief problem & solution description)

Given the lack or scarcity of cooking fuels (wood, coal or gas) in the far north region of Cameroon, and the lack of autonomy among women, because women can no longer go about other occupations because they are constantly preparing. The problem of deforestation which is a direct impact on climate change. ASAAB which is an ultimate solution, is a non-electrical device with a cylindrical shape made from a fabric and several thermal insulators. It allows you to simmer good dishes of all kinds. To use the ASAAB cooker, a pot is first preheated normally to a fireplace (a stove, stove, wood or charcoal fireplace,..) to bring an initial cooking temperature for up to 10 minutes. At this stage, the pan or pot is removed from the fireplace and placed in the cooker where, due to insulation, the container remains close to the temperature at which it was removed from the fireplace for a period of time. The same goes for cold drinks.

After economic analysis, our ASAAB cooker is sold between 15000 FCFA and 25000 FCFA or between 23 £ and 39 £ about 33 US$ and 56 US$. On the other hand, the price of other thermal cookers already marketed is about 90 US$ and more or more than 40,500 FCFA.

About 100 samples sold out. Customer feedback is positive so far, as it permits women to multitask while cooking and has not risk of food or pot getting burnt.
Please upload a picture of end-user feedback

Are there any efficiency benchmarks for this solution (eg. how much energy does it save; how much cheaper does it produce energy than current market rates/ current household expenditure / cost per kW h)?

We know that a household gas cylinder costs 6,500FCFA. For a family of 4 to 5 people who use a gas cylinder per month, this amounts to 78,000 FCFA per year, or 780,000 FCFA for 10 years. With the faithful use of our ASAAB cooker, the family will end up with about a bottle for two months, due to the fact that it is used for cooking pot fire that is to say no frying just cooking done with water. The service life of asaab is about 10 years because of its insulating material. So the family will spend a bottle for two months will give 39,000 FCFA or 390,000 FCFA for 10 years with a saving of 195,000 FCFA. -Reduce evaporation compared to conventional cooking methods, which prevents food from burning or drying -Frees up time for women for other income-generating activities -Reduce deforestation and fight climate change -Allows cooking using less energy and does not pollute during its use -Significantly reduces greenhouse gas emissions.
Are there any other potential bottlenecks affecting cross-border or in country diffusion of this solution?
Lack of funding for further product expansion

5037,c-30,Bleaglee cooking solution,6/7/22,10/4/24,3,,159,CMR,2,anna.ojong@undp.org,Cameroon,"4 billion people still cook food using polluting fires such as firewood and charcoal, causing about 3 million deaths yearly according to World Health organisation. BleagLee Cooking Solution provides clean cooking stoves and clean cooking fuel for Cameroonian kitchens made from recycled metal scraps and recycled biomass waste respectively. The solution reduces toxic emissions by up to 95%, can cook up to 5 times faster than traditional ovens and is up to 50% cheaper than firewood.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/c3787e8a-95c0-4ca3-a6dc-e462e7337526/38da8861bdeced043c7a8229e715e795.jpg,"Bleaglee cooking solution

What is the purpose of the solution? (brief problem & solution description)

4 billion people still cook food using polluting fires such as firewood and charcoal, causing about 3 million deaths yearly according to World Health organisation. BleagLee Cooking Solution provides clean cooking stoves and clean cooking fuel for Cameroonian kitchens made from recycled metal scraps and recycled biomass waste respectively. The solution reduces toxic emissions by up to 95%, can cook up to 5 times faster than traditional ovens and is up to 50% cheaper than firewood.

5022,c-11,Teflon REGULATOR,6/7/22,1/16/23,3,,,GIN,2,camara.moussa@undp.org,Guinea,"The TEFLON or PTFE is stable and nontoxic at lower temperatures, it begins to deteriorate at temperatures of about 260 °C (500 °F), it decomposes above 350 °C (662 °F), and pyloris occurs at temperatures above 400 °C (752 °F). ",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/a6f58a0b-c389-41db-8d24-aef6580a6877/749f05c9f308237495f045dcc42799b8.jpg,"Teflon REGULATOR

The TEFLON or PTFE is stable and nontoxic at lower temperatures, it begins to deteriorate at temperatures of about 260 °C (500 °F), it decomposes above 350 °C (662 °F), and pyloris occurs at temperatures above 400 °C (752 °F).

What is the purpose of the solution? (brief problem & solution description)

In a village where everyone thinks that not going far in their studies is an end in itself, where relentlessness and dedication are not considered as real arguments to support a citizen in his project, this is the decor in which evolves Mamadou Saliou Diallo, an autodidact whose level of study is of the 5th year of primary school; is developing a pico-dam to supply electricity to surrounding villages.

In the process of developing the energy sector to solve the power problem in Guinea, the government has electrified major cities, prefectures, and sub-prefectures. However, it emerges that despite these enormous efforts, shortcomings remain. So to provide a quick and low-cost solution, our friend “Actor's Name” gave himself body and soul to put together a micro-dam which for him will serve as a quick answer to the question of coverage and thus, influence positively on the lifestyle of local residents.

4932,c-17,Cafette solaire,5/30/22,10/4/24,3,,159,BFA,2,abdoulaye.ouedraogo@undp.org,Burkina Faso,"Les jeunes vendeurs de boissons chaudes dans la rue, sont souvent chargés de plusieurs thermos et lorsqu'ils sont vides ils sont obligés de trouver une source de chaleur ( gaz ou charbon) afin de se ravitailler et de continuer la vente. La cafete solaire permet ainsi au vendeur d'avoir une source de chaleur à porter et de se ravitailler à souhait. Elle est utilisé pour produire de l'eau chaude de façon permanente destiner à la vente de boissons chaudes.
Aussi, cette solution permet de récupérer les jeunes vulnérables et de leur octroyer un emploi.

La cafete solaire est très facile à mettre en place avec un coût réduit. ",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/e7e2a7be-5a45-4669-83f5-5539c538c020/ed1b83e54b293c659ab824a33c4da498.jpg,"Cafette solaire

A lot of people in the communities rely on using firewood and charcoal for cooking due to a lack of access to clean and sustainable energy. This has resulted in deforestation and other environmental shocks. The stove combines the use of a few firewood and electricity to reduce firewood and briquette use. It works perfectly when firewood is mixed with lava rocks, 80% lava, and 20% firewood.

What is the purpose of the solution? (brief problem & solution description)

The people of his village lack reliable and affordable access to electricity. He uses an already used maize mill motor, inverter, electric wire, and other locally available resources to generate over 1000 Volts of electricity from  Kasangadzi River. The river is situated 2 kilometers away from the residence of the innovator. He distributes the generated electricity to over 30 households within the same village, at an affordable fee to sustain the intervention.

What is the purpose of the solution? (brief problem & solution description)

The purpose of this solution is to address lack of clean cooking energy in Rwanda where more than 90% of households still rely on polluting traditional biomass-based cooking like firewood and charcoal. These inefficient cooking methods reduce the country’s forest cover, generate indoor air pollution that causes respiratory diseases associated with 1.6 million deaths globally every year and together with decomposing organic wastes dumped in landfills generates greenhouse gases contributing to climate instability

What is the purpose of the solution? (brief problem & solution description)

It transforms any Petroleum Product into LPG.

4748,c-17,RURAL ENERGY ASSISTANT,5/16/22,10/4/24,3,,159,BFA,2,abdoulaye.ouedraogo@undp.org,Burkina Faso,"Avec un taux d'électrification estimé à 28% au niveau national et à 3% en zone rurale en 2018, les possibilités de production énergétique sont très limitées dans les zones rurales. La principale source d'énergie disponible pour les populations rurales est la main d'oeuvre humaine aujourd'hui réduite essentiellement au travail des femmes et des hommes. Le bois énergie est également la principale source d'énergie pour la cuisson. En termes d'énergie productive, l'utilisation de l'énergie solaire se limitait souvent au pompage de l'eau et à la réfrigération pour la conservation de divers aliments et boissons. La mécanisation dans les champs, lorsqu'elle est disponible, est principalement assurée par des tracteurs dont l'accès, en raison du coût élevé, est limité aux grands agriculteurs et aux coopératives. Par ailleurs, la transformation des produits agricoles est effectuée par des prestataires de services qui utilisent des moteurs à combustibles fossiles. C'est pour y remédier que le Rural Energy Assistant (REA) a été développé. C'est une plateforme d'énergie mobile alimentée par l'énergie solaire qui peut être conduite au champ et aider à labourer, semer et irriguer les cultures et ainsi réduire la charge de travail des agriculteurs. Il peut alimenter d'autres appareils tels que des appareils de cuisson, des petits concasseurs, des moulins, etc. pour des activités génératrices de revenus. Outre l'utilisation productive, le REA peut alimenter n'importe quel appareil à faible consommation d'énergie.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/e7e2a7be-5a45-4669-83f5-5539c538c020/24b7aabbf9918ac6b3e938bbdc48f60d.jpg,"RURAL ENERGY ASSISTANT
What is the name of the solution holder? (main contact person, if multiple)
What is the address and preferred way to contact the solution holder?
Does the solution holder have any institutional affiliation in country?
What is the purpose of the solution? (brief problem & solution description)

Avec un taux d'électrification estimé à 28% au niveau national et à 3% en zone rurale en 2018, les possibilités de production énergétique sont très limitées dans les zones rurales. La principale source d'énergie disponible pour les populations rurales est la main d'oeuvre humaine aujourd'hui réduite essentiellement au travail des femmes et des hommes. Le bois énergie est également la principale source d'énergie pour la cuisson. En termes d'énergie productive, l'utilisation de l'énergie solaire se limitait souvent au pompage de l'eau et à la réfrigération pour la conservation de divers aliments et boissons. La mécanisation dans les champs, lorsqu'elle est disponible, est principalement assurée par des tracteurs dont l'accès, en raison du coût élevé, est limité aux grands agriculteurs et aux coopératives. Par ailleurs, la transformation des produits agricoles est effectuée par des prestataires de services qui utilisent des moteurs à combustibles fossiles. C'est pour y remédier que le Rural Energy Assistant (REA) a été développé. C'est une plateforme d'énergie mobile alimentée par l'énergie solaire qui peut être conduite au champ et aider à labourer, semer et irriguer les cultures et ainsi réduire la charge de travail des agriculteurs. Il peut alimenter d'autres appareils tels que des appareils de cuisson, des petits concasseurs, des moulins, etc. pour des activités génératrices de revenus. Outre l'utilisation productive, le REA peut alimenter n'importe quel appareil à faible consommation d'énergie.

Le public cible est dans la plupart des cas illettré. Le meilleur canal pour les atteindre est la démonstration. C'est pour cela qu'il est nécessaire pour nous de mettre en place un programme de démonstration et tests à grande échelle (100 à 150 REA plus formation et suivi) afin de démontrer la viabilité économique, sociale et environnementale du REA.

YES, He is part of Grid Incubation Innovation Hub in University of Rwanda.
What is the purpose of the solution? (brief problem & solution description)

Electrical energy from utility (grid) in Rwanda is expensive and not enough. People do not believe in solar energy technology due to its intermittence. This solution is to connect solar energy to utility using a device called 'RIGHT LAMP AUTOMATIC CHANGEOVER SWITCH'. The solar energy use is the priority source of energy. From this, electrical energy use will be enough as users are to generate their own electricity. The PV-Grid system reduces electricity price between 80% to 100% and Rwandans will be able to cook using electricity which is the strongest solution to environment degradation.

What is the Technological Readiness Level (TRL) of this solution?
It is currently at testing phase and has been used by the user for about 5 years now with success
How much has this solution already been diffused? Is there potential feedback from end-users available?

So far the solution has so far been by one homestead, but the plan was to diffuse it to one other community when COVID 19 hit and all plans were halted. The solution has received positive feedback from the user as she has been using it consistently for the past 5 years. it has reduced the need for her to collect fuel wood as she lives alone and can nolonger walk long distances.
Please upload a picture of end-user feedback

Are there any efficiency benchmarks for this solution (eg. how much energy does it save; how much cheaper does it produce energy than current market rates/ current household expenditure / cost per kW h)?

No calculations to estimate this have been undertaken. However, 75% of Swazis in rural areas are dependent of wood energy for cooking, and this technology, if widely diffused, can result in major reduction in the dependence on wood fuel use. the costs saved would not only be in monetary terms but would have to take into account the time savings for women, who often have to walk long distances and spend hours collecting this energy source.
Are there any other potential bottlenecks affecting cross-border or in country diffusion of this solution?

4366,c-18,Self-acting water pump,3/31/22,7/9/24,3,,159,ETH,2,amanuel.tadesse@undp.org,Ethiopia,"Access to water is a challenge in rural areas, due to access to energy to supply water from the sources. Such pumping device has been used for nearly a century in rural indigenous community for lifting water to certain height, which is useful application for water pumping and supply to a community. This pump is powered by wind.

Constraint: From the pump, a particular hydram works under a particular range of drive flow and of drive height. If the drive height or drive flow is too low, the water has not enough energy to create a water hammer effect. If the drive height or the drive flow is too high, the energy of the water causes too much stress on the pump and reduces its life time.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/d4f9b41c-bd86-464e-b759-73079e51709f/8aedab3f2817d812c8071bbc409e8ae0.jpg,"Self-acting water pump
What is the name of the solution holder? (main contact person, if multiple)
What is the address and preferred way to contact the solution holder?
Does the solution holder have any institutional affiliation in country?
What is the purpose of the solution? (brief problem & solution description)

Access to water is a challenge in rural areas, due to access to energy to supply water from the sources. Such pumping device has been used for nearly a century in rural indigenous community for lifting water to certain height, which is useful application for water pumping and supply to a community. This pump is powered by wind.

Constraint: From the pump, a particular hydram works under a particular range of drive flow and of drive height. If the drive height or drive flow is too low, the water has not enough energy to create a water hammer effect. If the drive height or the drive flow is too high, the energy of the water causes too much stress on the pump and reduces its life time.

What is the purpose of the solution? (brief problem & solution description)

Tikikil stove is used for cooking. It uses firewood as fuel which is continuously fed into the combustion chamber. The stove has a cylindrical inner clay liner as combustion chamber, covered with galvanized sheet metal on the outside. The 4cm thick liner has internal diameter of 11cm and is 23.5cm high. At its bottom is an 11cmX11cm opening as fuel and air inlet.

What is the purpose of the solution? (brief problem & solution description)

The company makes fuel pellets from biodegradable waste (e.g., spent coffee grounds, coffee husks, sawdust, wood chips, khat stems). Using pellets as a fuel source in gasifier cookstoves is superior to any other solid biomass because pellets are uniform in size, have low moisture content, have a high energy density, and are easier to transport and store. When these pellets are burned in fan-forced gasifier stoves, they turn into biochar (i.e., charcoal).

4143,c-18,Anti Striga (weed) biological solution,2/26/22,1/16/23,2,,,ETH,2,amanuel.tadesse@undp.org,Ethiopia,"Striga hermonthica (witchweed) is a parasitic weed that attacks and significantly reduces the yields of maize, sorghum, millet, and sugarcane throughout sub-Saharan Africa. Low cost management methods such as hand weeding, short crop rotations, trap cropping, or conventional biocontrol have not been effective. Therefore, the toothpick project is led by a foreign scientist and experts from the Ethiopian biotechnological institute. This solution will:
1. Improves crop yield by reducing the Striga weed. Improving crop yield will lead to food security and economic improvements.

2. Considers the environmental impact for weed management as a locally-sourced agent (vs. chemicals that have toxicology concerns as well as increasing issues with herbicide-resistant weeds - eg. in the last three decades, over two dozen weeds have developed resistance to glyphosate).

3. Operates as a sustainable business – providing an affordable product for farmers as a social enterprise. We have a second economic opportunity for micro agribusinesses to produce our live inoculum at the village level. This opportunity is designed to keep the economy strong at a local level rather than diverting funds out of a village to a large manufacturing center.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/d4f9b41c-bd86-464e-b759-73079e51709f/b6001b53ed72731a0aaa466805d9bfb4.jpg,"Anti Striga (weed) biological solution

Striga hermonthica (witchweed) is a parasitic weed that attacks and significantly reduces the yields of maize, sorghum, millet, and sugarcane throughout sub-Saharan Africa. Low cost management methods such as hand weeding, short crop rotations, trap cropping, or conventional biocontrol have not been effective. Therefore, the toothpick project is led by a foreign scientist and experts from the Ethiopian biotechnological institute. This solution will:
1. Improves crop yield by reducing the Striga weed. Improving crop yield will lead to food security and economic improvements.

2. Considers the environmental impact for weed management as a locally-sourced agent (vs. chemicals that have toxicology concerns as well as increasing issues with herbicide-resistant weeds - eg. in the last three decades, over two dozen weeds have developed resistance to glyphosate).

3. Operates as a sustainable business – providing an affordable product for farmers as a social enterprise. We have a second economic opportunity for micro agribusinesses to produce our live inoculum at the village level. This opportunity is designed to keep the economy strong at a local level rather than diverting funds out of a village to a large manufacturing center.

4139,c-18,x-fire,2/25/22,1/16/23,2,,,ETH,2,amanuel.tadesse@undp.org,Ethiopia,"Our solution is a distance limitless fire accident notification technology development called x-fire. X-fire also able to notify fire accident agency and neighbours at its early stage of the accident.

The technology that we have invented X-fire is the most efficient and affordable fire alarm compared to all existing ones. We have planned to sell each X-fire by 2,700 ETB but the existing ones are selling up to 4,500 ETB on the market. We have been checking the market in detail. 4135,c-18,MoveEt delivery and logistics solution,2/25/22,1/16/23,2,,,ETH,2,amanuel.tadesse@undp.org,Ethiopia,"MoveEt delivery and logistics system was developed with objective of improving (introduce digitized management) the existing delivery and logistics which is generally fragmented and manually managed in inefficient and ineffective manner.

MoveEt Delivery and logistics is a system serves suppliers to deliver their goods efficiently and timely while fully controlling the movement of the transport system using GPS system, thus improving the efficiency of their transport system. The system enables to select the best route to deliver goods to customers. The system had been established with the objective of optimizing the business activities through efficient utilization of transport means.

MoveEt provides a robust system to Enterprises to manage their vehicles. This system enables the Enterprise to see detail information about the delivery and track the vehicles on map. MoveEt installs the system on the computer of the customer and provides support services such as system maintenance, training and upgrading the system.
MoveEt Enterprise is a delivery management system controlled by MoveEt, enabling customers (Enterprises) order a delivery using a web portal or call center. The Vehicles are managed by
MoveEt where MoveEt uses its own cars or verified car owners
(Drivers) who qualify for the enterprise delivery requirement.

The MoveEt Public is a delivery system managed by MoveEt prepared for the public user to manage a logistics and delivery. This system includes various verified vehicle drivers to manage the delivery service. A user can use a mobile application or a call center to make the order (request the service).

The initiative is sustainably replicable because All users shall be charged for the service of logistics and delivery as they use of the system. At this time the system has already been developed, tested and is being loaded on smart phones of drivers, ready for use.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/d4f9b41c-bd86-464e-b759-73079e51709f/24fd51cfd86632d21a513fb2832730cb.jpg,"MoveEt delivery and logistics solution

4134,c-18,Ethio Locate,2/25/22,1/16/23,2,,,ETH,2,amanuel.tadesse@undp.org,Ethiopia,"Ethio Locate is a travel guide platform, that helps users find locations information and events for free with just simple clicks. This initiative intends to achieve a central database where travels or tourists or anyone seeking valuable information’s and locations of services providers on the digital world. The methodology that will lead us to a successful outcome is there is lack of information’s and locations of hospitality services providers in every city in Ethiopia and a high number of information seekers and services providers wanting to have a digital profile will lead us to a successful outcome.  Providing our country Ethiopia on a digital world and giving services providers a digital profile of their information’s and location is the outcome to be achieved. Our country Ethiopia has a lot of tourism destination places in different cities, currently we started to gather data from Addis Ababa but we are growing to different cities like Bahir dar, Gonder and Lalibela trying to replicate and so far we have good attraction and building network. The initiative is sustainable as long as the services providers are available. Given there is a gap of information in the service center, this product will be highly replicable.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/d4f9b41c-bd86-464e-b759-73079e51709f/ce431905964c7c3cdc3174fe028ac137.jpg,"Ethio Locate

4133,c-18,Solar electric three-wheeler vehicle,2/25/22,1/16/23,2,,,ETH,2,amanuel.tadesse@undp.org,Ethiopia,"Reduced a carbon emission and minimize expenditures through bringing a clean energy consuming vehicle into the transportation system.: The main aim of this innovation is to contribute a reduction of greenhouse gas emission from the transport system, while offering a cheapest and healthy means of transportation for low end economic community in sub-Saharan Africa and in particular Ethiopia. The innovative product is made out of mainly locally available resources and local capacity (a grassroot innovation). It is designed as a three-wheeler vehicle for space economy as well as energy efficiency. During its development the right partners were approached for standardization of the necessary parts of the three-wheeler vehicle for safety reasons. The product’s prototype has already tested functional and needs to be piloted with few revisions and under realistic situation in the transport system. In sub-Saharan rural parts such as Ethiopia, where population is growing at an alarming rate that exceeds the transport support system of the country. Therefore, opting to local innovations that solve this problem through making source of transportation energy renewable, and affordable by such low economic classes in the country. This will save the governments expenditure for fossil fuel subsidization that would rather fill other development gaps. This initiative will also put Ethiopia in fulfilling climate change mitigation strategies. Moreover, this innovative product supply chain of production could also open an opportunity for employment in the local automotive industry. ",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/d4f9b41c-bd86-464e-b759-73079e51709f/ba4e0ecc8cd563035f4ab773a9a6fafd.jpg,"Solar electric three-wheeler vehicle

The innovative product is made out of mainly locally available resources and local capacity (a grassroot innovation). It is designed as a three-wheeler vehicle for space economy as well as energy efficiency. 4132,c-18,Conversion of Waste Plastic into Construction tile,2/25/22,1/16/23,2,,,ETH,2,amanuel.tadesse@undp.org,Ethiopia,"The proposed Project will
(i) envisages the establishment of a plant to produce Plastic tiles with a capacity of 180,000 pieces per annum

4131,c-18,Water box for afforestation ,2/25/22,1/16/23,2,,,ETH,2,amanuel.tadesse@undp.org,Ethiopia,"This innovation enables to increase the survival rate of trees after afforestation, which supports an environmental greening programs and combat climate change, and desertification through an increased vegetation cover and carbon sequestration.  The suggested solution for the aforementioned problem is a designed structure that could be put around tree seedlings. This product shall also be simple for carriage and application to support extensive afforestation programs, and in line with circular economy (reusable and recyclable). The innovation is a Water box that has a moisture retention capacity (90%), which supports trees survival with a minimum care in countries that do not afford a logistical cost for post afforestation. The product’s colour is intentionally black to reflect sunlight and minimizes the soil penetrating radiation. Also, it has an extension wire mesh of 1-meter length to protect the seedlings from browsing animals. Such innovative methods need to be also affordable and technically applicable for their saleability. The innovation is to be piloted in the moisture scarce lowlands and pastoralist community. The unit cost per Water Box is 6.8USD including all the installation and follow-up costs. This water box’s production could be also a source of employment for small and micro enterprises. Also new SMEs could be engaged with rental services of such moisture maintaining boxes to government, and non-government organizations in the afforestation businesses. This innovation has been tested at experimental state and planning to conduct a medium scale piloting with 10,000 seedlings. ",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/d4f9b41c-bd86-464e-b759-73079e51709f/32914d7a680dd50744427e529ffa3f16.jpg,"Water box for afforestation

This innovation enables to increase the survival rate of trees after afforestation, which supports an environmental greening programs and combat climate change, and desertification through an increased vegetation cover and carbon sequestration.  The suggested solution for the aforementioned problem is a designed structure that could be put around tree seedlings. This product shall also be simple for carriage and application to support extensive afforestation programs, and in line with circular economy (reusable and recyclable). The innovation is a Water box that has a moisture retention capacity (90%), which supports trees survival with a minimum care in countries that do not afford a logistical cost for post afforestation. The product’s colour is intentionally black to reflect sunlight and minimizes the soil penetrating radiation. Also, it has an extension wire mesh of 1-meter length to protect the seedlings from browsing animals. Such innovative methods need to be also affordable and technically applicable for their saleability. The innovation is to be piloted in the moisture scarce lowlands and pastoralist community. The unit cost per Water Box is 6.8USD including all the installation and follow-up costs. This water box’s production could be also a source of employment for small and micro enterprises. Also new SMEs could be engaged with rental services of such moisture maintaining boxes to government, and non-government organizations in the afforestation businesses. This innovation has been tested at experimental state and planning to conduct a medium scale piloting with 10,000 seedlings.

4130,c-18,Hello Erf is an Agri-tech solution that aims to solve smallholders' challen…,2/25/22,9/9/24,2,,,ETH,2,amanuel.tadesse@undp.org,Ethiopia,"Hello Erf is an Agri-tech solution that aims to solve smallholders' challenge to access mechanization service through a direct call to our call centre or through our agents in their village. The solution also helps mechanization service providers to manage and grow their business. Service providers through an IoT powered mobile app will track and monitor their machineries, revenue and manage bookings from smallholder farmers. It also provides up to date research findings, suppliers address, events, and professionals and so on within the agriculture mechanization ecosystem. Applying human centered design approach has helped us to go through discussions with farmers, service providers, sector experts in public sector along with those working in NGOs in search of the problem on the ground and how they think will be solved. Though the problem to be solved are a bit difficult and ranging difference in literacy level, mobile device types of users were complicated. Years of experience of the team in the Agri-tech industry has helped to come to reach into innovative and inclusive solution to be provided. Hello Erf is winner of the 2018 innovation slam award by Green Innovation Center, GIZ project promoting innovative solutions transforming agriculture.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/d4f9b41c-bd86-464e-b759-73079e51709f/661315a9b6141ac14bd621337cc68690.jpg,"Hello Erf is an Agri-tech solution that aims to solve smallholders' challen…

Hello Erf is an Agri-tech solution that aims to solve smallholders' challenge to access mechanization service through a direct call to our call centre or through our agents in their village. The solution also helps mechanization service providers to manage and grow their business. Service providers through an IoT powered mobile app will track and monitor their machineries, revenue and manage bookings from smallholder farmers. It also provides up to date research findings, suppliers address, events, and professionals and so on within the agriculture mechanization ecosystem. Applying human centered design approach has helped us to go through discussions with farmers, service providers, sector experts in public sector along with those working in NGOs in search of the problem on the ground and how they think will be solved. Though the problem to be solved are a bit difficult and ranging difference in literacy level, mobile device types of users were complicated. Years of experience of the team in the Agri-tech industry has helped to come to reach into innovative and inclusive solution to be provided. Hello Erf is winner of the 2018 innovation slam award by Green Innovation Center, GIZ project promoting innovative solutions transforming agriculture.

4129,c-18,"Recover fuel oil, carbon black and steel wire from used tires using pyrolysis machine",2/25/22,1/16/23,2,,,ETH,2,amanuel.tadesse@undp.org,Ethiopia,"Globally, the effort for solving waste tyre problems through market-based value-adding waste tyre management options is as old as tyre itself. These include reusing, de-vulcanization, mechanical and thermal (including pyrolysis) processing. Disposal options such as land filling and stockpiling are also practiced.  Tyre pyrolysis is a thermal process carried out in the absence of oxygen for producing oil, carbon char black and gases from used tyres and recovering the steel wires in the tyre. This presents an opportunity to consider scrap tyre pyrolysis as a business. Pyrolysis is emerging as a more efficient way to utilize the resources in scrap tyres compared to the other options. From pyrolysis of scrap tyres, four products are obtained: oil, carbon char, fuel gas and steel wire. Pyrolysis is preferable because of the following reasons: It recycles 100% of the waste tyres. All valuable materials are extracted. It  produces  four  valuable  products  out  of  waste  tyres  with  no  effect  on  the environment. They are “green” products. There exists a huge and increasing demand for the products. It delivers clean steel after processing than other technologies. The pyrolysis machine can be design and manufacture locally",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/d4f9b41c-bd86-464e-b759-73079e51709f/8d4312af93bb022aefb964274cc32a5d.jpg,"Recover fuel oil, carbon black and steel wire from used tires using pyrolysis machine

Globally, the effort for solving waste tyre problems through market-based value-adding waste tyre management options is as old as tyre itself. These include reusing, de-vulcanization, mechanical and thermal (including pyrolysis) processing. Disposal options such as land filling and stockpiling are also practiced.  Tyre pyrolysis is a thermal process carried out in the absence of oxygen for producing oil, carbon char black and gases from used tyres and recovering the steel wires in the tyre. This presents an opportunity to consider scrap tyre pyrolysis as a business. Pyrolysis is emerging as a more efficient way to utilize the resources in scrap tyres compared to the other options. From pyrolysis of scrap tyres, four products are obtained: oil, carbon char, fuel gas and steel wire. Pyrolysis is preferable because of the following reasons: It recycles 100% of the waste tyres. All valuable materials are extracted. It  produces  four  valuable  products  out  of  waste  tyres  with  no  effect  on  the environment. They are “green” products. There exists a huge and increasing demand for the products. It delivers clean steel after processing than other technologies. The pyrolysis machine can be design and manufacture locally

4128,c-18,green waste made briquets,2/25/22,1/16/23,2,,,ETH,2,amanuel.tadesse@undp.org,Ethiopia,"Wastes that are inputs to briquette production (fruit peelings and cores,  green leaves, other green left-over materials, etc) are sorted, then the waste is dried up, carbonization the dried material, grinding and mixing the powder with binding material, molding and dried the final briquette.

The briquette replaces charcoal and useful minimizing deforestation and free from smoke  due to carbonization  during the process. The price is low and preferred by the residents as well as durable solution for energy needs.   ",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/d4f9b41c-bd86-464e-b759-73079e51709f/911e92477cdd38a5d0d21068ad85640c.jpg,"green waste made briquets

Wastes that are inputs to briquette production (fruit peelings and cores,  green leaves, other green left-over materials, etc) are sorted, then the waste is dried up, carbonization the dried material, grinding and mixing the powder with binding material, molding and dried the final briquette.

The briquette replaces charcoal and useful minimizing deforestation and free from smoke  due to carbonization  during the process. The price is low and preferred by the residents as well as durable solution for energy needs.
sdgs: Decent work and economic growth

4124,c-18,Sole Rebels -wears from reusable products,2/25/22,1/16/23,2,,,ETH,2,amanuel.tadesse@undp.org,Ethiopia,"Sustainable and traditionally zero-carbon methods of production as they are integral parts of Ethiopia’s cultural fabric, a tradition which we grew up with and feel committed to preserving.

Pair of Sole Rebels is made from the most sustainable materials: a combination of recycled, organic and bio-based materials. As most of the products are hand made, it opens a job opportunity for may men and women",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/d4f9b41c-bd86-464e-b759-73079e51709f/f363e655207a1e53cf8cf903d72c2186.jpg,"Sole Rebels -wears from reusable products
Sustainable and traditionally zero-carbon methods of production as they are integral parts of Ethiopia’s cultural fabric, a tradition which we grew up with and feel committed to preserving.

4123,c-18,recycled polythene bags,2/25/22,1/16/23,2,,,ETH,2,amanuel.tadesse@undp.org,Ethiopia,"After the PET (transparent bottles) are collected, compressed and provided for recyclers, the plastic cover (high density plastic)  part of the bottle was left over and disposed illegally.  This recycling activity highly  reduces the amount of plastic waste disposed and contribute to reduce  pollution and create job opportunities for youth and women.

In this procedure the plastic (HDPE) waste is collected, it is cleaned with water and crushed and processed to plastic bag with different thicknesses. The other product of this waste is polythene bags/seedling pots which is used by city municipality for seedling raising purposes. ",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/d4f9b41c-bd86-464e-b759-73079e51709f/df543609d6e09aa81ffc08a5a3e165a0.jpg,"recycled polythene bags

After the PET (transparent bottles) are collected, compressed and provided for recyclers, the plastic cover (high density plastic)  part of the bottle was left over and disposed illegally.  This recycling activity highly  reduces the amount of plastic waste disposed and contribute to reduce  pollution and create job opportunities for youth and women.

In this procedure the plastic (HDPE) waste is collected, it is cleaned with water and crushed and processed to plastic bag with different thicknesses. The other product of this waste is polythene bags/seedling pots which is used by city municipality for seedling raising purposes.

4118,c-18,paper recycling initiative,2/25/22,1/16/23,2,,,ETH,2,amanuel.tadesse@undp.org,Ethiopia,"Penda is a company that collectes wasted papers and recycled into new paper products. The initiative installs 40 mobile paper waste deposit sites called ‘Worke’ around the city of Addis Ababa that allows city residents to dispose their paper waste for 2 Ethiopian birr per kilo.

Penda Manufacturing was established in 2014 by Marie Nielsen, has been working to ‘revolutionize Addis Ababa’s paper recycling industry. It has so far been working with micro-enterprises collecting the city’s waste and creating jobs for collectors and processors in the recycling plant.  Penda collects paper waste from over 130 offices and factories around the city and provides 4, 300 individuals organized under micro-enterprise with additional income, the volume collected is still insufficient. ",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/d4f9b41c-bd86-464e-b759-73079e51709f/df747e9a8480c5b968c80b6a240bf9bd.jpg,"paper recycling initiative

Penda is a company that collectes wasted papers and recycled into new paper products. The initiative installs 40 mobile paper waste deposit sites called ‘Worke’ around the city of Addis Ababa that allows city residents to dispose their paper waste for 2 Ethiopian birr per kilo.

Penda Manufacturing was established in 2014 by Marie Nielsen, has been working to ‘revolutionize Addis Ababa’s paper recycling industry. It has so far been working with micro-enterprises collecting the city’s waste and creating jobs for collectors and processors in the recycling plant.  Penda collects paper waste from over 130 offices and factories around the city and provides 4, 300 individuals organized under micro-enterprise with additional income, the volume collected is still insufficient.

4115,c-18,notebooks from recycled waste,2/25/22,1/16/23,2,,,ETH,2,amanuel.tadesse@undp.org,Ethiopia,"Felek is a notebook brand under Savannah Printing Press Plc, which started recycling after witnessing the increased amount of wasted paper from its printing press.

We use a historical Coptic stitching method to produce hand-made paper,"" said Sulieman Dawit, managing and creative director of the company. ""We use customizable leather or recycled jerrycans to produce covers for the notebooks.""

After launching Felek Notebooks & Journal in 2016, the company found it challenging to penetrate the market because of a prejudicial view that questioned the quality standards and assumed that recycled products are more expensive, according to the director.
The prices of the recycled commodities have to compete with their virgin counterparts made straight out of the wood pulp,"" Suleiman said.

4101,c-18,Axiom Financial Technologies,2/18/22,1/16/23,2,,,ETH,2,amanuel.tadesse@undp.org,Ethiopia,"Mizan Credit Score - is a system for measuring credit risk for businesses and individuals.  Our credit risk assessment and rating platform that analyzes traditional and alternative borrower data to arrive at a standardized credit score. The platform enables the large sections of society that are currently unbanked to build their profiles using technology that can be readily accessed. Additionally, customers will acquire further access to finance through applications integrated with financial institutions and payment systems. The Platform allows lenders to have full information about borrowers and allows borrowers to gain financial education and access.”
· Integration with Credit Reference Bureau, Tax Database and commercial registry
· Self-assessment and publication of own credit score
· Searchable using TIN, business name, or address
· Accessible by microfinances, banks and other lenders and financial institutions

Mizan Credit Score - is a system for measuring credit risk for businesses and individuals.  Our credit risk assessment and rating platform that analyzes traditional and alternative borrower data to arrive at a standardized credit score. The platform enables the large sections of society that are currently unbanked to build their profiles using technology that can be readily accessed. Additionally, customers will acquire further access to finance through applications integrated with financial institutions and payment systems. The Platform allows lenders to have full information about borrowers and allows borrowers to gain financial education and access.”

3772,c-11,Jardin du Groupement KOSSIMANKAN de Kankan,12/13/21,1/16/23,2,,,GIN,2,camara.moussa@undp.org,Guinea,"Le jardin Kossimankan de Kankan est un ensemble constitué en groupement des personnes motivées à l'idée de résilience via le développement des cultures maraîchères sur une étendue de 2 hectares. nous avons la chance ici de croiser des ingénieurs en agronomie  qui ont pour but de non seulement cultiver mais aussi de partager leur compétence à travers cet abri à la toiture rougeâtre avec des table-bancs  et un tableau. En quoi est ce que ce jardin est une solution? Bien, il est à remarquer que la chance est donnée à tous de prendre part à cette organisation moyennant un cout forfaitaire que nous ne divulguerons pas, mais qui soulage tous ceux qui ont la chance d'y participer, comparé au niveau de bénéfice largement apprécié, à cela s'ajoute l'encadrement et le suivi accordé par les ingénieurs sans oublier la proximité et la sécurité de la zone assurée par l'enclos établi par la structure de gestion de cette parcelle.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/a6f58a0b-c389-41db-8d24-aef6580a6877/e9cd4c8dba6e6b11f1f3e1dd0ea1e70c.jpg,"Jardin du Groupement KOSSIMANKAN de Kankan

Le jardin Kossimankan de Kankan est un ensemble constitué en groupement des personnes motivées à l'idée de résilience via le développement des cultures maraîchères sur une étendue de 2 hectares. nous avons la chance ici de croiser des ingénieurs en agronomie  qui ont pour but de non seulement cultiver mais aussi de partager leur compétence à travers cet abri à la toiture rougeâtre avec des table-bancs  et un tableau. En quoi est ce que ce jardin est une solution? Bien, il est à remarquer que la chance est donnée à tous de prendre part à cette organisation moyennant un cout forfaitaire que nous ne divulguerons pas, mais qui soulage tous ceux qui ont la chance d'y participer, comparé au niveau de bénéfice largement apprécié, à cela s'ajoute l'encadrement et le suivi accordé par les ingénieurs sans oublier la proximité et la sécurité de la zone assurée par l'enclos établi par la structure de gestion de cette parcelle.
sdgs: Decent work and economic growth

3743,c-11,La cafetière du ghetto made in KANKAN,12/7/21,1/16/23,2,,,GIN,2,camara.moussa@undp.org,Guinea,"La cafetière de Kankan, issu du recyclage de déchets métalliques; est très en vogue et est en permanence utilisée dans les salons de thé et de petit café. elle est une sorte de compresseur de café moulu auquel on ajute de l'eau. Sous l'effet de la pression qui est appliquée par la barre supérieure maintenue par trois points tenus par des écrous solides de sorte à complètement extraire le liquide désormais coloré café. Commercialisée à prix moyen (200 000 GNF pour le moyen), cette solution est véritablement prisée dans les ville à fort niveau de consommation de café. ",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/a6f58a0b-c389-41db-8d24-aef6580a6877/14f09fc4fc4266b9944dc1bd46a09b0d.jpg,"La cafetière du ghetto made in KANKAN

La cafetière de Kankan, issu du recyclage de déchets métalliques; est très en vogue et est en permanence utilisée dans les salons de thé et de petit café. elle est une sorte de compresseur de café moulu auquel on ajute de l'eau. Sous l'effet de la pression qui est appliquée par la barre supérieure maintenue par trois points tenus par des écrous solides de sorte à complètement extraire le liquide désormais coloré café. Commercialisée à prix moyen (200 000 GNF pour le moyen), cette solution est véritablement prisée dans les ville à fort niveau de consommation de café.

3742,c-11,Le moule à pilier direct bétonné de KANKAN   ,12/7/21,1/16/23,2,,,GIN,2,camara.moussa@undp.org,Guinea,"Pour nos ingénieurs en bâtiment, voici une innovation! Elle est constituée de métaux recyclés et bénéficie d'une particularité qui consiste à donner une allure directe au pilier de nos maisons. C'est à dire, contrairement aux autres types de moules qui on la vocation de produire des piliers en trois sections séparées : les têtes supérieures et inférieures ainsi que le tronc. Et pour nos constructions, cela constitue une autre charge tant en énergie qu'en argent dans la mesure où l'on est obligés de procéder à l'agencement en y mettant du ciment en plus de ce qui a été utilisé pour la confection des parties, ce qui risque d'être instable en cas de mouvement rude. Tandis que pour cette solution, il nous faut juste remplir le moule et une fois retiré, vous avez en un seul bloc votre pilier, lui conférant ainsi sa rigidité contre les probables mouvement inattendus. ",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/a6f58a0b-c389-41db-8d24-aef6580a6877/d953319d779caf685b74b40a1abfcd9e.jpg,"Le moule à pilier direct bétonné de KANKAN

Pour nos ingénieurs en bâtiment, voici une innovation! Elle est constituée de métaux recyclés et bénéficie d'une particularité qui consiste à donner une allure directe au pilier de nos maisons. C'est à dire, contrairement aux autres types de moules qui on la vocation de produire des piliers en trois sections séparées : les têtes supérieures et inférieures ainsi que le tronc. Et pour nos constructions, cela constitue une autre charge tant en énergie qu'en argent dans la mesure où l'on est obligés de procéder à l'agencement en y mettant du ciment en plus de ce qui a été utilisé pour la confection des parties, ce qui risque d'être instable en cas de mouvement rude. Tandis que pour cette solution, il nous faut juste remplir le moule et une fois retiré, vous avez en un seul bloc votre pilier, lui conférant ainsi sa rigidité contre les probables mouvement inattendus.

3741,c-11,Le réservoir d'eau en béton (Djidaga) de SIGUIRI,12/7/21,1/16/23,2,,,GIN,2,camara.moussa@undp.org,Guinea,"Connu jadis pour ses propriétés liées à la conservation d’eau à température ambiante, le réservoir de béton est devenu une véritable solution locale contre le réchauffement de l’eau mais aussi le vol de bassin plastique ou du moins de faible masse; dont sont couramment victimes les habitants de Siguiri. A ce jour, vous pouvez disposer de bassin de 600 litres, 1000 Litres et même, vous le faire confectionner à domicile. Selon notre interlocuteur, ce bassin est fait dans plusieurs localités de Guinée mais la particularité de celui de Siguiri réside dans le fait qu’il est hyper résistant, solide et enfin assez lice de l’intérieur pour maintenir le caractère propre de l’eau.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/a6f58a0b-c389-41db-8d24-aef6580a6877/d32a60ec270358dd16dcb8bf2e9ddaf8.jpg,"Le réservoir d'eau en béton (Djidaga) de SIGUIRI

Connu jadis pour ses propriétés liées à la conservation d’eau à température ambiante, le réservoir de béton est devenu une véritable solution locale contre le réchauffement de l’eau mais aussi le vol de bassin plastique ou du moins de faible masse; dont sont couramment victimes les habitants de Siguiri. A ce jour, vous pouvez disposer de bassin de 600 litres, 1000 Litres et même, vous le faire confectionner à domicile. Selon notre interlocuteur, ce bassin est fait dans plusieurs localités de Guinée mais la particularité de celui de Siguiri réside dans le fait qu’il est hyper résistant, solide et enfin assez lice de l’intérieur pour maintenir le caractère propre de l’eau.

3740,c-11,La broyeuse de feuilles de Siguiri,12/7/21,1/16/23,2,,,GIN,2,camara.moussa@undp.org,Guinea," Issue de la forge de M. Yéro sur l’axe Siguiri-Bamako, cette machine conçue à base de métaux recyclés est  greffée au moteur de type Tiger pour en assurer le mouvement continu de marteau-torsion installé à l’intérieur du canon d’éjection de la pâte ou de la mixture de plants ainsi formé. Cette mixture est utilisée par nos mère pour les sauces à base de feuilles de manioc ou de patate. Ainsi, elle constitue un véritable facteur de gain en temps de et en énergie durant la cuisson de nos mets de même qu'un moyen rapide et simple de remettre en valeur les nombreuses feuilles de toles issues de la décomposition de certains véhicules. En général, cette solution est disponible dans la plupart des marchés mais au format manuel qui ici en vue de gagner en temps mais aussi en quantité de production, a bien été amélioré.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/a6f58a0b-c389-41db-8d24-aef6580a6877/679d07ce00f5c816b999cbbfc477fcb8.jpg,"La broyeuse de feuilles de Siguiri

Issue de la forge de M. Yéro sur l’axe Siguiri-Bamako, cette machine conçue à base de métaux recyclés est  greffée au moteur de type Tiger pour en assurer le mouvement continu de marteau-torsion installé à l’intérieur du canon d’éjection de la pâte ou de la mixture de plants ainsi formé. Cette mixture est utilisée par nos mère pour les sauces à base de feuilles de manioc ou de patate. Ainsi, elle constitue un véritable facteur de gain en temps de et en énergie durant la cuisson de nos mets de même qu'un moyen rapide et simple de remettre en valeur les nombreuses feuilles de toles issues de la décomposition de certains véhicules. En général, cette solution est disponible dans la plupart des marchés mais au format manuel qui ici en vue de gagner en temps mais aussi en quantité de production, a bien été amélioré.

3692,c-17,Coopérative d'utilisation de matériels agricoles,12/6/21,1/16/23,2,,,BFA,2,abdoulaye.ouedraogo@undp.org,Burkina Faso,"Description de la solution

Il s’agit de former des coopératives de 20 à 30 membres et de leur doter  en équipements agricoles (charrues, ksine, charrettes, moulins, tricycle, ….) pour permettre aux membres de bénéficier de services de la coopérative et faire de la location à d’autres personnes en vue d’avoir des ressources pour la coopérative.                                                                Cette solution permet de:                                                                                                                                         -        Etendre les superficies cultivées ;
Association pour la Recherche et la Formation en Agro-écologie (ARFA)
A quel défi/problème répond cette solution ?
Les producteur (rice)s agricoles organisés en coopératives.
En quoi est-ce que cette solution est innovante ?
-        Augmentation des rendements et des productions agricoles ;
-        Acquisition du matériel propre en individuel.

Il s’agit de mécanismes pour une production avicole   traditionnelle améliorée à grande échelle et de rentabilité accélérée et attachée à une formule de pérennisation dénommée No-Siouré (en dialecte moaga).                                          Le rôle essentiel qui s’affiche de cette initiative est : La promotion de l’aviculture traditionnelle (race locale) couplée à une croissance économique en milieu rural à travers :
-        La réduction du temps de travail des producteurs
-        La professionnalisation et même la spécialisation des producteurs
Koudougou - Province du Boulkiemdé - Burkina Faso
ZOUBGA Talinmanègba Claver, Agent de développement communautaire, Formation en Psychologie
A quel défi/problème répond cette solution ?
-        Au chômage des jeunes en milieu rural
-        A la fixation des jeunes dans leurs terroirs
-        A la faible production avicole traditionnelle (race locale)
-        A la faiblesse des revenus de l’aviculture traditionnelle
-        A la faible motivation des producteurs pour l’aviculture traditionnelle
-        A la faible qualité nutritionnelle des ménages ruraux
La principale cible visée par cette initiative est l’ensemble des aviculteurs du milieu rural avec un focus chez les jeunes (femmes et hommes).
En quoi est-ce que cette solution est innovante ?
-        L’aviculture traditionnelle améliorée est un moyen efficace de lutte contre le chômage et la pauvreté en milieu rural.

-        L’aviculture traditionnelle améliorée est hautement Genre sensible : traite des inégalités sociales et de l’équité (activité praticable par n’importe quelle personne de n’importe quel statut social avec les mêmes chances)
-        L’entrepreneuriat avicole traditionnelle est réalisable à moindre coût
-        L’aviculture traditionnelle améliorée est économique, écologique et hygiénique
-        L’aviculture contribue à la sécurité alimentaire et à la qualité nutritionnelle

Il s’agit de mécanismes pour une production avicole   traditionnelle améliorée à grande échelle et de rentabilité accélérée et attachée à une formule de pérennisation dénommée No-Siouré (en dialecte moaga).                                          Le rôle essentiel qui s’affiche de cette initiative est : La promotion de l’aviculture traditionnelle (race locale) couplée à une croissance économique en milieu rural à travers :
-        La réduction du temps de travail des producteurs
-        La professionnalisation et même la spécialisation des producteurs
Koudougou - Province du Boulkiemdé - Burkina Faso
ZOUBGA Talinmanègba Claver, Agent de développement communautaire, Formation en Psychologie
A quel défi/problème répond cette solution ?
-        Au chômage des jeunes en milieu rural
-        A la fixation des jeunes dans leurs terroirs
-        A la faible production avicole traditionnelle (race locale)
-        A la faiblesse des revenus de l’aviculture traditionnelle
-        A la faible motivation des producteurs pour l’aviculture traditionnelle
-        A la faible qualité nutritionnelle des ménages ruraux
La principale cible visée par cette initiative est l’ensemble des aviculteurs du milieu rural avec un focus chez les jeunes (femmes et hommes).
En quoi est-ce que cette solution est innovante ?
-        L’aviculture traditionnelle améliorée est un moyen efficace de lutte contre le chômage et la pauvreté en milieu rural.

-        L’aviculture traditionnelle améliorée est hautement Genre sensible : traite des inégalités sociales et de l’équité (activité praticable par n’importe quelle personne de n’importe quel statut social avec les mêmes chances)
-        L’entrepreneuriat avicole traditionnelle est réalisable à moindre coût
-        L’aviculture traditionnelle améliorée est économique, écologique et hygiénique

3663,c-11,"Batteuse de RIZ, MAÏS et ARACHIDE",12/1/21,1/16/23,2,,,GIN,2,camara.moussa@undp.org,Guinea,"Dans la ville de Siguiri et précisément sur l'axe Siguiri - Kouré Mali, se trouve une forge dont l'une des créations est la suivante: Une batteuse de céréale complètement constituée de métaux recyclés et généralement collectés sur place permet aux agriculteurs locaux d'accroitre le rendement en matière de récolte et de tri de semence. Dans la ville de Siguiri et précisément sur l'axe Siguiri - Kouré Mali, se trouve une forge dont l'une des créations est la suivante: Une batteuse de céréale complètement constituée de métaux recyclés et généralement collectés sur place permet aux agriculteurs locaux d'accroitre le rendement en matière de récolte et de tri de semence. 3662,c-11,La batteuse d'arachide de Dabola,12/1/21,1/16/23,2,,,GIN,2,camara.moussa@undp.org,Guinea,"Dans la ville de Dabola et Précisément au marché, se trouve la forge de M. Ibrahima. Parmi ses nombreuses créations et modifications, se trouve cette machine destinée à battre l'arachide pour en extraire les grains. On remarquera la composition à base de métaux recyclés est faite d'unité mécanique pour assurer la fonction de battement le tout relié à un moteur. Le choix des Panneaux solaires et de la ligne électrique ont été écarté  parce qu'ils  constituait une autre source de difficulté sur le temps pour notre entrepreneur.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/a6f58a0b-c389-41db-8d24-aef6580a6877/e445b86abe2eb897d353e1c41c1f95d2.jpg,"La batteuse d'arachide de Dabola

Dans la ville de Dabola et Précisément au marché, se trouve la forge de M. Ibrahima. Parmi ses nombreuses créations et modifications, se trouve cette machine destinée à battre l'arachide pour en extraire les grains. On remarquera la composition à base de métaux recyclés est faite d'unité mécanique pour assurer la fonction de battement le tout relié à un moteur. Le choix des Panneaux solaires et de la ligne électrique ont été écarté  parce qu'ils  constituait une autre source de difficulté sur le temps pour notre entrepreneur.

3660,c-11,le réfrigérateur réservoir de Dabola,12/1/21,1/16/23,2,,,GIN,2,camara.moussa@undp.org,Guinea,"Dans la ville de Dabola et précisément au marché, se trouve un réservoir d'eau  cylindrique au bas duquel se trouvent greffés des robinets permettant à la fois à plusieurs personnes de se désaltérer. On remarquera que ce réservoir est enveloppé dans des couches de tissus en vue de réduire la pénétration de la chaleur; dans la mesure où, le réservoir est fortement et longuement utilisé pour conserver de l'eau fraiche. Il constitue ainsi, une solution de conservation d'eau mais aussi, un moyen de recycler les cylindres de provenant de certaines usines d'huilerie tout comme certaines entreprises de production et ou de vente de carburant. ",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/a6f58a0b-c389-41db-8d24-aef6580a6877/7da7f54076c862228df725c26d57cd6d.jpg,"le réfrigérateur réservoir de Dabola

Dans la ville de Dabola et précisément au marché, se trouve un réservoir d'eau  cylindrique au bas duquel se trouvent greffés des robinets permettant à la fois à plusieurs personnes de se désaltérer. On remarquera que ce réservoir est enveloppé dans des couches de tissus en vue de réduire la pénétration de la chaleur; dans la mesure où, le réservoir est fortement et longuement utilisé pour conserver de l'eau fraiche. Il constitue ainsi, une solution de conservation d'eau mais aussi, un moyen de recycler les cylindres de provenant de certaines usines d'huilerie tout comme certaines entreprises de production et ou de vente de carburant.

3659,c-11,Pot girafe métallique pour fleur ,12/1/21,1/16/23,2,,,GIN,2,camara.moussa@undp.org,Guinea,"A Dabola, pour maitriser la croissance de ses fleurs, notre restaurateur a privilégié ces pots traditionnels aux longues jambes que nous appellerons : le pot girafe. Au delà de l'aspect circonférence, ce pot à base de métaux recyclés permet de protéger les racines contre les écoulements de boue en cas de grande pluies, facilite un nettoyage précis des contours et permet de lutter efficacement contre le gaspillage d'eau destinée au maintient des végétaux cultivés.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/a6f58a0b-c389-41db-8d24-aef6580a6877/5d8fba334d4cb14fec4bbe4ab125d1bc.jpg,"Pot girafe métallique pour fleur

A Dabola, pour maitriser la croissance de ses fleurs, notre restaurateur a privilégié ces pots traditionnels aux longues jambes que nous appellerons : le pot girafe. Au delà de l'aspect circonférence, ce pot à base de métaux recyclés permet de protéger les racines contre les écoulements de boue en cas de grande pluies, facilite un nettoyage précis des contours et permet de lutter efficacement contre le gaspillage d'eau destinée au maintient des végétaux cultivés.

3624,c-28,Container Classroom ,11/22/21,1/16/23,2,,,MUS,2,ayooshee.dookhee@undp.org,Mauritius,"The NGO 'Kolektif Rivier Nwar' works on the West Coast of Mauritius, covering a geographical area from Tamarin to Case Noyale.  This part of the island is one of the poorest, with high numbers of unemployment, drug abuse and children and young adults out of school.  This solution uses a renter container space, which has been converted into a classroom to welcome children and teenagers from the ""cité des salines"" to engage in educational activities provided by the NGO. The field-worker who manages the on-site facility is a resident of the same ""cité"" and maintains access (opening, closing, etc.,) to the container.    The solution addresses many problems that the cité faces and has been a success, as many parents like to send their children there.   The activities involve:  (i) learning to read and write (ii) learning to draw and paint  (iii) learning to engage with one and another  An adjacent field is used for sport coaching and classes.  Activities are supported by: 1 specialised educator 1 occupational therapist 1 child psychologist 1 parental coach 1 sport coach 1 music trainer 1 field worker (lives in the cité)",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/e6b91a28-7cce-41c9-99a2-70a87507b0ac/0f05901cf47bc6db606dc03a4d1331de.jpeg,"Container Classroom

The NGO 'Kolektif Rivier Nwar' works on the West Coast of Mauritius, covering a geographical area from Tamarin to Case Noyale.  This part of the island is one of the poorest, with high numbers of unemployment, drug abuse and children and young adults out of school.  This solution uses a renter container space, which has been converted into a classroom to welcome children and teenagers from the ""cité des salines"" to engage in educational activities provided by the NGO. The field-worker who manages the on-site facility is a resident of the same ""cité"" and maintains access (opening, closing, etc.,) to the container.    The solution addresses many problems that the cité faces and has been a success, as many parents like to send their children there.   The activities involve:  (i) learning to read and write (ii) learning to draw and paint  (iii) learning to engage with one and another  An adjacent field is used for sport coaching and classes.  Activities are supported by: 1 specialised educator 1 occupational therapist 1 child psychologist 1 parental coach 1 sport coach 1 music trainer 1 field worker (lives in the cité)
