L'initiative s'articule autour de plusieurs axes : - Une application mobile gratuite et accessible hors connexion, reconnue parmi les 40 meilleures Innovations dans l'éducation par l'Union Africaine. Elle donne accès aux informations sur les différentes filières (+60) qui existent après le bac, les procédures d'inscription dans les universités, des exemples de parcours pour inspirer les jeunes et casser les barrières d'autocensures, les inscriptions dans les établissements et les actualités éducatives, les bourses disponibles... Les perspectives sont nombreuses avec un peu de soutien. - Un programme de mentorat de jeunes par leurs Ainés - Du contenu vidéo éducatif sur notre chaîne Youtube et bientôt une émission Télé - Des ateliers dans les lycéens au plus près des jeunes. - Référencement du système éducatif Nigériens Karatou Post Bac est reconnu et soutenu à l'international pour son impact social et son intérêt général, répond aux objectifs de développement durable de l'ONU et peut contribuer à l'objectif d'amélioration de l'éducation de qualité au Niger. 3217,c-11,"CAC, when environment, positive attitude and motivation make ONE",7/13/21,1/16/23,3,,,GIN,2,camara.moussa@undp.org,Guinea,"Sur image vous avez une plaque communément appelée dallette (dalle de terrasse)  qui est un ensemble composé de plastiques collectés des déchets dans la  ville de Boké. le plastic chauffé est liquéfié et ainsi malaxé au sable avec une proportion bien définie pour garantir la solidité mais aussi le cohérence entre les différents agrégats utilisés. la solution est ensuite recueillie dans des moules de différentes formes selon le design souhaité. Sur le plan environnemental, cette solution représente un moyen certes de recyclage, de création de richesse et d'auto employabilité des jeunes étudiants sans emploi regroupés en coopérative dénommée Coopérative Action Citoyenne. ",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/a6f58a0b-c389-41db-8d24-aef6580a6877/7e2f63fede7f4f30dc85fa6a9f99f12d.png,"CAC, when environment, positive attitude and motivation make ONE

Sur image vous avez une plaque communément appelée dallette (dalle de terrasse)  qui est un ensemble composé de plastiques collectés des déchets dans la  ville de Boké. le plastic chauffé est liquéfié et ainsi malaxé au sable avec une proportion bien définie pour garantir la solidité mais aussi le cohérence entre les différents agrégats utilisés. la solution est ensuite recueillie dans des moules de différentes formes selon le design souhaité. Sur le plan environnemental, cette solution représente un moyen certes de recyclage, de création de richesse et d'auto employabilité des jeunes étudiants sans emploi regroupés en coopérative dénommée Coopérative Action Citoyenne.

3216,c-11,The power of faith facing of the weakness of the means of a young self-taught innovator,7/13/21,1/16/23,2,,,GIN,2,camara.moussa@undp.org,Guinea,"Mamadou saliou is a young person who went to grade 5 in primary school. from his almost non-illiterate state, he will use the means at his disposal to guarantee himself a self-training in computer science. In Guinea and at Timbi Madina to find enough to pay the housing taxes but also and above all the expenses related to the maintenance of the parents, our friend Saliou, given the difficulty in the field of electrification of rural areas by the government agencies in charge of this, will decide to set up a micro dam system which according to him, for a start, was intended to supply twenty (20) houses. Faced with reprisals from the family, Saliou will gather friends and all the means to be assisted in his task which consisted of building a turbine, buying a coil and interconnecting everything with a dynamism respecting the standards of physics and mechanics. This is how in a few months, he will pick up sheets, iron bars, parts of abandoned vehicles and other utensils to then send them to a boilermaker to constitute them in Turbine. As for the reel, remember that alongside the entrepreneurial spirit is a very seasoned telephone repairer who sells his breakdown service to the various passers-by and travelers who come for their supplies on market days. So here is how Saliou, from nothing succeeded in setting up a micro dam to be installed in a village where river never dry up and  which will probably be used to supply many more houses by the force of the water flowing.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/a6f58a0b-c389-41db-8d24-aef6580a6877/398167e8c5c40e7f3892528bc2788f8a.png,"The power of faith facing of the weakness of the means of a young self-taught innovator

Mamadou saliou is a young person who went to grade 5 in primary school. from his almost non-illiterate state, he will use the means at his disposal to guarantee himself a self-training in computer science. In Guinea and at Timbi Madina to find enough to pay the housing taxes but also and above all the expenses related to the maintenance of the parents, our friend Saliou, given the difficulty in the field of electrification of rural areas by the government agencies in charge of this, will decide to set up a micro dam system which according to him, for a start, was intended to supply twenty (20) houses. Faced with reprisals from the family, Saliou will gather friends and all the means to be assisted in his task which consisted of building a turbine, buying a coil and interconnecting everything with a dynamism respecting the standards of physics and mechanics. This is how in a few months, he will pick up sheets, iron bars, parts of abandoned vehicles and other utensils to then send them to a boilermaker to constitute them in Turbine. As for the reel, remember that alongside the entrepreneurial spirit is a very seasoned telephone repairer who sells his breakdown service to the various passers-by and travelers who come for their supplies on market days. So here is how Saliou, from nothing succeeded in setting up a micro dam to be installed in a village where river never dry up and  which will probably be used to supply many more houses by the force of the water flowing.
sdgs: Decent work and economic growth

3212,c-11,"Yéro Kanté, the man with the hands of steel!",7/12/21,1/16/23,3,,,GIN,2,camara.moussa@undp.org,Guinea,"- Shipwreck off Kanfarandé: 14 dead, one missing and 15 injured. - Guinea-Conakry: at least 15 dead in the sinking of a boat - Kamsar: the sinking of a canoe leaves 3 dead and 15 survivors. These are the tragedies facing which the authorities and residents of Kamsar have long remained unarmed.  Coming from a predominantly modest community, Yéro Kanté, will address the thorny question of finding a viable and lasting solution to the safety of the populations during the various crossings. Thus, with the sole strength of these arms coupled with the enthusiasm of the love of good, he will succeed in bringing together all the elements necessary mostly composed with the recycled metals for the design of a boat. To this day Yéro Kanté, like a true genius who started from nothing, has a naval fleet to his credit. his solution is a local option for the revalorisation of metals in the era side of Kamsar and by the same mean, a long term factor of saving peoples lives.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/a6f58a0b-c389-41db-8d24-aef6580a6877/496a2cc804e737d72241ee6f0392d2a4.png,"Yéro Kanté, the man with the hands of steel!

- Shipwreck off Kanfarandé: 14 dead, one missing and 15 injured. - Guinea-Conakry: at least 15 dead in the sinking of a boat - Kamsar: the sinking of a canoe leaves 3 dead and 15 survivors. These are the tragedies facing which the authorities and residents of Kamsar have long remained unarmed.  Coming from a predominantly modest community, Yéro Kanté, will address the thorny question of finding a viable and lasting solution to the safety of the populations during the various crossings. Thus, with the sole strength of these arms coupled with the enthusiasm of the love of good, he will succeed in bringing together all the elements necessary mostly composed with the recycled metals for the design of a boat. To this day Yéro Kanté, like a true genius who started from nothing, has a naval fleet to his credit. his solution is a local option for the revalorisation of metals in the era side of Kamsar and by the same mean, a long term factor of saving peoples lives.

3211,c-11,the architect of the ghetto,7/12/21,1/16/23,2,,,GIN,2,camara.moussa@undp.org,Guinea,"Leaving vocational school and graduated in masonry, Diallo Alpha Oumar, is a creative genius of design of all kinds. ",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/a6f58a0b-c389-41db-8d24-aef6580a6877/490273755881f140872bb2c4282488da.png,"the architect of the ghetto
Leaving vocational school and graduated in masonry, Diallo Alpha Oumar, is a creative genius of design of all kinds.

Alpha Oumar, since childhood began to create gadgets such as carts, helicopters, shoes, planes and other pure to name a few ...  During its development, it was several times confronted with the problems of funding and supervision which were a real obstacle. One of Alpha Oumar's strengths was that in a dream he was used to visions that he forced himself to implement. He succeeded but still with a few points to review such as taking measurements to properly frame his work. It was therefore necessary for him to follow a training in masonry to understand how to overcome this obstacle. This is how he began to produce models of all kinds, here in image that of a double stadium sports complex with covered roofs. Added to this is his developed sense of adaptability to various trades such as hairdressing, electronics, particularly the repair of mobile phones and other accessories, and finally the carpentry where his action consists of indicating to laborers how to model and assemble what 'he wants to complete for a clientele whose orders are made on the basis of negotiation with regard to the final design to be adopted. Diallo Alpha Oumar would like the government to make available for young people in Guinea, and particularly those from Boké, a center intended to support young people in their businesses. According to him, these centers could be equipped with minimum equipment that could guarantee the development of the spirit of creativity.

3209,c-11,"Yéro, the Hero of palm oil producers.",7/12/21,11/1/24,3,,,GIN,2,camara.moussa@undp.org,Guinea,"Again he, yes him, Yéro Kanté, here he takes on the savior of palm cultivators in the sense that given the difficulty of these in extracting oil properly and therefore to market on a large scale due to the fact that it required transport to processing plants which were excessively expensive, at least for the average producer. Our friend Yéro kate has designed a machine that crushes palm kernels and extracts the oil, bark and seed separately. This solution is of three types: one manual, two other motorized but respectively medium and large capacity. To date, Yéro has managed to make a good situation thanks to the sale of this solution which is very popular with our average growers and which finally allowed him to reach neighboring countries so as to facilitate the sale of his productions. .",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/a6f58a0b-c389-41db-8d24-aef6580a6877/cb4f62446efdcf12d2a254fcdba40e5a.png,"Yéro, the Hero of palm oil producers.

Again he, yes him, Yéro Kanté, here he takes on the savior of palm cultivators in the sense that given the difficulty of these in extracting oil properly and therefore to market on a large scale due to the fact that it required transport to processing plants which were excessively expensive, at least for the average producer. Our friend Yéro kate has designed a machine that crushes palm kernels and extracts the oil, bark and seed separately. This solution is of three types: one manual, two other motorized but respectively medium and large capacity. To date, Yéro has managed to make a good situation thanks to the sale of this solution which is very popular with our average growers and which finally allowed him to reach neighboring countries so as to facilitate the sale of his productions. .

3208,c-11,Helicopter of Yéro; from dream to reality!,7/12/21,1/16/23,3,,,GIN,2,camara.moussa@undp.org,Guinea,"I met an incredible metal genius who succeeded in following all the laws of aerodynamics by building a model helicopter from a visualization.

In Guinea and particularly in Kamsar, there is a man by the name of Yéro Kanté, never educated but who has to his credit creations worthy of an engineer of great schools. Yéro by viewing a helicopter, will bring together all the equipment necessary to make this dream come true. Beyond the physical design, he will meet pilots who will not hesitate to provide him with everything he needs to learn, understand and master all the interdependencies linked to the dynamics of the helicopter. This is how yéro will put everything on its side, with the support of a team of young people guided by the strong desire to see the dream come true; to collect metals, weld them together, make a rotor and hand-crafted propellers and finally buy a motor which will serve to provide a driving power drive to the whole. After days of hard work, Yéro will be congratulated by his friends and almost all the inhabitants for his achievement
,https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/a6f58a0b-c389-41db-8d24-aef6580a6877/c35ef7a5f6b4040a19fd62c072066d38.png,Helicopter of Yéro; from dream to reality!

3207,c-11,The luggage trolley made in Timbi-madina!,7/12/21,1/16/23,2,,,GIN,2,camara.moussa@undp.org,Guinea,"Timbi-Madina is a town and a sub-prefecture of the Pita prefecture in the Mamou region, in north-central Guinea. the city is famous for these great productions of sweet potatoes and the dynamism of its townspeople as regards the organization and the holding of the great days of market.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/a6f58a0b-c389-41db-8d24-aef6580a6877/27e80bb20b76a3ff6dbc7fb523c1b8d3.jpg,"The luggage trolley made in Timbi-madina!

Timbi-Madina is a town and a sub-prefecture of the Pita prefecture in the Mamou region, in north-central Guinea. the city is famous for these great productions of sweet potatoes and the dynamism of its townspeople as regards the organization and the holding of the great days of market.

During these days, flocking from all parts of the villages and other surrounding sub-prefectures. It is therefore in this atmosphere that there are a number of small businesses. Speaking of small businesses, you can find a bit of everything there, vendors full of shoes, electronic aprons that passers-by are crazy about, especially cell phones with long charging capacity, rechargeable radios ... can pass the eyes on the big calibers: the big tradesmen who with a stroke of mastery, load more parcels therefore require more manpower as for the port of these goods towards their means of displacement. This is how our charetiers come into play. Oh yes these long metal boards intended to carry all kinds of luggage.

What struck us the most is that these baggage handlers have established a management system that allows: - or rental for paid use (billed per day). - Or the purchase for personal use (you are free to agree with the customer). - Or by joint ownership with the manufacturer (a certain percentage is paid at the end of the day). According to the citizens of Timbi Madina, this creation is original and specific to the city of Timbi Madina, something that we cannot dispute.

3202,c-22,COVIDEX DRUG,7/6/21,1/16/23,2,,,UGA,2,hadijah.nabbale@undp.org,Uganda,"Approved by Uganda's  National Drug Authority (NDA), COVIDEX is a product formulated from herbal plants that have been traditionally used to alleviate symptoms of several diseases including CoViD-19. It is only available by purchase through registered clinics, pharmacies and drug stores regulated by Uganda's NDA, the product should only be used it is unexpired and sealed.   The product which was developed by Prof. Patrick Ogwang, is an oral consumption medication only to be used by adults (6 drops, 3 times daily) children, ages 5 - 12 years (3 drops 3 times daily) and those younger than 5 years (1 drop, 3 times daily). Consult with a medical doctor before use of this product as it is not WHO approved yet.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/40119c91-a65d-46a8-b910-383024e2ca6c/76de139a8cf7b4f215f1747a1caf5886.jpg,"COVIDEX DRUG

Approved by Uganda's  National Drug Authority (NDA), COVIDEX is a product formulated from herbal plants that have been traditionally used to alleviate symptoms of several diseases including CoViD-19. It is only available by purchase through registered clinics, pharmacies and drug stores regulated by Uganda's NDA, the product should only be used it is unexpired and sealed.   The product which was developed by Prof. Patrick Ogwang, is an oral consumption medication only to be used by adults (6 drops, 3 times daily) children, ages 5 - 12 years (3 drops 3 times daily) and those younger than 5 years (1 drop, 3 times daily). Consult with a medical doctor before use of this product as it is not WHO approved yet.

3191,c-11,The silente chair of Filao Hotel in Boké,7/5/21,1/16/23,2,,,GIN,2,camara.moussa@undp.org,Guinea,In the locality of Boké there is a hotel that respects the comfort of its customers and anxious to keep a space conducive to reflection. This establishment guarantees you a quality silence through its works in this case the silent chair.,https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/a6f58a0b-c389-41db-8d24-aef6580a6877/6f9ad32947249f852ecaa47e006defa0.jpg,"The silente chair of Filao Hotel in Boké

In the locality of Boké there is a hotel that respects the comfort of its customers and anxious to keep a space conducive to reflection. This establishment guarantees you a quality silence through its works in this case the silent chair.

While passing through Boké, one of the towns of the lower coast of Guinea known for its basement and its geomine university, you will find on the national road 3 Complexe Hôtelier Filaoplus. A fairly well welcoming establishment with respect for the guests, the cost of the rooms varying between 35 and 70 Usd per night, the two reception rooms imensely dressed with good quality table covers and a smiling and very courteous staff willing to do everything implemented to satisfy customers. speaking of the rooms, you will necessarily find it to your liking. But what appeals is this quet of silence which is allowed even for the installed equipment. It looks like a deaf choir of its Mute, in the ocurence that of the chair placed at the small desk formed for your nocturnal typing and writing exercises. This chair has been completed in its elant by a kind of soft plastic slipper to break up the deafening noise that we make when we pull them up and most often the parents lecture us to lift the chair. Here, this is a great innovation, Zero noise, at least not to disturb the neighbor next door. do not hesitate to visit them while passing through Boké!

3190,c-11,"Dowè Mosque, the blessed land of animals",7/5/21,1/16/23,2,,,GIN,2,camara.moussa@undp.org,Guinea,"In a mosq where human and animal are welcome! Where water is considered as tresaure to not be wasted and any by any mean, blessing should be kept... Welcome in Dowè Village!",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/a6f58a0b-c389-41db-8d24-aef6580a6877/e82babbcc7e65662d814cf8aaa15e7fe.png,"Dowè Mosque, the blessed land of animals
In a mosq where human and animal are welcome! Where water is considered as tresaure to not be wasted and any by any mean, blessing should be kept... Welcome in Dowè Village!

Dowè is a transit village between Labé and Mamou in Guinea, precisely located 56Km from Timbi Madina. The first building that strikes you at the start of the school year is indeed this mosque. In the normal functioning of mosques in Guinea, there are separate spaces dedicated to the prayer of men and women. Dest toilets and wells or taps intended for the taking of ablution (ritual washing of purification).  At the Dorè mosque, one thing very quickly sublimated me, the support erected to support the tap breaks the rule of applied art common to mosques. Here under the tap is a biline cemented to form a channel allowing the water to flow. Usually the water would be lost on the path in the earth as it moves forward.  Here the change brought is that at the end of the circuit formed by the two lines of cemented blocks there is a kind of rectangular basin which is definitely a water receptacle designed to allow the animals to drink. Yes goats, cattle and others find their accounts there. What a great initiative, to conserve water to serve as many people as possible, even if they are animals.

3187,c-11,IST Electric Management System  ,7/4/21,1/16/23,3,,,GIN,2,camara.moussa@undp.org,Guinea,"If you are looking for a solution to control your electricity consumption and, in turn, lower your bill at the end of the month, this is indeed a device that will please you. it is a circuit assembly designed to adapt switching on and off by means of an SMS which you can send from any point on earth. Let's say it's an executor of will dictated through the short messaging system ....... For the moment this solution is in full swing and could well be available very soon on the market. This is also designed by the team of IST of Mamou.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/a6f58a0b-c389-41db-8d24-aef6580a6877/748932c9ac3909e6cd75760a491f6474.jpeg,"IST Electric Management System

If you are looking for a solution to control your electricity consumption and, in turn, lower your bill at the end of the month, this is indeed a device that will please you. it is a circuit assembly designed to adapt switching on and off by means of an SMS which you can send from any point on earth. Let's say it's an executor of will dictated through the short messaging system ....... For the moment this solution is in full swing and could well be available very soon on the market. This is also designed by the team of IST of Mamou.

3170,c-11,The IST Surge protection,6/25/21,1/16/23,3,,,GIN,2,camara.moussa@undp.org,Guinea,"Guinea, a country located on the west coast of Africa is endowed with a high rainfall, and has a vast network of rivers which earned it the name of water tower of Africa. A wealth taken advantage of by the government by the construction of certain dams for the provision of drinking water and electricity to the populations. However, the obsolescence of the circuits used to transport electricity, the use of certain alternatives such as generators, thunder, to name but a few, cause enormous losses for the population both in human lives and with regard to household electrical equipment. To respond to this problem, our research team at the Mamou IST center has set up a device to cut the circuit when the voltage level no longer corresponds to that expected in the circuit. This device is practically operational and will be available for low-income households.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/a6f58a0b-c389-41db-8d24-aef6580a6877/805d6c7ff536ebe0713a1f499875d435.jpeg,"The IST Surge protection

Guinea, a country located on the west coast of Africa is endowed with a high rainfall, and has a vast network of rivers which earned it the name of water tower of Africa. A wealth taken advantage of by the government by the construction of certain dams for the provision of drinking water and electricity to the populations. However, the obsolescence of the circuits used to transport electricity, the use of certain alternatives such as generators, thunder, to name but a few, cause enormous losses for the population both in human lives and with regard to household electrical equipment. To respond to this problem, our research team at the Mamou IST center has set up a device to cut the circuit when the voltage level no longer corresponds to that expected in the circuit. This device is practically operational and will be available for low-income households.

3169,c-11,IST Compact sanitary protection kit,6/25/21,1/16/23,3,,,GIN,2,camara.moussa@undp.org,Guinea,"While everyone held their heads on the issue of covid, Guinea, through its team of engineers from the IST institute in Mamou, set to work hard and ended up designing a device for KRAPOS name which means: Automatic Sanitary Protection Kit, whose role is to Test and Prevent covid-19 disease, by aggregating the following functionalities: Scanner for the temperature level, hand washing with a reservoir integrated soap and drinking water, hand drying after washing and finally, a water level indicator to deal with any possible shortage.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/a6f58a0b-c389-41db-8d24-aef6580a6877/5e3d2a1e8f4e4b0005dfe4ff5a7427cc.jpeg,"IST Compact sanitary protection kit

While everyone held their heads on the issue of covid, Guinea, through its team of engineers from the IST institute in Mamou, set to work hard and ended up designing a device for KRAPOS name which means: Automatic Sanitary Protection Kit, whose role is to Test and Prevent covid-19 disease, by aggregating the following functionalities: Scanner for the temperature level, hand washing with a reservoir integrated soap and drinking water, hand drying after washing and finally, a water level indicator to deal with any possible shortage.

On the strength of their results, the team of researchers finally presented their solution to OAPI at the African technological innovation fair where it was awarded the UEMOA prize et lui en a même dressé un Brévet. Our team of engineers has already started marketing this device and has prioritized other university education institutions.

3164,c-19,TOLBI : Smart agriculture in local languages ,6/24/21,1/16/23,2,,,SEN,0,hassanatou.ba@live.fr,Senegal,"Description  Tolbi provides real-time information for effective decision making on irrigation, disease management and yield forecasting to agricultural stakeholders especially small scale producers for a Climate-Smart Agriculture. e-Tolbi resides in the mash-up of global data (satellite images, research work, plant data sheets, diseases) with data related to the smallholder (credit history, property title, mobile money subscriber service, etc.) and data related to the farm (soil data, location, geography, history, etc.) to deliver highly accurate information, predictions and better decision-making for all stakeholders in the agricultural value chain. The data is collected by satellite, drones, from agricultural cooperatives, national agricultural agencies and then centralized through a platform to deliver real-time and reliable information to small farmers in local languages on IVR/SMS voice. This allows agricultural advisors and investors to be able to remotely monitor small farmers in real time through a web-based SAAS platform for accurate alerts and updates based on the data provided. Through the e-Tolbi marketplace, agregator companies, traders and supermarkets will be able to make pre-orders through yield forecasts  based on machine learning algorithms and enable smallholders and their partners to sell at good prices and ensure early marketing. video link : https://youtu.be/W3oviAR0BVU",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/7540db86-59d5-4db7-9809-34e706ec05a7/9344d184020de3e3f94a8c0b06626d23.jpeg,"TOLBI : Smart agriculture in local languages

Description  Tolbi provides real-time information for effective decision making on irrigation, disease management and yield forecasting to agricultural stakeholders especially small scale producers for a Climate-Smart Agriculture. e-Tolbi resides in the mash-up of global data (satellite images, research work, plant data sheets, diseases) with data related to the smallholder (credit history, property title, mobile money subscriber service, etc.) and data related to the farm (soil data, location, geography, history, etc.) to deliver highly accurate information, predictions and better decision-making for all stakeholders in the agricultural value chain. The data is collected by satellite, drones, from agricultural cooperatives, national agricultural agencies and then centralized through a platform to deliver real-time and reliable information to small farmers in local languages on IVR/SMS voice. This allows agricultural advisors and investors to be able to remotely monitor small farmers in real time through a web-based SAAS platform for accurate alerts and updates based on the data provided. Through the e-Tolbi marketplace, agregator companies, traders and supermarkets will be able to make pre-orders through yield forecasts  based on machine learning algorithms and enable smallholders and their partners to sell at good prices and ensure early marketing. video link : https://youtu.be/W3oviAR0BVU

Challenges Small-scale farmers lose 60-80% of their irrigation water every day due to lack of water control. Late detection of diseases results in an estimated 30% loss of agricultural yield for small farmers. Microfinance institutes lack reliable information and data to set up financial insurance policies to allow small farmers to benefit from financing. They negatively impact the ability of small-scale farmers to innovate in production due to lack of means and to obtain optimal yields due to losses and poor water management.

Insights Tolbi aims to enable small-scale producers to access different services such as production-related services (from the pre-harvest phase to the post-harvest phase to assist and advise them on best practices to combat diseases that can hinder production), finance-related services with detailed field data that can help credit companies to build a reliable credit profile and deliver loans to smallholder farmers more easily, trade and market-related services by facilitating linkages with stakeholders and access to information on best prices, and services related to subscriptions to the cooperative (member management with CRM, distributed communications. .). e-Tobli's services will enable small farmers to take advantage of technological innovations (drone, artificial intelligence, IoT, satellite) with adapted IVR interfaces in local languages and voice SMS for women and illiterate youth and a mobile application for those who are better equipped and also considerably increase their income with accurate information on the agricultural health (disease, weeds), exact needs for water and fertilization as well as forecasts of harvest periods to aid production-related planning.

Manque de données fiables sur Agrobusiness au Niger;
A l’origine, une solution conçue en réponse à l’impact de la pandémie COVID 19 sur les petits producteurs
Vulnérabilité à la propagation du virus du fait de leur dépendance aux petites transactions commerciales informelles (marchés)
Accès limités aux marchés avec les mesures édictées par le gouvernement
Mais identification d’un impact positif sur les débouchés des petits producteurs (conservation, stockage) .
Compétitivité pour le secteur agricole au niveau international
Bancarisation des producteurs (surtout des petits) est encouragée, en façonnant un mécanisme fiable, simple et délocalisé grâce au réseau de la Maison du Paysan.
-Traçabilité des flux bancaires du secteur agricole sera améliorée, permettant également de recueillir des informations en temps réel sur les revenus générés par le secteur ;
-Revenu des petits producteurs sera sécurisé, le revenu des producteurs n’est plus amputé et leur disponibilité pour augmenter la production est assurée ;

-Digitalisation de l’économie est encouragée : en proposant une solution numérique (sur la base d’une solution cartographiée par le Lab de plateforme de e-commerce), facile d’accès et disponible sur l’ensemble du territoire.

3124,c-18,Plastic waste into bricks,6/10/21,1/16/23,2,,,ETH,2,amanuel.tadesse@undp.org,Ethiopia,"The plastic bags converted into  useful paving bricks. First the waste plastic bag is collected and melted. The melted plastic bag is mixed with sand, poured the mixture in to mold  sheet and then dried up to complete the process

The recycling is useful to reduce water and soil pollution that will be occurred due to uncollected plastic bag waste. Moreover, it’s benefit is extended to reduce infrastructure damage as far as the plastic waste is collected from ditches and roadsides and converted to paving bricks.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/d4f9b41c-bd86-464e-b759-73079e51709f/cf76af21b9c8edfbd9dee3d95d04d521.jpg,"Plastic waste into bricks

The plastic bags converted into  useful paving bricks. First the waste plastic bag is collected and melted. The melted plastic bag is mixed with sand, poured the mixture in to mold  sheet and then dried up to complete the process

The recycling is useful to reduce water and soil pollution that will be occurred due to uncollected plastic bag waste. Moreover, it’s benefit is extended to reduce infrastructure damage as far as the plastic waste is collected from ditches and roadsides and converted to paving bricks.
sdgs: Decent work and economic growth

3122,c-18,organic waste to compost,6/10/21,1/16/23,2,,,ETH,2,amanuel.tadesse@undp.org,Ethiopia,"The Aerobic windrow composting passes multiple stages before the soil like compost is realized. The MSEs are producing the compost using semi manual method using tractored pulled turning machine to enhance production in quantity and quality.

3106,c-34,FINAGROS : FERME INTEGREE AGROALIMENTAIRE SOLAIRE,6/2/21,1/16/23,2,,,NER,2,assane.boukar@undp.org,Niger,"Le Projet FINAGROS a pour objet de créer un écosystème favorable à l’épanouissement des petits producteurs et des associations rurales dans les domaines des énergies renouvelables, de l’environnement, de l’agriculture, de l’élevage, de la transformation et la conservation agroalimentaire. Il cible ainsi les opportunités locales d’emploi et l’employabilité des jeunes et des femmes grâce au développement des ressources locales de formation professionnelle et entrepreneuriale correspondant aux besoins du marché à travers les chaînes de valeur pérenne  grâce à : • L’énergie solaire • L’eau • Développement des compétences  Pour aboutir à la sécurité alimentaire, l’employabilité des jeunes et des femmes, la lutte contre la pauvreté et l’insécurité ",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/2817119a-f880-4b4e-97cc-103ae4a24a3b/6e20b0969e350a7887db6352688a9554.png,"FINAGROS : FERME INTEGREE AGROALIMENTAIRE SOLAIRE

Le Projet FINAGROS a pour objet de créer un écosystème favorable à l’épanouissement des petits producteurs et des associations rurales dans les domaines des énergies renouvelables, de l’environnement, de l’agriculture, de l’élevage, de la transformation et la conservation agroalimentaire. Il cible ainsi les opportunités locales d’emploi et l’employabilité des jeunes et des femmes grâce au développement des ressources locales de formation professionnelle et entrepreneuriale correspondant aux besoins du marché à travers les chaînes de valeur pérenne  grâce à : • L’énergie solaire • L’eau • Développement des compétences  Pour aboutir à la sécurité alimentaire, l’employabilité des jeunes et des femmes, la lutte contre la pauvreté et l’insécurité

- Utilisation de l'énergie solaire et de nouvelles technologies(gestion rationnelle de l'eau, production d'engrais organique, preservation de l'environnement...) - Interaction des différentes chaines de valeur(agricole, avicole, piscicole, ruminants, petites transformations agroalimentaire) -Création d'une plateforme en ligne de mise en relation producteurs & clients et information sur le marché -Promotion de l’éthique et de l’intégrité de la profession et la qualité des services rendus - Respect et implication du genre -Formations métiers qualifiantes -Développement (entreprenariat, incubation, mise en relation, suivi et accompagnement)

3105,c-34,AGADJI DETECTOR,6/2/21,1/16/23,2,,,NER,2,assane.boukar@undp.org,Niger,"Agadji detecteur est un appareil Electronique qui assure la sécurité domestique. En cas de fuite d'une bouteille de gaz (le gaz utilisé pour les préparations de plats, etc.). Cet appareil va fermer automatiquement la bouteille et prévient l'intéressé via un appel téléphonique et un son d'alarme. En cas d'incendie, l'appareil va prévenir via un appel téléphonique le concerné, dépasser un délai de 30 secondes sans éteindre l'incendie, ce dernier va automatiquement appeler les sapeurs-pompiers via un appel téléphonique tout en n'indiquant vocalement le numéro de porte de la maison, le quartier etc. pour faciliter sa localisation.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/2817119a-f880-4b4e-97cc-103ae4a24a3b/466f24f7e045512a3b5201f9494f4ff0.jpg,"AGADJI DETECTOR

Agadji detecteur est un appareil Electronique qui assure la sécurité domestique. En cas de fuite d'une bouteille de gaz (le gaz utilisé pour les préparations de plats, etc.). Cet appareil va fermer automatiquement la bouteille et prévient l'intéressé via un appel téléphonique et un son d'alarme. En cas d'incendie, l'appareil va prévenir via un appel téléphonique le concerné, dépasser un délai de 30 secondes sans éteindre l'incendie, ce dernier va automatiquement appeler les sapeurs-pompiers via un appel téléphonique tout en n'indiquant vocalement le numéro de porte de la maison, le quartier etc. pour faciliter sa localisation.
En cas de fuite d'une bouteille de gaz, l'appareil fermer la bouteille et prévient l'intéressé via un appel téléphonique. En cas incendie dans une habitation, l'appareil averti les sapeurs-pompiers.

3091,c-22,Space Technology Agency Limited,5/26/21,1/16/23,2,,,UGA,2,hadijah.nabbale@undp.org,Uganda,"Space Technology Agency (STA) specializes in tracking air and water pollution in informal settlements. STA aims to advance the inclusive use of space science tools and services for socio-economic development. STA expects to impact Uganda through an improved sewerage management system and increased mechanisms that will reduce air and water pollution.   STA use modern technology to measure air and water quality against the index, their aerosol micro-robots measure with reference to the Air Quality Index (AQI) and Water Quality Index (WQI) respectively, purity or contamination details are then interpreted in their medium. STA’S solution will make use of technologies like artificial intelligence (AI) and robotics to determine the quality index. Using the AI route, images of water and air will be fed into a model which extracts features to be utilized in figuring out the quality index of the air or water. The data set created will contain images from different geographical positions with their accompanying quality indices to be fed into STA’s model used in mobile devices and robotics. This solution makes use of robotics with different sensors and cameras. They may include: 1.     Camera 2.     Carbon monoxide sensor 3.     Carbon dioxide sensor 4.     A combined ph. and temperature sensor 5.     Turbidity sensor 6.     Lidar sensor These sensors are used to formulate a micro-robot or even included on a drone used for surveys and to gather necessary data for the air quality and water quality indices. They are made from 3D printed material and electronically recycled components, all of which can be obtained locally.   The solution provides data on change detection for Air and Water pollution in slums of Kampala and provides a warning system for contamination levels in the environment as a means to prevent health hazards caused by pollution.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/40119c91-a65d-46a8-b910-383024e2ca6c/b440a0bda05c7e446d0315cd297249ab.png,"Space Technology Agency Limited

Space Technology Agency (STA) specializes in tracking air and water pollution in informal settlements. STA aims to advance the inclusive use of space science tools and services for socio-economic development. STA expects to impact Uganda through an improved sewerage management system and increased mechanisms that will reduce air and water pollution.   STA use modern technology to measure air and water quality against the index, their aerosol micro-robots measure with reference to the Air Quality Index (AQI) and Water Quality Index (WQI) respectively, purity or contamination details are then interpreted in their medium. STA’S solution will make use of technologies like artificial intelligence (AI) and robotics to determine the quality index. Using the AI route, images of water and air will be fed into a model which extracts features to be utilized in figuring out the quality index of the air or water. The data set created will contain images from different geographical positions with their accompanying quality indices to be fed into STA’s model used in mobile devices and robotics. This solution makes use of robotics with different sensors and cameras. They may include: 1.     Camera 2.     Carbon monoxide sensor 3.     Carbon dioxide sensor 4.     A combined ph. and temperature sensor 5.     Turbidity sensor 6.     Lidar sensor These sensors are used to formulate a micro-robot or even included on a drone used for surveys and to gather necessary data for the air quality and water quality indices. They are made from 3D printed material and electronically recycled components, all of which can be obtained locally.   The solution provides data on change detection for Air and Water pollution in slums of Kampala and provides a warning system for contamination levels in the environment as a means to prevent health hazards caused by pollution.

3070,c-34,Portique moustiquaire,5/25/21,1/16/23,2,,,NER,2,assane.boukar@undp.org,Niger,Les supports de moustiquaires et de tentes à installation et démontage ultra rapide sur toute forme de terrains appelé « quick »  sont  constitué de tubes encastrables qu’on assemble pour créer un cadre solide sur lequel on peut attacher la moustiquaire. Quand on aura fini de l’utiliser on le démonte pour le mettre dans un étui qu’on peut transporter partout avec soi. Ils sont d'usage faciles et correctes de la moustiquaire sur toutes formes de terrains pour prévenir les piqures des moustiques et des mouches  vecteurs du paludisme et de plusieurs maladies,https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/2817119a-f880-4b4e-97cc-103ae4a24a3b/78f64bcaa72b442d59d30f10831e7554.png,"Portique moustiquaire

Les supports de moustiquaires et de tentes à installation et démontage ultra rapide sur toute forme de terrains appelé « quick »  sont  constitué de tubes encastrables qu’on assemble pour créer un cadre solide sur lequel on peut attacher la moustiquaire. Quand on aura fini de l’utiliser on le démonte pour le mettre dans un étui qu’on peut transporter partout avec soi. Ils sont d'usage faciles et correctes de la moustiquaire sur toutes formes de terrains pour prévenir les piqures des moustiques et des mouches  vecteurs du paludisme et de plusieurs maladies

Ces supports de moustiquaire permettent d’installer une moustiquaire surtout sur des terrains durs qu’on ne peut pas creuser,  comme les terrasses. Il permet également de résoudre le problème de la moustiquaire, quand on est en voyage.
sdgs: Decent work and economic growth

3069,c-34, LEDABANE ou  « fini le plastique ».,5/25/21,1/16/23,2,,,NER,2,assane.boukar@undp.org,Niger,"La prolifération des déchets plastiques dans les centres urbains et même ruraux est  l’un des plus grands problèmes environnementaux auxquels l’humanité fait face aujourd’hui. En effet les déchets plastiques, outre l’insalubrité qu’ils causent dans l’environnement, intoxiquent les animaux, bloquent l’infiltration des eaux, asphyxient les plantes sur lesquelles ils se déposent, remplissent les fleuves, les puits et les marigots. C’est pour répondre à cette préoccupation que l'Association Nigérienne Pour la Promotion de l’ Invention et de l’Innovation (ANPII) a mis au point un nouveau type de poubelle incinérateur mobile. Ce dispositif d'assainissement est appelé  « LEDABANE » dans la langue locale Zarma qui signifie en français « fini le plastique ».",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/2817119a-f880-4b4e-97cc-103ae4a24a3b/fa6fd7799a4c76725ef76e6a23991631.png,"LEDABANE ou  « fini le plastique ».

La prolifération des déchets plastiques dans les centres urbains et même ruraux est  l’un des plus grands problèmes environnementaux auxquels l’humanité fait face aujourd’hui. En effet les déchets plastiques, outre l’insalubrité qu’ils causent dans l’environnement, intoxiquent les animaux, bloquent l’infiltration des eaux, asphyxient les plantes sur lesquelles ils se déposent, remplissent les fleuves, les puits et les marigots. C’est pour répondre à cette préoccupation que l'Association Nigérienne Pour la Promotion de l’ Invention et de l’Innovation (ANPII) a mis au point un nouveau type de poubelle incinérateur mobile. Ce dispositif d'assainissement est appelé  « LEDABANE » dans la langue locale Zarma qui signifie en français « fini le plastique ».

3068,c-22,Saerd Centre Limited,5/25/21,1/16/23,2,,,UGA,2,hadijah.nabbale@undp.org,Uganda,"Saerd Centre are a company who specialize in a multi-dimensional approach to flood control in Kampala city. The organization was founded in 2017 with a focus of developing innovative appropriate solutions and offer practical training, their belief is that innovation is a vital part of development of new industries and the industrial transformation to create a smarter society in Africa.   Flash floods affect many parts of Kampala city causing heavy rainfall, poorly maintained drainage systems, waste disposal in drainage channels, silting in natural channels and improper house planning of city suburbs contribute to the flooding. In 2020 alone Kampala experienced over 4 deadly flash floods which have left more than two dead and caused not only city-wide disruptions on travel and businesses but also destruction of properties and wide spread of water-borne diseases.   Saerd’s main goal is to develop multi-dimensional structural and non-structural approach to control occasional floods and simultaneously mitigate future flood occurrences, currently the existing flood control measures include desilting of the channels to curb the floods regular maintenance of drainages but are inadequate. Saerd’s solution entails the structural measures which include water harvesting & multi-storage (i.e., underground reservoirs, drainage pumps). While there is a possibility of channeling this water to Lake Victoria, it can serve water needs in other sectors such as urban agriculture and industries. Moreover, underground water storage systems are one of the most sustainable approaches that has worked in other countries, for example, the one of Tokyo called the floodwater cathedral hidden 22 meters underground. The integration of the public-private partnership (PPP Model) into Saerd’s solution to drive capacity and sustainability is vital for providing much-needed support for monitoring, management and facility use.   The following can be expected at the end of the project: 1.      A feasibility study plan for flood control and storm water management of the Kampala city. 2.     A Master plan on comprehensive flood and storm water management entailing structural and non-structural measures. 3.     Designed and constructed multi storage, underground tanks/reservoirs, drainage pumps and Water harvesting system. 4.     Addition of new opportunities in the job market. 5.     Development of a new flood forecasting and warning system.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/40119c91-a65d-46a8-b910-383024e2ca6c/fab610145f4ed0ae3de8eb8d1c5fa669.png,"Saerd Centre Limited

3050,c-34,Transformation des aliments d’arbres indigènes,5/21/21,1/16/23,2,,,NER,2,assane.boukar@undp.org,Niger,"Transformation et valorisation des fruits, graines et feuilles des espèces d’arbres alimentaires indigènes du pays. Celles-ci, au nombre de quelques douzaines dans leur ensemble, ont des saisons de récoltes décalés, permettant de créer de l’activité en milieu rural tous les mois de l’année. Leur adaptation naturelle au climat aride sahélien font qu’ils résistent mieux aux années de sécheresse ou de décalage pluviométrique, et peuvent produire souvent même lorsque les céréales classiques échouent. Aussi, certains de ces espèces ont une productivité moyenne supérieur aux cultures céréalières, tel que l’arbuste de hanza (Boscia senegalensis) qui produit en moyenne 100g de pseudo-céréale par m² d’espace de champ occupé, ce qui vaut plus de deux fois la production céréalière classique. Finalement, les aliments des arbres pris dans leur ensemble couvrent tous les éléments nutritifs nécessaires à l’organisme humain. Cependant, ils ont souvent besoin d’une transformation pour faciliter leur préparation en cuisine, ou pour écarter des composants amers présents à leur état naturel. Ces transformations les rendent adaptés aux habitudes de consommateurs du 21ème siècle et leur permet de redécouvrir leurs usages traditionnels, tout en y ajoutant des innovations sur les produits à en dériver. Les aliments d’arbres transformés, bien qu’ayant été utilisés dans l’histoire, ont été abandonnés en temps modernes et souvent fortement stigmatisés comme aliments de pénurie et de famine. Cette initiative reprend ces aliments oubliés, méprisés d’arbres indigènes saharao-saheliens à morphologie souvent épineuse et ratatinée, et à saveurs bruts souvent sérieusement amères, afin de les transformer en aliments de qualité pouvant être appréciés comme des délices et pratiques à consommer pour l’homme du 21ème siècle.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/2817119a-f880-4b4e-97cc-103ae4a24a3b/6da390b1ea83da76a258fd9e9789b2f7.png,"Transformation des aliments d’arbres indigènes

Transformation et valorisation des fruits, graines et feuilles des espèces d’arbres alimentaires indigènes du pays. Celles-ci, au nombre de quelques douzaines dans leur ensemble, ont des saisons de récoltes décalés, permettant de créer de l’activité en milieu rural tous les mois de l’année. Leur adaptation naturelle au climat aride sahélien font qu’ils résistent mieux aux années de sécheresse ou de décalage pluviométrique, et peuvent produire souvent même lorsque les céréales classiques échouent. Aussi, certains de ces espèces ont une productivité moyenne supérieur aux cultures céréalières, tel que l’arbuste de hanza (Boscia senegalensis) qui produit en moyenne 100g de pseudo-céréale par m² d’espace de champ occupé, ce qui vaut plus de deux fois la production céréalière classique. Finalement, les aliments des arbres pris dans leur ensemble couvrent tous les éléments nutritifs nécessaires à l’organisme humain. Cependant, ils ont souvent besoin d’une transformation pour faciliter leur préparation en cuisine, ou pour écarter des composants amers présents à leur état naturel. Ces transformations les rendent adaptés aux habitudes de consommateurs du 21ème siècle et leur permet de redécouvrir leurs usages traditionnels, tout en y ajoutant des innovations sur les produits à en dériver. Les aliments d’arbres transformés, bien qu’ayant été utilisés dans l’histoire, ont été abandonnés en temps modernes et souvent fortement stigmatisés comme aliments de pénurie et de famine. Cette initiative reprend ces aliments oubliés, méprisés d’arbres indigènes saharao-saheliens à morphologie souvent épineuse et ratatinée, et à saveurs bruts souvent sérieusement amères, afin de les transformer en aliments de qualité pouvant être appréciés comme des délices et pratiques à consommer pour l’homme du 21ème siècle.
sdgs: Decent work and economic growth

3044,c-34,Propagation des plantes vivaces indigènes par le semis direct,5/21/21,1/16/23,2,,,NER,2,assane.boukar@undp.org,Niger,"La technique du semis direct est une technique simple mais précise, qui mimique les conditions de propagation des plantes naturelles, en respectant la génétique sauvage des plantes, ne demandant ni irrigation, ni engrais. Elle permet de faire pousser des arbres et d'autres espèces vivantes indigènes à moindre coût, et fonctionne particulièrement bien sur les terres agricoles pour les fins d'agroforesterie. Les plantes établies par cette technique développent un système racinaire très épanoui, ce qui leur permet de résister aux sécheresses. La pratique peut s'utiliser à partir de l'isohyète de 150 mm jusqu'à celle de 600 mm, voir même au-delà. Dans les zones les plus arides, une quinzaine d'espèces indigènes peuvent être établies par cette technique, et dans les zones plus humides, plus d'une cinquantaine. Le semis direct est une technique de reboisement très adaptée aux zones arides, parce qu'elle permet l'épanouissement du système racinaire, essentiel à l'adaptation de la plante à son milieu. La technique développée par Rewild.Earth est basée sur 35 ans de recherches sur les types d'espèces qui peuvent être établies, les configurations d'ensemencement, les profondeurs de semis, les traitements de semences, les modes et durées de conservation des semences et bien d'autres paramètres. Elle a permis de trouver les diversités optimales de techniques pour reboiser les champs de culture céréalières avec des essences indigènes, sans nécessiter d'irrigation ni d'engrais, et à bas coût, tout en conservant la génétique naturelle des espèces. Plus de 100 espèces différentes ont été expérimentées. Ces espèces sont ensuite de grandes valeurs alimentaires,",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/2817119a-f880-4b4e-97cc-103ae4a24a3b/0a8c1eb9ef4f484d31f2278f4b04d24e.png,"Propagation des plantes vivaces indigènes par le semis direct

3035,c-37,English - Siswati Tourism Manual,5/20/21,1/16/23,2,,,SWZ,2,nontobeko.mlangeni@undp.org,Eswatini,"The English - Siswati manual aims to solve the language barrier between non-siswati speakers and native speakers when it comes to communication especially tourists who come into the country to explore the Kingdom of Eswatini with the interests in culture, tradition, tourist attraction areas and most importantly learning a new language, in this case being the Siswati language. The manual sets to translates over 3000+ English words that are translatable in Siswati. Non siSwati speakers will have the pleasure of learning basic Siswati words for communication purposes. Since most tourists are unfamiliar to the Swati language and culture, they will get an opportunity to learn about different Siswati words, basic Siswati sentences, traditional regalia, Swazi cuisine etc. This way non Siswati speakers, tourists or not will learn more about the Kingdom of Eswatini and broaden the language spectrum. The product will come in the form of a hard copy handbook/manual at first and then progress to be in a digital form (Soft copy or an app) depending on the target market's demand. It is going to cater for both digital users and people who prefer hardcopy manuals. This manual will put Eswatini on the map help develop the Siswati language and culture. The project is looking forwarding to engaging with the Ministry of Tourism and Environmental Affairs, as a key stakeholder to realizing this project.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/2deb6d53-592b-4758-8404-37fcc4ae20fd/37678d34bbc597f0528bd9fdbdf9ac77.jpg,"English - Siswati Tourism Manual

The English - Siswati manual aims to solve the language barrier between non-siswati speakers and native speakers when it comes to communication especially tourists who come into the country to explore the Kingdom of Eswatini with the interests in culture, tradition, tourist attraction areas and most importantly learning a new language, in this case being the Siswati language. The manual sets to translates over 3000+ English words that are translatable in Siswati. Non siSwati speakers will have the pleasure of learning basic Siswati words for communication purposes. Since most tourists are unfamiliar to the Swati language and culture, they will get an opportunity to learn about different Siswati words, basic Siswati sentences, traditional regalia, Swazi cuisine etc. This way non Siswati speakers, tourists or not will learn more about the Kingdom of Eswatini and broaden the language spectrum. The product will come in the form of a hard copy handbook/manual at first and then progress to be in a digital form (Soft copy or an app) depending on the target market's demand. It is going to cater for both digital users and people who prefer hardcopy manuals. This manual will put Eswatini on the map help develop the Siswati language and culture. The project is looking forwarding to engaging with the Ministry of Tourism and Environmental Affairs, as a key stakeholder to realizing this project.

3032,c-37,SVTECH: Improving the ease of doing Business and Reliable Technological Solutions.,5/20/21,1/16/23,2,,,SWZ,2,nontobeko.mlangeni@undp.org,Eswatini,"SVTECH is a software development company that is aimed at improving the ease of doing business and building reliable technological solutions. Their mission is to make a qualitative difference to the lives of millions of people and organizations in Eswatini and across the continent by empowering them with the power of information telecommunications technology.  SVTECH’s goals are to:  1. Empower businesses and individuals to keep them ahead.  2. Be a leader in market share, quality, revenue, growth and gross margins.  3. Add value to stakeholders, our investors, customers, partners and associates 4. Build on Eswatini’s unique advantages.  Services and software solutions currently under SVTECH’s portfolio include the following:  Smart Card Printing, Network Installation and management, hardware repair and refurbishing, bulk SMS platform, online school platform, retail point of sale, biometric clocking system, and  online survey application. SVTECH recently developed a mobile application that will help agriculture stakeholders manage farmer’s data. They have put the functionality to send bulk SMS's to farmers to notify them about opportunities and information they will need to know about the agriculture industry. The application will also enable Eswatini Agricultural Union (ESNAU) to link farmers to financial services. Farmers are able to pay for input subsidy and further manage their individual farms.  ",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/2deb6d53-592b-4758-8404-37fcc4ae20fd/a5bfe84ad287c7cc96102b2b59521dfa.png,"SVTECH: Improving the ease of doing Business and Reliable Technological Solutions.

SVTECH is a software development company that is aimed at improving the ease of doing business and building reliable technological solutions. Their mission is to make a qualitative difference to the lives of millions of people and organizations in Eswatini and across the continent by empowering them with the power of information telecommunications technology.  SVTECH’s goals are to:  1. Empower businesses and individuals to keep them ahead.  2. Be a leader in market share, quality, revenue, growth and gross margins.  3. Add value to stakeholders, our investors, customers, partners and associates 4. Build on Eswatini’s unique advantages.  Services and software solutions currently under SVTECH’s portfolio include the following:  Smart Card Printing, Network Installation and management, hardware repair and refurbishing, bulk SMS platform, online school platform, retail point of sale, biometric clocking system, and  online survey application. SVTECH recently developed a mobile application that will help agriculture stakeholders manage farmer’s data. They have put the functionality to send bulk SMS's to farmers to notify them about opportunities and information they will need to know about the agriculture industry. The application will also enable Eswatini Agricultural Union (ESNAU) to link farmers to financial services. Farmers are able to pay for input subsidy and further manage their individual farms.

PROPOSED AGRI TECH PROJECT Currently, SVTECH is trying to gather enough resources to produce a cattle and general livestock tracking application to curb the problem of livestock theft and road accident caused by livestock in the country. SVTECH is still in process engaging with key stakeholders to gather information to develop and commercialize this project.

3031,c-37,Vundzisa: nurtures entrepreneurs business growth,5/20/21,1/16/23,2,,,SWZ,2,nontobeko.mlangeni@undp.org,Eswatini,"Vundzisa (loosely translated to nurture to ripen) helps entrepreneurs nurture their business growth. They help apply the right business tools at the right time for entrepreneurs who need help with managing their enterprises. They support entrepreneurs in financial management, business compliance, as well as sales and marketing. Founded in 2019, Vundzisa, continued to operate along the COVID19 pandemic 2020. Vundzisa mostly helped businesses position themselves online, access simple digital bookkeeping software, and provided free consultations for ~5 businesses to make themselves essential during the unforeseen lockdown. In 2021, Vundzisa continues to help entrepreneurs to grow their businesses. The Vundzisa mission continues to contribute towards the achievement of SDGs 1  & 4  directly. ",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/2deb6d53-592b-4758-8404-37fcc4ae20fd/284821b44757c0e55a9797befcc82f6e.png,"Vundzisa: nurtures entrepreneurs business growth

Vundzisa (loosely translated to nurture to ripen) helps entrepreneurs nurture their business growth. They help apply the right business tools at the right time for entrepreneurs who need help with managing their enterprises. They support entrepreneurs in financial management, business compliance, as well as sales and marketing. Founded in 2019, Vundzisa, continued to operate along the COVID19 pandemic 2020. Vundzisa mostly helped businesses position themselves online, access simple digital bookkeeping software, and provided free consultations for ~5 businesses to make themselves essential during the unforeseen lockdown. In 2021, Vundzisa continues to help entrepreneurs to grow their businesses. The Vundzisa mission continues to contribute towards the achievement of SDGs 1  & 4  directly.

3025,c-37,Ummo - Access to Public Services in the Wake of COVID 19,5/18/21,1/16/23,2,,,SWZ,2,nontobeko.mlangeni@undp.org,Eswatini,"Accessing Public Services has always been a daunting experience for the everyday citizen. In the wake of the COVID-19 pandemic, this has become a critical Public Health challenge. Ummo is a mobile platform that improves how the public accesses government service information, as well as empower participation in the delivery and management of those public services. In 2020, Ummo piloted its service delivery solution at the Matsapha Revenue Office (Tommy Kirk shopping complex). In doing so, Ummo created job opportunities for two agents and saved over a hundred hours of queuing time for its customers. Ummo is on track to launch its mobile app which will host all Public Service information and enable citizens to participate in rating the performance of a given service - increasing the accountability of public administrators and leaders. This is also inline with the government's anti-corruption mandate. By focusing on our society’s public service challenges and creating job opportunities for service agents, Ummo’s “COVID-19 Objective”, as well as its 2021 plans is to aid in the kingdom’s economic recovery plan. Ummo’s SDG targets are to be one of the key drivers of Goal 1, Goal 8 and Goal 16 in the kingdom.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/2deb6d53-592b-4758-8404-37fcc4ae20fd/7ee544869888e25104e64948794c1996.jpeg,"Ummo - Access to Public Services in the Wake of COVID 19

Accessing Public Services has always been a daunting experience for the everyday citizen. In the wake of the COVID-19 pandemic, this has become a critical Public Health challenge. Ummo is a mobile platform that improves how the public accesses government service information, as well as empower participation in the delivery and management of those public services. In 2020, Ummo piloted its service delivery solution at the Matsapha Revenue Office (Tommy Kirk shopping complex). In doing so, Ummo created job opportunities for two agents and saved over a hundred hours of queuing time for its customers. Ummo is on track to launch its mobile app which will host all Public Service information and enable citizens to participate in rating the performance of a given service - increasing the accountability of public administrators and leaders. This is also inline with the government's anti-corruption mandate. By focusing on our society’s public service challenges and creating job opportunities for service agents, Ummo’s “COVID-19 Objective”, as well as its 2021 plans is to aid in the kingdom’s economic recovery plan. Ummo’s SDG targets are to be one of the key drivers of Goal 1, Goal 8 and Goal 16 in the kingdom.
sdgs: Decent work and economic growth

3001,c-24,Safe-guarding Culture - Associação de Minjeres de Ponta Nova,5/5/21,1/16/23,2,,,GNB,2,ana.dju@undp.org,Guinea-Bissau,"Nhana Sedi is the president of the Associação de Minjeres de Ponta Nova, women who dye fabric and sell it for a living. A tradition from saracule tribe, passed on from generation to generation. Other local tribes such as Fula, Mandinga and Balanta are now all working in this area and learning of this technique of dyeing fabric. The advantage of this association is that it create employment of women in Bafata, teaches them new skills, gives visibility to the culture of dyeing clothes in a traditional manner.  The association is an advocate for preservation of culture and believe this is a way to preserve their culture and still be able to sustain their households. ",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/bd928d4f-48da-4722-b9c9-c09c7caa26b8/1878cd004c5c0f00fba280d398e83cd5.jpg,"Safe-guarding Culture - Associação de Minjeres de Ponta Nova

Nhana Sedi is the president of the Associação de Minjeres de Ponta Nova, women who dye fabric and sell it for a living. A tradition from saracule tribe, passed on from generation to generation. Other local tribes such as Fula, Mandinga and Balanta are now all working in this area and learning of this technique of dyeing fabric. The advantage of this association is that it create employment of women in Bafata, teaches them new skills, gives visibility to the culture of dyeing clothes in a traditional manner.  The association is an advocate for preservation of culture and believe this is a way to preserve their culture and still be able to sustain their households.

2999,c-24,ASPAG - Waste Management NGO,5/5/21,1/16/23,2,,,GNB,2,ana.dju@undp.org,Guinea-Bissau,"Guinean Association for Sanitation and Environmental Protection is an NGO based in the region of Gabu. The main goal of the association is to manage solid waste around the city of Gabu. They go a step further by recycling the materials and making them into items which can be used in the household. The income from items sold allows for the volunteers to have a form of income, which largely consist of youth. They organise monthly clean-ups to keep Gabu clean.  They often get together to discuss ways in which they can make the work sustainable, but offering to collect waste from shop owners directly for a small fee of 200 francs a month, but due to lack of government backing, this plan has not worked. ",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/bd928d4f-48da-4722-b9c9-c09c7caa26b8/1e82d77bd9c2bdde878af125ed298ce8.jpeg,"ASPAG - Waste Management NGO

Guinean Association for Sanitation and Environmental Protection is an NGO based in the region of Gabu. The main goal of the association is to manage solid waste around the city of Gabu. They go a step further by recycling the materials and making them into items which can be used in the household. The income from items sold allows for the volunteers to have a form of income, which largely consist of youth. They organise monthly clean-ups to keep Gabu clean.  They often get together to discuss ways in which they can make the work sustainable, but offering to collect waste from shop owners directly for a small fee of 200 francs a month, but due to lack of government backing, this plan has not worked.

2995,c-33,Planet 3R - Converting Textiles and Plastic wastes into Eco-friendly products through weaving.,5/4/21,1/16/23,2,,,NGA,0,abigail.ony@gmail.com,Nigeria,"Planet 3R is a social enterprise founded by Adejoke Lasisi and is dedicated to converting textile and plastic waste into eco-friendly products using the 3R method ( Reduce, Reuse, Recycle) to save our planet by weaving them into innovative items. With the vision of creating a sustainable world without textile and plastic wastes, it became necessary for Planet 3R to reduce the landfill space by recycling clothes and plastic bags. As landfill sites are a threat to our environment as well as water supplies. Planet 3R creatively shred old clothes and used plastic (especially pure water sachets) then converts them into finished products using traditional weaving techniques. These finished products include fashion wears, home decors, bags, and accessories.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/c0ec6018-ce80-4356-b59c-4e66bf0e812f/487bee9e1fe46d9bb5dc32b4d08fb90c.png,"Planet 3R - Converting Textiles and Plastic wastes into Eco-friendly products through weaving.

Planet 3R is a social enterprise founded by Adejoke Lasisi and is dedicated to converting textile and plastic waste into eco-friendly products using the 3R method ( Reduce, Reuse, Recycle) to save our planet by weaving them into innovative items. With the vision of creating a sustainable world without textile and plastic wastes, it became necessary for Planet 3R to reduce the landfill space by recycling clothes and plastic bags. As landfill sites are a threat to our environment as well as water supplies. Planet 3R creatively shred old clothes and used plastic (especially pure water sachets) then converts them into finished products using traditional weaving techniques. These finished products include fashion wears, home decors, bags, and accessories.

2975,c-11,"M'mawali,  The financial management app",4/19/21,1/16/23,2,,132,GIN,2,camara.moussa@undp.org,Guinea,"M'mawali is our solution designed and developped from the collaboration of UNDP and the Ministry of Telecommunication through it's agency ANIEN.
M'mawaly is a financial management app available for the women as contribution to their resilience against COVID-19 pendemic situation.

For the initial part of our project, like a normal app developpment, from the idea, we passed through a dianogstic of what women are really living in their respective activities as challenges. M'mawali is our solution designed and developped from the collaboration of UNDP and the Ministry of Telecommunication through it's agency ANIEN.
M'mawaly is a financial management app available for the women as contribution to their resilience against COVID-19 pendemic situation.

For the initial part of our project, like a normal app developpment, from the idea, we passed through a dianogstic of what women are really living in their respective activities as challenges. So, after some analyses we ended by designing and developping M'mawali. Essencially, the app is about finacial expenditures and incomes management for the women to better understand their finance movement.
How did you find this solution? Can you describe how the information about this solution ""traveled"" to you?

The App is the result of the common work between UNDP and the ministry of the telecommunication. From this collaboration, the Lab was sollicited by the C.O to accelerate the process. So now we are pleased to announce you that we just ended the sharing of the smartphones and the training so that they be able to use by themselves.

2971,c-11,another simple and easy solution for Michelin,4/15/21,1/16/23,2,,,GIN,2,camara.moussa@undp.org,Guinea,"On the principles to look and try to find what best we can identify as innovation, we have been running our safari around Touyah beach. In normal situation it is a kind of waste dropping zone but according to what I had in front was really surprising. Because of the fact that we found the area that was before considered as nasty by the tones of collected wastes from the direct deposit of men and also all the raining water that was leading the wastes through the water coming from the area sides all around; clean with new restaurants at both sides of the road.

By discussing, we have seen from something like 300m a kind of rounded base all around flowers and my collegue and I have decided to just try to be closer and bingo! ""Funny!!! are these guys, has said my collegue.""
for the first point of view this was for us a joke. How can he be using tires as flowerpots?
Some  10 to 15m later, we come to realize by seeing the complete line of tires that was used to change the state of the area. For the Owner, ""this was for me a solution to avoid two cases:
1- Fight against Air pollution as we cannot burn or incinarate without smoke!
2- Be submerged by falty tires and not be able to do something against, would certainly lead to the degradation and pollution of the environnement.""
So please if you have faulty tires and you realy do not have idea for avoiding the incinaration please give a look at this solution and just let us know how it helps to transform things around you!

thanks to M. Bandi Amara for his sharing.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/a6f58a0b-c389-41db-8d24-aef6580a6877/6890ce5bf0c72ecc1ead2df5de8fbe20.jpg,"another simple and easy solution for Michelin

On the principles to look and try to find what best we can identify as innovation, we have been running our safari around Touyah beach. Because of the fact that we found the area that was before considered as nasty by the tones of collected wastes from the direct deposit of men and also all the raining water that was leading the wastes through the water coming from the area sides all around; clean with new restaurants at both sides of the road.

By discussing, we have seen from something like 300m a kind of rounded base all around flowers and my collegue and I have decided to just try to be closer and bingo! ""Funny!!! are these guys, has said my collegue.""
for the first point of view this was for us a joke. How can he be using tires as flowerpots?
Some  10 to 15m later, we come to realize by seeing the complete line of tires that was used to change the state of the area. For the Owner, ""this was for me a solution to avoid two cases:

2970,c-11,When Biodigesting becomes more than a solution by setting Waste as Gold  ,4/15/21,1/16/23,2,,,GIN,2,camara.moussa@undp.org,Guinea,Biodigester solution is a device used to transform organic waste (waste that can decompose) into biogas and organic liquid fertilizer. this solution is the work of our friend Koivogui Gbadé. Native to the forest zone of Guinea.,https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/a6f58a0b-c389-41db-8d24-aef6580a6877/455e2e42fe64d29fde19001317a29273.jpg,"When Biodigesting becomes more than a solution by setting Waste as Gold

Biodigester solution is a device used to transform organic waste (waste that can decompose) into biogas and organic liquid fertilizer. this solution is the work of our friend Koivogui Gbadé. Native to the forest zone of Guinea.

It should be noted that this solution consists of three units: The electronics which, according to the manufacturer, have a duration of 4 years; The Battery which lasts on average three years and finally, the metal here galvanized to withstand the negative and corrosive effects. For marketing, the difference is in the storage capacity since: the one with a capacity of 2000 liters is sold at 1800 USD, 1200 liters at 800 USD and finally that of 250 liters at 300 USD.
in pictures, the papaya tree used to serve as a cobail for the soil reconditioning test to promote organic cultivation
Merci à Koivogui Gbadé et bonne chance à lui!

2969,c-11,The charger back center,4/15/21,1/16/23,2,,,GIN,2,camara.moussa@undp.org,Guinea,"My name is Alpha Ibrahima Diallo, I deliver battery recharging services for traders in the port of Kamsar. It is true that for my age it can seem difficult to reconcile but as we can well mean it, the work ennobled and makes it possible to avoid certain derogatory situations especially for us of which most of the families have modest incomes. Here is in a few lines my experience in this battery recharging business.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/a6f58a0b-c389-41db-8d24-aef6580a6877/17ec1d6eca149cbc247068cd524996ad.jpg,"The charger back center

My name is Alpha Ibrahima Diallo, I deliver battery recharging services for traders in the port of Kamsar. It is true that for my age it can seem difficult to reconcile but as we can well mean it, the work ennobled and makes it possible to avoid certain derogatory situations especially for us of which most of the families have modest incomes. Here is in a few lines my experience in this battery recharging business.

Being a member of a modest family, I must always help my parents find a way that can be a relief for them with regard to the expenses related to the maintenance of my brothers and me. Thus, I hurry every afternoon to reach the port of Kamsar where the population is quite dynamic and made up of saleswomen, fish fishermen but also resourceful people like me. I run a battery recharging business there that serves as a safe haven for the phones of the above types of people.

To avoid the theft and / or loss of phones, I use a ticket coupling system, each with the number corresponding to that provided by the carrier of the phone. during the collection, he has the obligation to present it to me with the cost of the service, against which I deliver the telephone.

One of the reasons why many customers frequent me is that I provide them with a possibility of charging even in the event of a power cut from the sector and to do so, I use a 5 Kva motor (Tiger) for assure it.
