2968,c-11,the regulating potential of COVID-19,4/15/21,1/16/23,2,,,GIN,2,camara.moussa@undp.org,Guinea,"His name is Oumar CAMARA, grew up in Sierra Léon  and has joinned Guinea a decade before. from this picture, we see a single and simple man but when we try to discuss and go a little bit deeper, we discover the other side of the isberg hidden by the wall of modesty.  Let's together read the story of Oumar, our former english teacher transformed throught the impact of covid-19 to an isolant seller.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/a6f58a0b-c389-41db-8d24-aef6580a6877/23ed6eebc5aaf0cec4de33149ab2d994.jpg,"the regulating potential of COVID-19

His name is Oumar CAMARA, grew up in Sierra Léon  and has joinned Guinea a decade before. from this picture, we see a single and simple man but when we try to discuss and go a little bit deeper, we discover the other side of the isberg hidden by the wall of modesty.  Let's together read the story of Oumar, our former english teacher transformed throught the impact of covid-19 to an isolant seller.

Oumar Camara has started to monetize his knowledge of english in a school in the city of Kamsar where at the begining, everything was fine and with the time, he took advantage of the fact that Guinea scholarship is less expensive and the program spread the taught program has a shortfall in English. However, we will remember that for the years felt, the government of the Republic of Guinea has focused heavily on strengthening the training capacity of teachers and on the other hand is the need for a professional working language where it was introduced. idea of ​​ensuring that children from elementary school can start studying this language very early. It is therefore in this momentum that our friend Oumar CAMARA has established himself.

And as we know in any case there are ups and downs, our friend Oumar after this good period of grace began to have delays on the wages which was due for the work done despite all the revision and proposal of Alleviation of payment for management hardly changed anything. In the end, he even deduced that it was the management that refused. While the latter gave every effort to be able to respect its commitment and ensure that the damage is minimized. Against all expectations, the covid-19 pendemic has upset the majority of our abitudes and even the most fundamental such as the payment of schooling due to the closure of many businesses and restrictions on motion to certain destinations.

Faced with all these elements which constitute a strong alibi of disuasion to remain indulgent. not long after, Oumar by a coup de grace, found himself promoted to the post of director. From that moment on, Oumar said he was able to quickly receive his salary (s) given that the arrears were a significant portion. On the strength of his new position, Oumar was surprised by the parents' non-reaction to his appeal for payment of school fees. As we raise the curtain on a surprising situation, Oumar suffered a big shock when he finally realized that all this time he was struggling to warm up the management when the reality was totally different. After several recall attempts, he was forced to throw in the towel. Nothing more could be added to it. This is how our friend finds himself in search of a solution to meet his needs and ends up realizing and admitting that everything had to be redone. Surrounded by his friends and brothers, he receives some suggestions of resilience in the face of this lean cow situation among which he brilliantly welcomes the idea of ​​trying his luck in the sale of protective plastics normally intended to pack televisions and other equipment. classified very fragile. In any case, we call it a ""float"" because of its property of floating on liquid surfaces.

According to Oumar, the sale of insulation is very easy and quick in terms of generating money as it allows him to earn between 900,000 and 1,500,000 gnf on average and per month, which is much better compared to his old profile. Oumar uses his links in conakry for its supply by isolating collected from repair shops for electronic equipment and or from surrounding markets where the majority of insulation is collected as soon as the freezer boxes and others are opened without forgetting the fact that he makes great use of his fraternal relationships to expand his network of suppliers. Fortunately for him up to this day, everything is going very well. Oumar often pauses the question if for him although the Corona Virus is a difficult burden for all humanity, the fact remains that for him and some of his condition in particular it is rather a solution that has arrived at the right time?
so we wonder, but what is the use of the insulation or floats sold by our friend?

Well behave yourself because, the fishermen rush to the lots of floats to use it, once mixed with oil which gives a sticky and opaque mixture that does not let the water pass under any pretex. In short, it is a perfect element which spread over the sides of the boat, prevents water penetration. AND for our friend Oumar, this is a real positive means of recycling that we could well popularize in order to contribute to the good behavior of the environment.

It is therefore on this end note that Oumar CAMARA gratifies us with this smile while hoping to tell us the rest of his story which according to him must necessarily have a future extract retracing his return to teaching because for him ""TEACHING"" is the best commitment we can make to the community that has given us everything.
sdgs: Decent work and economic growth

2967,c-11,Alibaba's floating cabin,4/15/21,1/16/23,2,,,GIN,2,camara.moussa@undp.org,Guinea,"On the banks of the Rio Pongo, located a few kilometers from the city center of Kamsar, we discover before our eyes an idyllic scene with hyper-hurried ladies, men overloaded with basins at the edges of which we can identify the few lines of fish and seafood. It is in a good-natured atmosphere that we manage to collect a few words from our friend DAOUDA CAMARA fishing in deep water.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/a6f58a0b-c389-41db-8d24-aef6580a6877/15041957c0b100ad0615ca9317263040.jpg,"Alibaba's floating cabin

On the banks of the Rio Pongo, located a few kilometers from the city center of Kamsar, we discover before our eyes an idyllic scene with hyper-hurried ladies, men overloaded with basins at the edges of which we can identify the few lines of fish and seafood. It is in a good-natured atmosphere that we manage to collect a few words from our friend DAOUDA CAMARA fishing in deep water.

Like most of the unemployed young people of Kamsar, Daouda Camara found himself at a very critical moment in his life confronted with the fact of wanting to carve out a better future and at the same time provide his family with the minimum necessary for a living.

After his primary studies, Daouda was guided by the force of fate towards several types of odd jobs which ultimately remained without a favorable outcome. Always in search of a solution to his dilema, he quickly surrounded himself with a few friends who gave him the chance to enter their favorite exercise. This is how Daouda, a young resourceful man, will discover fishing boats, canoes and other traditional means of navigation at the heart of the port of Kamsar.

Our friend Daouda, day after day will end up enjoying it and will discover the wonders of fishing but also the constraints that go with it such as the level of coldness of the sea during the night, the difficulty of fishing and the scarcity of fish during the rainy seasons, very often the few losses of human life due to the sinking of boats of fortune.

According to Daouda, during his learning cycle, the biggest problem was the conservation of the fishing crops because, they had to quickly return to the surface to prevent the fish from rotting in the sea.

When the Senegalese fishermen arrived, Daouda and his friends had a chance to discover the ""YOLI"", a kind of traditional fishing boat made up of a very large canoe hull divided into several compartments including the 'front serving as a livewell hold, the middle serving as a transition between the front and the conservation hold. Speaking of conservation hold, here is one of the most innovative components of this traditional fishing boat because before its existence, fishermen like our friend Tinder beat each other up when they delayed at sea with the expiration of fish as an argument.

THE FAMOUS FLOATING freezer is a box whose walls are covered with glue based on liquid floats. In addition to this is added a cover made of polyester sleeping bag which finally makes the structure waterproof, allowing the fish to be kept this time for more than three weeks of duration on the sea. This makes the series of trips more than comfortable. Amadou and his family at sea. According to Amadou, after fishing, the contents of the boxes are distributed between them and the port manager in the following proportions: for each catch of three boxes, a half-box is intended for him. it will be remembered that in the event of an inconsistent setting, nothing is transmitted to him.
As it is often said, rural populations always have a solution to their problem.

From this solution of freezing over a long period, the fishermen act positively on the environment in the sense that they avoid letting empty bags inherit in nature which would probably push the residents to proceed with the calcination and thus pollute the environment. nature. For our Hero Daouda Camara, the conservation mode is more than beneficial since beyond the conservation of fish, without the need for a motor or battery; it offers them the possibility of reselling the residue of ice which is reusable to maintain the fish for the women going from the port to the various places of consumption or markets.
sdgs: Decent work and economic growth

2918,c-24,Hand Washing Station,4/9/21,1/16/23,2,,,GNB,2,ana.dju@undp.org,Guinea-Bissau,"ADEMA, an organisation led by Augusto, is championing waste management and sanitation in the Archipelago of Bijagos. The organisation developed this handwashing station in response to Ebola outbreak in 2014. Training was given to 11 islands to allow citizens to set them up. They use 5 litre bottles, a string and 4 sticks to create this, making it sustainable and easy to manage.

2917,c-24,Ojon Press,4/9/21,1/16/23,2,,,GNB,2,ana.dju@undp.org,Guinea-Bissau,"Jose Pedro dos Santos (Zeca), developed a manual Ojon pressing machine to make the work of women of Bubaque easier. Palm Oil is a big part of the produce Bideras (female market sellers) take to the markets of Bubaque and it is also a product that is highly sought after. Althought, the process of extracting the palm oil can often be physically harmful and unsafe. Zeca developed this machine to make the work easier and allow them to produce in higher quantities. Women can bring their Ojon to be pressed at his workshop. ",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/bd928d4f-48da-4722-b9c9-c09c7caa26b8/589f3bbc81b781e0f35f566baf024a93.jpg,"Ojon Press

Jose Pedro dos Santos (Zeca), developed a manual Ojon pressing machine to make the work of women of Bubaque easier. Palm Oil is a big part of the produce Bideras (female market sellers) take to the markets of Bubaque and it is also a product that is highly sought after. Althought, the process of extracting the palm oil can often be physically harmful and unsafe. Zeca developed this machine to make the work easier and allow them to produce in higher quantities. Women can bring their Ojon to be pressed at his workshop.

2915,c-24,Multi Shop Stop - FinTech,4/9/21,1/16/23,2,,,GNB,2,ana.dju@undp.org,Guinea-Bissau,"Zeca Nfad lives in Bissora of the Oio Regio. 2910,c-24,Washing Powder ,4/8/21,1/16/23,2,,132,GNB,2,ana.dju@undp.org,Guinea-Bissau,"Fatu Uegé, developed a washing powder which she sells and gifts at well below market price. Fatu lives in Farim, a sector separated from the closest biggest city by a river. Due to inaccessibility and lack of employment she and her community have been limited in ways they can buy washing up powder. With inflated prices in Farim, she tested and prototyped till she developed a washing powder which used only local products. With the success of her washing powder she is able to sell but also give to other women of the city who face the same issues as her. ",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/bd928d4f-48da-4722-b9c9-c09c7caa26b8/3f9eb37465c033d6bd826c38f420e313.jpg,"Washing Powder

Fatu Uegé, developed a washing powder which she sells and gifts at well below market price. Fatu lives in Farim, a sector separated from the closest biggest city by a river. Due to inaccessibility and lack of employment she and her community have been limited in ways they can buy washing up powder. With inflated prices in Farim, she tested and prototyped till she developed a washing powder which used only local products. With the success of her washing powder she is able to sell but also give to other women of the city who face the same issues as her.

2909,c-24,Netos de Bandim,4/8/21,1/16/23,2,,,GNB,2,ana.dju@undp.org,Guinea-Bissau,"Cultural dancing group who has created a circular economy whereby the children who dance, their parents and any others who show interest are supported by the organisation economically. The children are encouraged to preserve culture through dancing and showing of masks and traditional clothes, in exchange they have their education paid for as well as international travel to represent the country. The parents are employed by the group to manage children if they are interest as well the children being employed if they decide to stop participating in the dancing. ",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/bd928d4f-48da-4722-b9c9-c09c7caa26b8/7486f987d7adef7fdaa3d01e8145bc9d.jpg,"Netos de Bandim

Cultural dancing group who has created a circular economy whereby the children who dance, their parents and any others who show interest are supported by the organisation economically. The children are encouraged to preserve culture through dancing and showing of masks and traditional clothes, in exchange they have their education paid for as well as international travel to represent the country. The parents are employed by the group to manage children if they are interest as well the children being employed if they decide to stop participating in the dancing.
sdgs: Peace, justice and strong institutions

2908,c-24,Cashew Peeling Machine,4/8/21,1/16/23,2,,,GNB,2,ana.dju@undp.org,Guinea-Bissau,"With cashews being the biggest export of the country and employing a disproportionate number of population, there has been interest in ways to make the job easier. Ricardo Ca, developed this machine which functions with no electricity, in direct response to the lack of constant electricity in the country, which peels cashew nuts. This is to elevate the harm caused by peeling manually and increase the number peeled per minute. ",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/bd928d4f-48da-4722-b9c9-c09c7caa26b8/44e7497b5155fc823143f1c3f94a2991.jpeg,"Cashew Peeling Machine

With cashews being the biggest export of the country and employing a disproportionate number of population, there has been interest in ways to make the job easier. Ricardo Ca, developed this machine which functions with no electricity, in direct response to the lack of constant electricity in the country, which peels cashew nuts. This is to elevate the harm caused by peeling manually and increase the number peeled per minute.
sdgs: Decent work and economic growth

Nitumeni, which means ""Send Me'  is a start-up by a group of young women that seeks to contribute to the reduction in the spread of COVID-19. The initiative operates by encouraging people and business owners to order or deliver their food and non-food items through a courier company being operated by a group of female youths. They hope to reduce footprint in the market places thereby contributing to the reduction on the spread of COVID-19. The team currently uses social media to run errands for clients across Zambia's capital city of Lusaka.
How did you find this solution? Can you describe how the information about this solution ""traveled"" to you?

The solution was identified during a solutions safari to identify community response to the COVID-19 challenge. The SME then participated in the Innovation Challenge that AccLab Zambia conducted in 2020 in partnership with partners from the government - National Technology Business Centre (NTBC) and the Zambia Information and Communication Technology Authority (ZICTA)

2866,c-33,Aid Card,3/31/21,1/16/23,2,,,NGA,0,abigail.ony@gmail.com,Nigeria,"Aid Card facilitates aid/grants administration to the vulnerable, hungry, displaced, poor and people living below a dollar per day. According to the UN, over 2.7 million people are displaced in Nigeria and 60% are living below the poverty line of US$1.90 a day. In Africa, about 18 million people are displaced and globally, 821 million people are undernourished, and depend mostly on aid/grants from government and non-governmental agencies to survive. Leveraging a growing network of vendors, government agencies, non-governmental organizations, development agencies and philanthropists are able to administer aid/grants to their intended beneficiaries conveniently without the risks and high costs associated with typical processes of aid delivery. As a lot of vulnerable populations do not engage in the formal economy and might not have bank accounts to receive aid especially cash programmes, Aid Card meets them where they are and provides them a way to receive aid when needed. Aid-givers can also track and see how distributed aid/grant is expended by their beneficiaries in Realtime.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/c0ec6018-ce80-4356-b59c-4e66bf0e812f/ae1844302f0cb1bd8132a185222e9f2d.jpg,"Aid Card

Aid Card facilitates aid/grants administration to the vulnerable, hungry, displaced, poor and people living below a dollar per day. According to the UN, over 2.7 million people are displaced in Nigeria and 60% are living below the poverty line of US$1.90 a day. In Africa, about 18 million people are displaced and globally, 821 million people are undernourished, and depend mostly on aid/grants from government and non-governmental agencies to survive. Leveraging a growing network of vendors, government agencies, non-governmental organizations, development agencies and philanthropists are able to administer aid/grants to their intended beneficiaries conveniently without the risks and high costs associated with typical processes of aid delivery. As a lot of vulnerable populations do not engage in the formal economy and might not have bank accounts to receive aid especially cash programmes, Aid Card meets them where they are and provides them a way to receive aid when needed. Aid-givers can also track and see how distributed aid/grant is expended by their beneficiaries in Realtime.

2849,c-30,Biogaz Production from Animal Waste ,3/17/21,1/16/23,2,,,CMR,2,anna.ojong@undp.org,Cameroon,"Animal Waste Management . Soukaina Bouba Dalil, a young Cameroonian lady from the Far-North Region targets animal breeders, farmers and households as she produces biogaz. She collects animal waste such as beef dung, poultry manure and pig manure which is put into a biodigester for the production of biogaz. ",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/c3787e8a-95c0-4ca3-a6dc-e462e7337526/69b0727b26cc205bdbef68abead34e62.jpg,"Biogaz Production from Animal Waste

Animal Waste Management . Soukaina Bouba Dalil, a young Cameroonian lady from the Far-North Region targets animal breeders, farmers and households as she produces biogaz. She collects animal waste such as beef dung, poultry manure and pig manure which is put into a biodigester for the production of biogaz.
Animal waste introduced into the Bio-digester and converted into gaz. Left over product is used as biofertilizer by farmers for improved productivity
Canalized biogaz system for cooking energy in households

According to Soukaina, these mobile biodigesters are conceived to ease access for households who cannot afford to construct the static system in their homes. It is also easily accessible for  lighting up animal farms and to keep them warm, particularly poultry

2848,c-30,Ecological Charcoal from household and Agricultural Waste,3/17/21,1/16/23,3,,,CMR,2,anna.ojong@undp.org,Cameroon,"Dried plantain leaves, Jatropha shells, groundnut shells, dried straw  leaves and fallen tree branches valorized to produce Ecological Charcoal. These leaves or dried mixture of waste is transformed in a Carbonizer",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/c3787e8a-95c0-4ca3-a6dc-e462e7337526/2c4cfb5faaddf235315a7f10d81b1d80.jpg,"Ecological Charcoal from household and Agricultural Waste

Dried plantain leaves, Jatropha shells, groundnut shells, dried straw  leaves and fallen tree branches valorized to produce Ecological Charcoal. These leaves or dried mixture of waste is transformed in a Carbonizer
After carbonization, a binder is added to the powder waste which is transformed into different shapes (round or square) for cooking energy
Its pure vegetal content reduces the rate of carbon effects  emitted in the atmosphere and does not produce smoke

2786,c-11,"The game is called ""DAME"" and we enjoy  playing it in Africa. Strategy and reflexion…",3/4/21,1/16/23,3,,,GIN,2,camara.moussa@undp.org,Guinea,By Diao Diallo and CONDE,https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/a6f58a0b-c389-41db-8d24-aef6580a6877/5d2b1c5badeb0d7e2ef3282b8c358060.png,"The game is called ""DAME"" and we enjoy  playing it in Africa. Strategy and reflexion…

The game is called ""DAME"" , strategic and High reflexion game. We enjoy  playing it in Africa. Most of time precisely during the holidays. Fine, if ti is to be played in the day time also in the night where light is. In general, once there is power outage, no more game and we have to wait untill it come back again. So to stay active during outages, here is a solution created by the team. It is supplyed in power by 2 to 4 LEDs that are working with 5V Battery.  so if you are projecting to travel and are not sure to find light were you are targetting to go please check ""the Freedom fighter ¨Power bank"" that can easily be used with this one to produce up to 5 years power stock for you.

2784,c-11,The remote Power reboot,3/4/21,1/16/23,3,,,GIN,2,camara.moussa@undp.org,Guinea,Created by Djime  CONDE,https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/a6f58a0b-c389-41db-8d24-aef6580a6877/3512b5ab04d0ef3883b0c2368c410f18.png,"The remote Power reboot

In general case, for remote actions we see in the movies it is all about connected houses. Some households in Africa and most part of the world are wasting energy just because the owner forgot to switch off the power before leaving the place. In France, Out of 250,000 annual fires, 80,000 are of electrical origin. 40% of the victims are children under 9 years old.  So to avoid such kind of problem and taking in consideration that power is very expensive ressource that should be well managed, here is a proposition of Power management with a GSM mobile phone. all you need is to send an SMS of instruction that is going to enable the requested action. So if you have to switch off any electrical component remotely, and you just have GSM coverage, this is yours!

consent: https:/acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/consent/uploads/ac0eee53-cfa2-4746-becb-bdd7acbe050d/37cff24753e2387df3445909212ef1ac.pdf",10.43464905,-10.94306127,GIN,Guinea,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,net,regulator,bcb,publication,contexte,printing,required,restrictions,instructors,desired,aceleracao,acelererado,bddacbed,telecom,internet,ejecución,communications,permits,caebfdbdacdca,regulations,dcacafbdddbfec,hacerlo,cfa,ccaefebcadadcbd,dcfefcbfdfcda,boʼlgan,aceee,smartphone,downloadable,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,Responsible consumption and production,Sustainable cities and communities,"Industry, innovation and infrastructure",,,,,,,citizen science,security,innovation,safety,prototyping,,,,,

2783,c-11,Public Lights auto managed ,3/4/21,1/16/23,3,,,GIN,2,camara.moussa@undp.org,Guinea,Solution developped by Diao and Condé .,https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/a6f58a0b-c389-41db-8d24-aef6580a6877/2728e35710389e1ccb1e569430e58695.png,"Public Lights auto managed
Solution developped by Diao and Condé .

In Guinea, electricity is existing long time ago but with covarage holes. Added to that, in the special rural area, to mitigate power supply need and the management problem to avoid public light being active for 24H in so that the rest of the  population could be served. CONDE has decided to set available his auto-managed Public Lights.  Composed by a LED lightning  and  220 to 12V converter, this solution can be reproduced in different format. It's particularity is the sensor incorporated in the converter that enables the switching to light when dakness comes or OFF when day light is felt. Using it can help decrease the consumption and waste of electricity.

2772,c-11,"""MINI-RESPIRATOR"", imagination and créativité at the front line of resistance to the COVID19 ! ",2/25/21,1/16/23,3,,,GIN,2,camara.moussa@undp.org,Guinea,Here is our local frespirator invented by Mamadou Cellou DIALLO and Djime CONDE.,https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/a6f58a0b-c389-41db-8d24-aef6580a6877/0ce48020a46b5ab98b56002b33a30473.jpg,"""MINI-RESPIRATOR"", imagination and créativité at the front line of resistance to the COVID19 !
Here is our local frespirator invented by Mamadou Cellou DIALLO and Djime CONDE.

Like a simple letter box, with a empty ballon stuck on the back orifice,  please see the local respirator invented to support the ministry of public health to secure and save lives of millions of citizen. the box itself is a 25cm side cube in what you have a system realising all the mecanism on the respirator as we see in the hospital. The respirator is powered by a 12V source. It is equiped with an electrical switch and a tube that will be linked to the patient for him to breath easily
The Back side with the 12V power entry and the switch to stop the operation.
Please see how it works, Enjoy !

2771,c-11,Power Bank of the Freedom fighter,2/24/21,1/16/23,3,,,GIN,2,camara.moussa@undp.org,Guinea,Inventors : Mamadou Cellou Diallo and Djime Condé.,https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/a6f58a0b-c389-41db-8d24-aef6580a6877/952e811a2affef7fbc9543cc2e53d325.jpg,"Power Bank of the Freedom fighter
Inventors : Mamadou Cellou Diallo and Djime Condé.

If you are in pain to recharge your phone, in a non-electrified area, if you don't have time to wait for your phone to recharge even better, if you think you are paying too much for power banks that do not last for long time then here is your solution: the power bank of the freedom fighter.  With a compact frame, it has a minimum autonomy of 5 years and is self-charging without a foreign source of electricity. It allows you to generate by using two dynamos of the voltage current of 12 and 5V (for this prototype in picture) stored using batteries, all connected on by two switches, the first one is responsible for activation a 12V dynamo to generate power to be stored in the batteries and the second is responsible for the distribution of needed power. For this case 5V for charging the phone.
In picture, the power switcher allowing the bateries to receive electricity.
Applying charging cable through the USB port to power supply the phone.
Please see how it works, Enjoy!

2695,c-37,This is a Social media campaign aimed at controlling the use of single use …,1/20/21,1/16/23,2,,,SWZ,2,nontobeko.mlangeni@undp.org,Eswatini,"This is a Social media campaign aimed at controlling the use of single use plastic in Eswatini. It is done by UNDP in partnership with the Eswatini Environment Authority, the Ministry of Tourism and Environmental Affairs as well as the 5 major food franchises in Eswatini. The aim is to introduce a partial ban that allows for single use plastic bags at source while also facilitating for some behavioural change on the part of the public and retailers on the control of single use plastic bags. the campaign, called Phatsa Sakho nawe (bring your own shopping bag), is part of some solutions that are being experimented with to determine the most feasible in the control of plastic bags. ",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/2deb6d53-592b-4758-8404-37fcc4ae20fd/0546d4e9cf7db726d4fd6490f15ec208.jpg,"This is a Social media campaign aimed at controlling the use of single use …

This is a Social media campaign aimed at controlling the use of single use plastic in Eswatini. It is done by UNDP in partnership with the Eswatini Environment Authority, the Ministry of Tourism and Environmental Affairs as well as the 5 major food franchises in Eswatini. The aim is to introduce a partial ban that allows for single use plastic bags at source while also facilitating for some behavioural change on the part of the public and retailers on the control of single use plastic bags. the campaign, called Phatsa Sakho nawe (bring your own shopping bag), is part of some solutions that are being experimented with to determine the most feasible in the control of plastic bags.

2666,c-34,TELE-IRRIGATION,1/13/21,1/16/23,2,,,NER,2,assane.boukar@undp.org,Niger,"La « Télé-Irrigation » : c’est un procédé technologique qui permet à un agriculteur de piloter à distance le système d’irrigation de son exploitation agricole quelque soit sa position géographique et le temps au moyen de son téléphone mobile, du solaire et des capteurs IOT suivant une distribution intelligente de l’eau (besoins, quantité, temps, type spéculation…). La Télé-Irrigation permet également de collecter et diffuser en temps réel et à distance les données météorologiques et hydrologiques notamment la température, le taux d’humidité du sol, la pluviométrie, la radiation solaire, la vitesse du vent..... Ce dispositif permet à un agriculteur de s’enquérir de l’état du besoin hydrique de son exploitation et les conditions climatiques qui y prévalait quelque soit sa position dans le monde. Ce dispositif permet également de disposer de la traçabilité des données climatiques d’une zone et sur plusieurs années grâce à son système de stockage des données. Ce procédé permet à l’exploitant (i) un gain de temps et d’énergie, (ii) une augmentation de la superficie irrigable, (iii) un accroissement de la production et du revenu et (iv) une gestion maitrisée d’eau d’irrigation. Le kit Télé-Irrigation est composé d’une station solaire, d’un moyen d’exhaure (pompe solaire), d’un réseau de distribution d’eau, d’un équipement télécom et d’une application vocale mutualisée hébergée dans notre datacenter.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/2817119a-f880-4b4e-97cc-103ae4a24a3b/514156564f0373b25d6e80b352995b14.jfif,"TELE-IRRIGATION

La « Télé-Irrigation » : c’est un procédé technologique qui permet à un agriculteur de piloter à distance le système d’irrigation de son exploitation agricole quelque soit sa position géographique et le temps au moyen de son téléphone mobile, du solaire et des capteurs IOT suivant une distribution intelligente de l’eau (besoins, quantité, temps, type spéculation…). La Télé-Irrigation permet également de collecter et diffuser en temps réel et à distance les données météorologiques et hydrologiques notamment la température, le taux d’humidité du sol, la pluviométrie, la radiation solaire, la vitesse du vent..... Ce dispositif permet à un agriculteur de s’enquérir de l’état du besoin hydrique de son exploitation et les conditions climatiques qui y prévalait quelque soit sa position dans le monde. Ce dispositif permet également de disposer de la traçabilité des données climatiques d’une zone et sur plusieurs années grâce à son système de stockage des données. Ce procédé permet à l’exploitant (i) un gain de temps et d’énergie, (ii) une augmentation de la superficie irrigable, (iii) un accroissement de la production et du revenu et (iv) une gestion maitrisée d’eau d’irrigation. Le kit Télé-Irrigation est composé d’une station solaire, d’un moyen d’exhaure (pompe solaire), d’un réseau de distribution d’eau, d’un équipement télécom et d’une application vocale mutualisée hébergée dans notre datacenter.

En quoi est-ce que cette innovation locale est innovante?  La Télé-Irrigation est indépendante du temps et de l’espace et contribue à la réduction de la pauvreté par la génération de revenu aux producteurs. Elle contribue à la réduction de gaz à effet de serre par la substitution de l’énergie thermique avec l’énergie renouvelable. Au plan macro économique elle participe d’une part à la réalisation de l’Objectif N°1 des Objectifs du Développement Durable (ODD1) qui est de réduire l’extrême pauvreté et la faim qui doit passer nécessairement par la bonne gestion de l’eau donc de l’irrigation et d’autre part à l’accroissement du taux de pénétration de la téléphonie en zone rurale et la création du trafic chez les operateurs.
Quelques photos de télé-irrigation au Niger

2665,c-34,B-DESINF TDSA : TUNNEL DE DESINFECTION SOLAIRE AUTOMATIQUE,1/13/21,1/16/23,2,,,NER,2,assane.boukar@undp.org,Niger,"B-DESINF est un système de désinfection solaire automatique conçu et fabriqué )au Niger, avec la participation des jeunes talents dans divers domaines (soudure, électricité, automatisme, énergie, domotique, sanitaire..). Très facile à utiliser et à maintenir, Il existe en deux types de systèmes :  1. B-DESINF TUNNEL modèle TDSA/170/3000  et modèle TDSA/110/1500 à placer dans un passage, ils disposent d’une entrée d’une zone de désinfection et d’une sortie libre. 2. B-DESINF SAS modèle SDSA/170/3000 et modèle SDSA/110/1500 : à placer dans un passage, ils disposent d’une entrée, d’une zone de désinfection et d’une sortie contrôlée par verrou électronique. Autonome, écologique, efficace ,robuste et durable, le -DESINF contribue  à la lutte  des agents pathogènes (en particulier le COVID 19),  Il combine :  La désinfection des mains ; Le contrôle de température ; La désinfection des habits et chaussures et la prise en photo automatiques des individus à temperature anormale(option du système)",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/2817119a-f880-4b4e-97cc-103ae4a24a3b/0e4a6ce466f6f92212321a42788c61d1.jpg,"B-DESINF TDSA : TUNNEL DE DESINFECTION SOLAIRE AUTOMATIQUE

B-DESINF est un système de désinfection solaire automatique conçu et fabriqué )au Niger, avec la participation des jeunes talents dans divers domaines (soudure, électricité, automatisme, énergie, domotique, sanitaire..). Très facile à utiliser et à maintenir, Il existe en deux types de systèmes :  1. B-DESINF TUNNEL modèle TDSA/170/3000  et modèle TDSA/110/1500 à placer dans un passage, ils disposent d’une entrée d’une zone de désinfection et d’une sortie libre. 2. B-DESINF SAS modèle SDSA/170/3000 et modèle SDSA/110/1500 : à placer dans un passage, ils disposent d’une entrée, d’une zone de désinfection et d’une sortie contrôlée par verrou électronique. Autonome, écologique, efficace ,robuste et durable, le -DESINF contribue  à la lutte  des agents pathogènes (en particulier le COVID 19),  Il combine :  La désinfection des mains ; Le contrôle de température ; La désinfection des habits et chaussures et la prise en photo automatiques des individus à temperature anormale(option du système)

2550,c-34,Recyclage de pneus usagés en matériel de collecte de déchets,12/1/20,1/16/23,2,,,NER,2,assane.boukar@undp.org,Niger,"La structure Fortitude / REAGIS s'intéresse à la gestion des déchets à Niamey, et travaille étroitement avec les communautés et les acteurs en charge de la salubrité de la ville de Niamey pour mettre en œuvre des solutions concrètes à la prolifération des déchets dans la ville . Elle est à l'origine de la conception et de la réalisation de poubelles à partir de pneus recyclés. Faisant partie des plus gros déchets, régulièrement brûlés lorsqu'inutilisables, les pneus retrouvent une seconde vie : la structure les recycle essentiellement en poubelles, mais aussi en mobilier intérieur (poufs, tables...) et parfois même pour le remballage des nids de poule sur les voies goudronnées (qui sont dans ce cas plus solides qu'à travers la voie normale).",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/2817119a-f880-4b4e-97cc-103ae4a24a3b/bc835f611798045e0fc5e849c9a49b1f.jpeg,"Recyclage de pneus usagés en matériel de collecte de déchets

La structure Fortitude / REAGIS s'intéresse à la gestion des déchets à Niamey, et travaille étroitement avec les communautés et les acteurs en charge de la salubrité de la ville de Niamey pour mettre en œuvre des solutions concrètes à la prolifération des déchets dans la ville . Elle est à l'origine de la conception et de la réalisation de poubelles à partir de pneus recyclés. Faisant partie des plus gros déchets, régulièrement brûlés lorsqu'inutilisables, les pneus retrouvent une seconde vie : la structure les recycle essentiellement en poubelles, mais aussi en mobilier intérieur (poufs, tables...) et parfois même pour le remballage des nids de poule sur les voies goudronnées (qui sont dans ce cas plus solides qu'à travers la voie normale).

2540,c-28,Learning how to plant during lockdown,11/30/20,1/16/23,2,,55,MUS,2,ayooshee.dookhee@undp.org,Mauritius,"During the lockdown in Mauritius, a lot of people (including members of my family) had to learn how to plant (in case something bad happens which, fortunately, didn't happen). But, in the process, people who had never ever planted something learned about the different kids of soils, the use of fertilisers, the different kids of seeds, etc. This knowledge, in many cases, was passed to children.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/536a371a-d289-444b-91bf-652c3df3be38/7f895191d45ddecee8cb84887aed6810.jpg,"Learning how to plant during lockdown
TITLE: Please provide a title for the solution you observed.
Learning how to plant during lockdown
DESCRIPTION: What did you observe, or what did people write or say?

During the lockdown in Mauritius, a lot of people (including members of my family) had to learn how to plant (in case something bad happens which, fortunately, didn't happen). But, in the process, people who had never ever planted something learned about the different kids of soils, the use of fertilisers, the different kids of seeds, etc. This knowledge, in many cases, was passed to children.
PHOTO/ ILLUSTRATION: Please provide a photo or an illustration of what you observed.
NEED: What need does this answer?

The need, at the very least, to continue eating. Of course, someone who had never planted cannot aspire to quickly be in a position to become self-sustainable in terms of food but this is an important first step.
INSIGHTS: What lessons can be learned from this observation?
In situations of crisis, people need to innovate.

PHOTO/ ILLUSTRATION: Please provide a photo or an illustration of what you observed.

As a reminder, Mohamed Bah has a University degree and is still looking to the horizon to get a JoB.

2526,c-19,recycling ,11/29/20,1/16/23,2,,55,SEN,0,hassanatou.ba@live.fr,Senegal,"Waste pickers take recyclable materials in the historic Rebeuss district to provide low-cost hand made home appliances to city residents, restaurants or ""Dibiteries"" ( grilled meat restaurants). Rebeuss is a district in the heart of Dakar city center (Senegal).
They collect household appliance waste, more precisely fridge condensers, water heater blocks, Oil drum

and other aluminium or iron materials to recycle them into ovens, barbecues, stoves, pots and other kitchen accessories.  They can buy waste raw materials from households directely or re-sellers, or pick them from dumps.
For the confection, they do all the work of scraping, cutting, assembling and decorating....
These recovery products are very popular and are exhibited on some arteries of the city especially during civil and religious holidays.

Ibrahima Thiam is one of the waste pickers. He can produce up to 2 barbecues per day.  If he can sell 5 to 10 pieces per months, 10.000 Fcfa (20$ US) is the maximum benefit he can earn with a barbecue.

Prices from waste pickers vary from 15.000 Fcfa to 50.000 Fcfa (30$ - 100$ US) for barbecues depending on the size. In the other side and comparatively to those hand made appliances, in the same road big furniture stores are selling similar imported items  10 or 20 times more expensive : 50.000 cfa to 250.000 cfa (100$ – 500$ US).

Ibrahima emphasized that earnings are very low and working conditions are poor. Most of them lack basic services : water, electricity, or access to finance, markets and value chains. ",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/17b8a9c2-367a-460c-ab9f-73924208ab63/937de3e4867a3a0eb54f0c2c8b108d18.jpg,"recycling
TITLE: Please provide a title for the solution you observed.
Informal Waste Factory : Recycling Fridge condensers, water heater blocks and oil drum to produce barbecues, ovens, stoves, and other kitchen accessories.
DESCRIPTION: What did you observe, or what did people write or say?

Waste pickers take recyclable materials in the historic Rebeuss district to provide low-cost hand made home appliances to city residents, restaurants or ""Dibiteries"" ( grilled meat restaurants). Rebeuss is a district in the heart of Dakar city center (Senegal).
They collect household appliance waste, more precisely fridge condensers, water heater blocks, Oil drum

and other aluminium or iron materials to recycle them into ovens, barbecues, stoves, pots and other kitchen accessories.  They can buy waste raw materials from households directely or re-sellers, or pick them from dumps.
For the confection, they do all the work of scraping, cutting, assembling and decorating....
These recovery products are very popular and are exhibited on some arteries of the city especially during civil and religious holidays.

Ibrahima Thiam is one of the waste pickers. He can produce up to 2 barbecues per day.  If he can sell 5 to 10 pieces per months, 10.000 Fcfa (20$ US) is the maximum benefit he can earn with a barbecue.

Prices from waste pickers vary from 15.000 Fcfa to 50.000 Fcfa (30$ - 100$ US) for barbecues depending on the size. In the other side and comparatively to those hand made appliances, in the same road big furniture stores are selling similar imported items  10 or 20 times more expensive : 50.000 cfa to 250.000 cfa (100$ – 500$ US).
Ibrahima emphasized that earnings are very low and working conditions are poor. Most of them lack basic services : water, electricity, or access to finance, markets and value chains.
PHOTO/ ILLUSTRATION: Please provide a photo or an illustration of what you observed.
NEED: What need does this answer?
The demand for kitchen supplies at affordable cost without need of electricity or gas is very high.
Access to descent employment is also a vital need for waste recyclers.
Imported items are very expensive and not accessible to low incomes.
Lack of training, need for formalization, structuring, regularization, access to raw materials, support....
Access to finance, markets and value chains
Need to promote expertise and local production to foster exportations.
INSIGHTS: What lessons can be learned from this observation?
Waste pickers have developed competencies in producing equipments without any basic training.
They are providing a response to a strong demand.
General censuses of companies in Senegal found that almost 97% were informal (ANSD 2017).  ANSD : Agence Nationale de la Statistique et de la Démographie.
Earnings in the informal labor market are very low.

Working conditions are poor. Most of workers lack basic services: water, electricity, or access to finance, markets and value chains.  In the other hand, they escape tax obligations, labor market regulations, and other government interventions.
1. The need to create factories in this informal waste sector and ensure the supply of quality appliances.
2. Promote the integration of these informal artisans and the creation of a value chain.
3. Ensure Access to education/professional training and decent working conditions to promote sustainable production and development methods as well as inclusive and sustainable growth.
Top : Waste home appliances - fridge condensers, water heater blocks, Oil drum
The use of hand made barbecues by a Dibiterie in Medina ( District in Dakar Senegal)
Bottom : Imported home appliances exhibited in a furniture department store on the same road. (Rue de Reims Dakar - Senegal)

2524,c-28,Recycled,11/29/20,1/16/23,2,,55,MUS,2,ayooshee.dookhee@undp.org,Mauritius,"Walking around my locality, I observed that the trees of the taxi stand had been preserved and made into benches by the taxi drivers instead of being cut (like so many other taxi stands over the island). They wanted to preserve the environment and hence have transformed the trees into some sitting space as well as shade providers as they work through the day, especially during the hot summers over the island. Just a small note, there was also an area within the trees that they had transformed into a prayer spot for their work.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/536a371a-d289-444b-91bf-652c3df3be38/92ede65832d03142a5d673eb2c55e4bc.jpg,"Recycled
TITLE: Please provide a title for the solution you observed.
Preserving trees - shade and sitting area for taxi stand
DESCRIPTION: What did you observe, or what did people write or say?

Walking around my locality, I observed that the trees of the taxi stand had been preserved and made into benches by the taxi drivers instead of being cut (like so many other taxi stands over the island). They wanted to preserve the environment and hence have transformed the trees into some sitting space as well as shade providers as they work through the day, especially during the hot summers over the island. Just a small note, there was also an area within the trees that they had transformed into a prayer spot for their work.
PHOTO/ ILLUSTRATION: Please provide a photo or an illustration of what you observed.
NEED: What need does this answer?

Dry, heavy sunshine and droughts are affecting so many areas of the island. Trees are cut for development and most of the time no new trees are planted.  Therefore this observation of preservation of trees throughout development and enhancement of the locality is the perfect example that sustainable development of the locality, cleaner environment for the taxi drivers as well as the preservation of trees for shade making and sitting area can work together.
INSIGHTS: What lessons can be learned from this observation?

Development is possible, through the most sustainable way. Trees do not need to be cut down for development or settlement. Development and preservation of the environment can work together and this observation is the perfect example of the community commitment to sustainable development and preservation of the environment.

2415,c-34,AlloDocta-La santé au bout des doigts,11/18/20,1/16/23,2,,,NER,2,assane.boukar@undp.org,Niger,"La plateforme web mobile est un dispositif de boxes physiques au bénéfice des patients et des institutions sanitaires (clients). Elle permettra de prendre rendez-vous et d’effectuer des téléconsultations. Cette innovation s’inscrit dans le cadre de la gestion des consultations en milieu hospitalier et chez les professionnels de santé. La crise sanitaire du coronavirus (Covid-19) a mis en exergue les lacunes et les limites de notre système de santé. L'innovation répond à trois défis : 1) Salle d'attente saturée : respect des gestes barrières ; 2)Une médecine de contact ; 3) La couverture sanitaire : selon l’INS en 2016, au Niger il y a 20 955 habitants pour 1 médecin contre 10 000 selon les normes de l’OMS .",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/2817119a-f880-4b4e-97cc-103ae4a24a3b/9ab60827458063f274b78c78ad63ede8.png,"AlloDocta-La santé au bout des doigts

La plateforme web mobile est un dispositif de boxes physiques au bénéfice des patients et des institutions sanitaires (clients). Elle permettra de prendre rendez-vous et d’effectuer des téléconsultations. Cette innovation s’inscrit dans le cadre de la gestion des consultations en milieu hospitalier et chez les professionnels de santé. La crise sanitaire du coronavirus (Covid-19) a mis en exergue les lacunes et les limites de notre système de santé. L'innovation répond à trois défis : 1) Salle d'attente saturée : respect des gestes barrières ; 2)Une médecine de contact ; 3) La couverture sanitaire : selon l’INS en 2016, au Niger il y a 20 955 habitants pour 1 médecin contre 10 000 selon les normes de l’OMS .

C'est une innovations présentée au Coronahackaton organisé par l'AccLab-Niger et le CIPMEN (Centre Incubateur des PME au Niger).,https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/2817119a-f880-4b4e-97cc-103ae4a24a3b/2b6e32ca817c093d69c5a48c9e15aa61.png,"Sensibilisation virtuelle contre le COVID-19 à travers les jeux vidéos

Il s'agit de faire des campagnes de sensibilisation pour promouvoir la distanciation sociale dans la perspective de la lutte contre le COVID-19. C'est une innovations présentée au Coronahackaton organisé par l'AccLab-Niger et le CIPMEN (Centre Incubateur des PME au Niger).

Les publics cibles sont les jeunes et les adultes qui disposent d'un téléphone Android. C'est une innovation portée par un groupe de trois jeunes : - Chaibou Maikibi Nafissatou, Master Genie Logiciel ; -Maman Bachir, Maître Réseaux Informatiques ; -Harouna Dan Malam Samira, Maître Réseaux Informatique

1955,c-29,Sign-IO: Smart gloves that convert sign language into audio,10/21/20,1/16/23,2,,,KEN,2,victor.awuor@undp.org,Kenya,"Roy Allela, a 25-year-old engineering student invented smart gloves that he has named Sign-IO. The smart gloves auto-translate sign language into speech. The innovative student created the pair of gloves equipped with flex sensors in order to communicate with his niece who is deaf.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/25020757-2ff6-4a23-831d-54fa05d4d184/32d80fe8ea28b65e0772a0f220218176.jpg,"Sign-IO: Smart gloves that convert sign language into audio

Roy Allela, a 25-year-old engineering student invented smart gloves that he has named Sign-IO. The smart gloves auto-translate sign language into speech. The innovative student created the pair of gloves equipped with flex sensors in order to communicate with his niece who is deaf.

The smart gloves have flex sensors stitched on each finger. The sensors quantify the bend of the fingers and process the letter being signed. The gloves are then paired via Bluetooth to an app which vocalizes the letters. The gloves which can prove useful to over 30 million people across the world have an accuracy of 93 percent. The smart gloves can be customized into different superhero themes, thereby eliminating the stigma associated with deafness.

1792,c-24,Upcycling cans,10/11/20,1/16/23,2,,55,GNB,2,ana.dju@undp.org,Guinea-Bissau,"I met Sabado in Mercadu Bandim, the biggest informal market in Bissau, as she was collecting old cans we started a conversation. Sabado collects the cans from the general waste laying around on the street. When she has collected enough cans she is heating them up and remoulds them into pots that she sells on the market.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/bd928d4f-48da-4722-b9c9-c09c7caa26b8/b5d9a82bc77e0f5a96c78cf3d7e75032.jpg,"Upcycling cans
DESCRIPTION: What did you observe, or what did people write or say?

I met Sabado in Mercadu Bandim, the biggest informal market in Bissau, as she was collecting old cans we started a conversation. Sabado collects the cans from the general waste laying around on the street. When she has collected enough cans she is heating them up and remoulds them into pots that she sells on the market.
PHOTO/ ILLUSTRATION: Please provide a photo or an illustration of what you observed.
NEED: What need does this answer?

There is a need for job opportunities in Guinea-Bissau. Sabado creates her own job opportunity as she takes cans that people have thrown on the ground and process them into something valuable that she can sell so economically sustain herself and her family, an interesting example of up-cykling. At the same time she takes an action agains the lacking waste management system in Bissau, contributing to a cleaner environment.
INSIGHTS: What lessons can be learned from this observation?
Up-cykling has potential for women employment in Bissau.

I did not have to go too far to observe people crowding at the corner of the main street nearby my home. Day workers rushing toward cars and incomers to offer their services, which vary with respect to their skills (construction, plumbers...etc.). One factor in common they have is that every day is an absolute struggle to put food on the table for their families.

I approached a group of workers and asked what their main issues were and how to make their work pursuit better. The answers were several but a common one was SPEEDING UP the matching process. In fact, the matching between the customers seeking workers and the day laborers is hard to establish. This is mainly due to the information asymmetry, some workers pretending they have sets of skills they don’t in desperately attempting to match the customers offers (This leads the confidence of customers to deteriorate) ...etc.

I immediately considered a matching solution. How about an electronic platform or an application that acts as a labor market maker for less skilled workers (in reference to financial market makers which match bids and asks)? This will tremendously speed up the recruitment process cycles making the workers to benefit more from it.

Excited about the idea, I sought to verify its originality and if anyone else came up with such a solution in advance. For doing so, I engaged in online research, social media and exploited some personal connections for that purpose. And the answer was YES! A group of young researchers came up with a very similar idea to address the problem of crowding of less-skilled workers. Their perception comprises a speeding up solution to the matching process through an application they are trying to develop.
The young researchers were interested in developing the application, however, they blame the lack of financial means to pursue their goals.
,https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/7b1746c1-d864-4c73-bffa-85dafb1876ec/08d317d7ca6cc16552a90d89f439fc63.png,E-Labor Market Maker for Less Skilled Workers
TITLE: Please provide a title for the solution you observed.
e-Labor Market Maker for Less Skilled Workers
DESCRIPTION: What did you observe, or what did people write or say?

I did not have to go too far to observe people crowding at the corner of the main street nearby my home. Day workers rushing toward cars and incomers to offer their services, which vary with respect to their skills (construction, plumbers...etc.). One factor in common they have is that every day is an absolute struggle to put food on the table for their families.

I approached a group of workers and asked what their main issues were and how to make their work pursuit better. The answers were several but a common one was SPEEDING UP the matching process. In fact, the matching between the customers seeking workers and the day laborers is hard to establish. This is mainly due to the information asymmetry, some workers pretending they have sets of skills they don’t in desperately attempting to match the customers offers (This leads the confidence of customers to deteriorate) ...etc.

I immediately considered a matching solution. How about an electronic platform or an application that acts as a labor market maker for less skilled workers (in reference to financial market makers which match bids and asks)? This will tremendously speed up the recruitment process cycles making the workers to benefit more from it.

Excited about the idea, I sought to verify its originality and if anyone else came up with such a solution in advance. For doing so, I engaged in online research, social media and exploited some personal connections for that purpose. And the answer was YES! A group of young researchers came up with a very similar idea to address the problem of crowding of less-skilled workers. Their perception comprises a speeding up solution to the matching process through an application they are trying to develop.
The young researchers were interested in developing the application, however, they blame the lack of financial means to pursue their goals.
PHOTO/ ILLUSTRATION: Please provide a photo or an illustration of what you observed.
NEED: What need does this answer?
The needs answered by the solution can be listed as follow:
Clearing up or lowering the crowding in the main streets of the city.
Reducing the intensity of traffic congestion.
Benefiting workers with low income and skills (SDGs 1 and 2).
Reducing the risk of contracting the covid-19 among workers.
INSIGHTS: What lessons can be learned from this observation?

A main lesson can be learned from this observation. That is, well designed and tailored local solution can have a substantial impact on people’s livelihood. The impact of local solutions on SDGs targets can have an amplified effect through the dynamic nature of learning and solving at smaller scales. This is particularly true when it comes to jobs creation for the pool of less skilled workers, where the effect on the wellbeing of the poorest laborers can be felt considerably.

1779,c-9,Using hides and skins as a business venture to maintain tradition “Lekshat”,10/11/20,1/16/23,2,,55,MRT,2,lalla.aicha@undp.org,Mauritania,"Mauritanians eat a lot of meat. Animals are either slaughtered at home or at a slaughter house. The hides and skins of these animals are normally left to perish which causes a lot of pollution. Since a local market for raw hides and skins hardly exists in Mauritania, some groups of people are using these hides and skins to make local traditional products. The most prominent locally produced product from hides is the “Lekshat”. Lekshat is a local traditional leather belt used by men in Mauritania to tie the Sirwal (aerated baggy pant).  The “Sirwal” goes with the Moorish boubou or Drâa which is a kind of long sheet with a hole in order to let the passage of the head, with two large opened sleeves in each side. In summer time, when it is very hot, sleeves can be rolled up until shoulders. Pockets are sewed in each side to allow men to put their personal effects in. Boubou can be worn on top of a “Sirwal”. The “Lekshat” and Sirwal is a long standing traditional dress by men in Mauritania.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/7b1746c1-d864-4c73-bffa-85dafb1876ec/5a1906de0dcb1ff36aac17b3d0f0a969.jpg,"Using hides and skins as a business venture to maintain tradition “Lekshat”
DESCRIPTION: What did you observe, or what did people write or say?

Mauritanians eat a lot of meat. Animals are either slaughtered at home or at a slaughter house. The hides and skins of these animals are normally left to perish which causes a lot of pollution. Since a local market for raw hides and skins hardly exists in Mauritania, some groups of people are using these hides and skins to make local traditional products. The most prominent locally produced product from hides is the “Lekshat”. Lekshat is a local traditional leather belt used by men in Mauritania to tie the Sirwal (aerated baggy pant).  The “Sirwal” goes with the Moorish boubou or Drâa which is a kind of long sheet with a hole in order to let the passage of the head, with two large opened sleeves in each side. In summer time, when it is very hot, sleeves can be rolled up until shoulders. Pockets are sewed in each side to allow men to put their personal effects in. Boubou can be worn on top of a “Sirwal”. The “Lekshat” and Sirwal is a long standing traditional dress by men in Mauritania.
PHOTO/ ILLUSTRATION: Please provide a photo or an illustration of what you observed.
NEED: What need does this answer?

This helps to ameliorate situations where people have nothing meaningful to engage in within their communities, by creating opportunities through the utilization of available unwanted resources in the community such as animal hides and skins. It helps to foster a safer and more prosperous country where people are seen as active player in moving their own developmental plans forward in partnership with like-minds. It’s also, a source of livelihood and empowerment from community waste.
INSIGHTS: What lessons can be learned from this observation?

There is greater socio-economic potential in the hides and skins value chain that could be exploited by establishing a modern production enterprise and take advantage of the opportunity. Leather is probably the most ancient fabric used by humans, and it’s a multi-billion dollar global industry. Demand for leather goods is growing but so is criticism of its severe environmental impact, which is driving a keen interest in sustainable alternatives.

1768,c-27,La tech au service du respect de la distanciation physique,10/9/20,1/16/23,2,,,BEN,2,georges.bessan.kakpo@undp.org,Benin,"La distanciation physique d’au moins un mètre entre les personnes est l’une des principales mesures barrières recommandées

dans le cadre de la lutte contre la propagation de la Covid-19. Mais le respect de cette mesure s’avère parfois difficile, car dans la culture africaine et celle béninoise en particulier, les populations sont habituées à vivre en communauté avec des relations sociales très étroites : une tendance à aller saluer la famille, les malades, à manger ensemble dans le même plat, à participer à des réjouissances (mariage, baptême, etc.) ou à des cérémonies funéraires. Dans un tel contexte, le respect de la distanciation  physique reste un défi en dépit des sensibilisations.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/356b009b-65e9-49de-8d20-cf51d497aee4/7bd15b6696bab70f62323731ae2254ef.jpg,"La tech au service du respect de la distanciation physique
La distanciation physique d’au moins un mètre entre les personnes est l’une des principales mesures barrières recommandées

dans le cadre de la lutte contre la propagation de la Covid-19. Mais le respect de cette mesure s’avère parfois difficile, car dans la culture africaine et celle béninoise en particulier, les populations sont habituées à vivre en communauté avec des relations sociales très étroites : une tendance à aller saluer la famille, les malades, à manger ensemble dans le même plat, à participer à des réjouissances (mariage, baptême, etc.) ou à des cérémonies funéraires. Dans un tel contexte, le respect de la distanciation  physique reste un défi en dépit des sensibilisations.

Le Laboratoire d’Accélération du PNUD a collaboré avec une start-up béninoise pour développer une solution peu onéreuse, inclusive et à la portée de tout détenteur d’un téléphone portable. Il s’agit d’une application fonctionnant avec la technologie Bluetooth dénommée « Stop Covid-19 », qui comprend des modules distincts. En effet, via la technologie Bluetooth, elle permet de déterminer de façon précise si deux ou plusieurs personnes ne respectent pas la mesure de distanciation physique (rester à au moins 1 mètre de distance les uns des autres) et génère automatiquement des alertes sur leurs téléphones via des notifications claires (sonores et sms) leur indiquant le non-respect de cette mesure dans des langues de leur choix dont des langues nationales parlées dans diverses parties du pays.

Ainsi, en cas de non-respect de la distanciation physique, l’alerte sonore suivante se déclenche sur le téléphone portable : « Attention ! Veuillez reculer ! ». Le message d’alerte est selon le choix de l'utilisateur, en français, ou en anglais ou en langue locale jusqu’à ce que l’intéressé prenne ses distances.  Dès que l’on se retrouve à au moins un mètre d’un autre individu, le message vocal suivant résonne : « Merci, vous êtes à une distance raisonnable ! ».
Par ailleurs, l’application est associée à une plateforme web accessible de façon sécurisée fournissant en temps réel

l’historique des individus avec lesquels une personne est rentrée en contact (restée à moins d’un mètre). Aussi, est-elle également dotée d’un moteur central pouvant fournir des statistiques et, en cas de besoin, l’historique de toutes les personnes susceptibles d’avoir été contaminées par une personne testée positive à la Covid-19, pendant une période donnée parce n’ayant pas
Les alertes sonores fonctionnent indépendamment de la plateforme et du moteur de recherche qui pourraient être utilisés pour

l’identification et le traçage des cas déclarés au cas où le Gouvernement en décidait. Toutes les données collectées par l’application seraient le cas échéant conservées sur un serveur du Gouvernement. En perspective, elle pourra
être utilisée pour gérer toute autre épidémie/pandémie au Bénin.

1767,c-27,Le lave-main automatique : une solution efficace pour lutter contre la propagation du COVID-19,10/9/20,1/16/23,2,,,BEN,2,georges.bessan.kakpo@undp.org,Benin,"
Le Laboratoire d’Accélération du PNUD Bénin (AccLab/Bénin) a fait une série de constats :

- L’utilisation des dispositifs mécaniques de lave-main nécessite, pour les enfants de moins de 8 ans, les personnes  âgées, les malades et les femmes enceintes à l’entrée des centres de santé, l’assistance d’une  autre personne conduisant ainsi au non respect de la distanciation physique d'un mètre ;
- Les dispositifs de lave-main existants nécessitent un contact physique avec des objets ; ce qui constitue une source potentielle de contamination ;
- Le non respect des recommandations en vigueur pour le lavage des mains;
- Le gaspillage de l’eau pour le rinçage des mains.

A la recherche de solutions adéquates à ces problèmes, le Laboratoire d'Accélération du PNUD a travaillé avec les chercheurs de l'Ecole Polytechnique d'Abomey-Calavi (EPAC) pour réaliser des lave-mains hybrides, automatiques améliorés.

Il s’agit d’un lave-main mobile, automatique interactif hybride (fonctionnel avec le courant conventionnel ou l'énergie solaire)  pour les enfants, les aveugles, les handicapés moteurs, les femmes enceintes les malades et les personnes en bonne santé.  Ces lave mains automatiques interagissent avec les utilisateurs dans la langue choisie (Français, Anglais, langues locales). Ils permettent non seulement de se laver les mains, suivant les recommandations en la matière, sans fournir d’efforts physiques par l’appui d’une quelconque « pédale », mais aussi d’éviter le gaspillage d’eau et de savon, sans aucun risque de contamination, car ne nécessitant pas de contact physique.

,https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/356b009b-65e9-49de-8d20-cf51d497aee4/38c398d9d5da297db7ea3c05768d0ac2.jpeg,Le lave-main automatique : une solution efficace pour lutter contre la propagation du COVID-19
Le Laboratoire d’Accélération du PNUD Bénin (AccLab/Bénin) a fait une série de constats :

- L’utilisation des dispositifs mécaniques de lave-main nécessite, pour les enfants de moins de 8 ans, les personnes  âgées, les malades et les femmes enceintes à l’entrée des centres de santé, l’assistance d’une  autre personne conduisant ainsi au non respect de la distanciation physique d'un mètre ;
- Les dispositifs de lave-main existants nécessitent un contact physique avec des objets ; ce qui constitue une source potentielle de contamination ;
- Le non respect des recommandations en vigueur pour le lavage des mains;
- Le gaspillage de l’eau pour le rinçage des mains.

A la recherche de solutions adéquates à ces problèmes, le Laboratoire d'Accélération du PNUD a travaillé avec les chercheurs de l'Ecole Polytechnique d'Abomey-Calavi (EPAC) pour réaliser des lave-mains hybrides, automatiques améliorés.

Il s’agit d’un lave-main mobile, automatique interactif hybride (fonctionnel avec le courant conventionnel ou l'énergie solaire)  pour les enfants, les aveugles, les handicapés moteurs, les femmes enceintes les malades et les personnes en bonne santé.  Ces lave mains automatiques interagissent avec les utilisateurs dans la langue choisie (Français, Anglais, langues locales). Ils permettent non seulement de se laver les mains, suivant les recommandations en la matière, sans fournir d’efforts physiques par l’appui d’une quelconque « pédale », mais aussi d’éviter le gaspillage d’eau et de savon, sans aucun risque de contamination, car ne nécessitant pas de contact physique.

1766,c-27,Cabine de désinfection contre la Covid-19 pour plus de sécurité sur les lieux publics au Bénin,10/9/20,1/16/23,2,,,BEN,2,georges.bessan.kakpo@undp.org,Benin,"Cette cabine hybride automatique de désinfection a été conçue grâce à la collaboration entre les chercheurs du Laboratoire de Physique de Rayonnement (LPR) de la Faculté des sciences et Techniques (FAST) de l’Université d’Abomey-Calavi (UAC) et le Laboratoire d’accélération du Programme des Nations Unies pour le développement (PNUD). C’est une cabine à portique automatique hybride (fonctionnant avec le courant conventionnel ou l'énergie solaire) dotée d'un thermomètre infrarouge prenant la température

corporelle des usagers avant de procéder à la désinfection des surfaces de leur habillement avec des jets de vapeur d'eau hydrolysée ou chlorée. Au cas où leur température est supérieure ou égale à 38°C, une alerte sonore les invite dans la langue choisie (Français, Anglais, langues locales) à se rapprocher d'un agent de santé avant l'ouverture des portiques pour subir la désinfection. Elle permet outre la CoVID-19, de protéger les populations contre les épidémies de grippe.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/356b009b-65e9-49de-8d20-cf51d497aee4/c60d285c967d7fea77f901457a5d9635.jpeg,"Cabine de désinfection contre la Covid-19 pour plus de sécurité sur les lieux publics au Bénin

Cette cabine hybride automatique de désinfection a été conçue grâce à la collaboration entre les chercheurs du Laboratoire de Physique de Rayonnement (LPR) de la Faculté des sciences et Techniques (FAST) de l’Université d’Abomey-Calavi (UAC) et le Laboratoire d’accélération du Programme des Nations Unies pour le développement (PNUD). C’est une cabine à portique automatique hybride (fonctionnant avec le courant conventionnel ou l'énergie solaire) dotée d'un thermomètre infrarouge prenant la température

corporelle des usagers avant de procéder à la désinfection des surfaces de leur habillement avec des jets de vapeur d'eau hydrolysée ou chlorée. Au cas où leur température est supérieure ou égale à 38°C, une alerte sonore les invite dans la langue choisie (Français, Anglais, langues locales) à se rapprocher d'un agent de santé avant l'ouverture des portiques pour subir la désinfection. Elle permet outre la CoVID-19, de protéger les populations contre les épidémies de grippe.

1755,c-17,Le Système Hawk par les drones pour une agriculture de précision,10/8/20,1/16/23,2,,,BFA,2,abdoulaye.ouedraogo@undp.org,Burkina Faso,"DESCRIPTION DE LA SOLUTION : Le drone dénommé « Hawk » est fabriqué au Burkina Faso en vue d’aider à la prise de décision pour une agriculture de précision. Ce drone permet de collecter des images des cultures et de les traiter afin d’identifier d’éventuels problèmes rencontrées par les plantes et ce, en collaboration avec les ingénieurs agricoles.",https://acclabplatforms.blob.core.windows.net/solutions-mapping/uploads/sm/e7e2a7be-5a45-4669-83f5-5539c538c020/46de3a8a9d23ac1d9722b814a710ebc7.jpg,"Le Système Hawk par les drones pour une agriculture de précision

DESCRIPTION DE LA SOLUTION : Le drone dénommé « Hawk » est fabriqué au Burkina Faso en vue d’aider à la prise de décision pour une agriculture de précision. Ce drone permet de collecter des images des cultures et de les traiter afin d’identifier d’éventuels problèmes rencontrées par les plantes et ce, en collaboration avec les ingénieurs agricoles.

CARACTERES INNOVANTS : L’innovation du système est qu’il aide le producteur dans l’optimisation de l’utilisation des ressources naturelles et des intrants. Le système estime pour le producteur la quantité d’intrants nécessaire qu’il faut par endroit de son exploitation ainsi que pour l’ensemble, et cela en fonction des spéculations qui sont produites. Le système fournit également au producteur avec précision les endroits et les ressources naturelles de l’exploitation dont il peut se servir pour de meilleures productions et productivités. Les résultats sont quasi disponibles vingt à trente fois plus rapidement que par les méthodes
PROMOTEUR  : Faso Drone/Dr Yssouf Ouattara, ingénierie aéronautique, spatiale et intelligence artificielle

Wapek signifie « vient  laver », en langue mooré parlée au Burkina Faso. Wapek est un lave

main intelligent qui peut être alimenté au solaire, mais aussi à l’énergie électrique fournie par la société nationale d’électricité du Burkina Faso (SONABEL). Si Wapek a été conçu dans l’objectif de promouvoir l’hygiène et de combattre le coronavirus, il sert aussi à la lutte contre d’autres maladies liées à l’hygiène. Ce sont entre autres la diarrhée,le choléra, la dysenterie, etc.
Wapek signifie « vient  laver », en langue mooré parlée au Burkina Faso. Wapek est un lave

main intelligent qui peut être alimenté au solaire, mais aussi à l’énergie électrique fournie par la société nationale d’électricité du Burkina Faso (SONABEL). Si Wapek a été conçu dans l’objectif de promouvoir l’hygiène et de combattre le coronavirus, il sert aussi à la lutte contre d’autres maladies liées à l’hygiène. Ce sont entre autres la diarrhée,le choléra, la dysenterie, etc.

Caractères innovants de Wapek:•   Le système de lavage autonome WAPEK permet de laver les mains sans toucher physiquement le récipient et d’éviter des nids de contamination. Il comprend un capteur qui détecte la présence d’une main et déclenche la pompe à eau permettant à la personne de laver ses mains et interrompt la sortie d’eau en l’absence de la main.

•   Un autre avantage de ce dispositif est la maitrise de la quantité d’eau à utiliser. C’est une machine faite de telle sorte que l’eau soit utilisée en quantité contrôlée, ce qui permet donc de limiter le gaspillage de l’eau.
offre la double possibilité d’utilisation de l’énergie solaire mais aussi de l’énergie fournie par la SONABEL ;

•  Wakep permet de sécher les mains avec de l’air chaud produit par un des dispositifs intégrés au produit. Wapek dispose de deux réservoirs dont l’un pour l’eau propre et l’autre pour l’eau sale qui est recueillie et qui peut être utilisée dans l’arrosage des plantes étant donné que le savon utilisé à petite quantité n’est pas corrosif
Promoteur: Sandouidi Frédéric, Nignan Rachid et Bouda Yves
Avec la COVID-19, le lavage des mains s’est révélé primordial pour se protéger du virus. Cependant en Afrique, il est

souvent difficile de respecter ou suivre correctement les méthodes de lavage de mains comme le préconise l’OMS. En effet, une grande partie de la population et les structures de santé ne disposent pas d’outils ou d’instruments adéquats de

lavage de mains. Dans les habitudes de nombreuses communautés en Afrique, elles utilisent le même récipient (sceau, bouilloire, fût, etc.) pour se laver les mains. Ainsi, les parties de contact avec ces récipients constituent des nids

Aussi, après avoir lavé les mains au savon, les personnes sont souvent amenées à toucher encore des parties à fort risque de contamination. C’est pour pallier cette insuffisance et contribuer à la lutte contre la COVID-19, que Wapek a été concu.
Impact : L’impact de Wapek est de contribuer à assurer une bonne santé aux populations du Burkina Faso
